title: Entry Level Software Implementation Developer
description:
**About the role**


Their implementation department consists of approximately 100 people where most of the operations is positioned in Gothenburg. This team is responsible for configuring, delivering and supporting Jeppesen solutions for commercial airlines. It’s crucial that the solutions that they provide truly align with their customer´s needs.


Together with your skilled team of specialists you´ll solve complex optimization challenges where the best way forward is to learn from each other and continuously improve your way of working.


In this team you will play an important role in delivering tailored solutions to Jeppesen's clients and you will work closely with their clients to gain a deep understanding of their requirements and business objectives. You will be working in an agile environment to ensure a smooth implementation and development process.


**Example of work** **tasks:**

* Translate client needs into clear and technical specifications
* Configure and customize their industry-leading crew planning software using Rave (their proprietary rule-based modeling language) and Python
* Pair programming to share knowledge with colleagues
* Apply a test-driven development approach to ensure high quality solutions
* Make sure that the solutions align with both client requirements and industry’s best practices
* Present and explain design decisions and technical solutions clearly and confidently to clients
* Foster a strong long-term relationship with clients

**Qualifications**


We seek individuals who are passionate about learning the airline business and possess an analytical mindset and a structured approach to problem solving. You are a great communicator and likes to work with both individual task and in team constellations but most importantly you are curious and eager to learn new skills!


* Recent graduated with a Bachelor’s or Master´s degree in a relevant area
* Programming skills in Python
* Comfortable working in a Linux environment
* Strong communication skills in English

It´s a great bonus if you have any background within optimization and understanding of modeling concepts.  



  

**About Jeppesen**
  

One third of the pilots and cabin crew worldwide are flying with schedules produced by Jeppesen's innovative solutions. One million pilots use their navigation products, and every day some 70,000 routes around the world are planned with the help of Jeppesen. They are solving some of the hardest combinatorial optimization problems you can imagine, in one of the most exciting and dynamic industries you can find.


At Jeppesen in Göteborg, over 400 employees from over 50 countries develop, implement and support cutting-edge resource optimization systems for airlines and railways. Jeppesen's crew planning and optimization product lines are mainly developed in Gothenburg. Jeppesen has more than 3500 employees worldwide and is a subsidiary of Boeing.
  

  

**About the talent program**
  

  

**Who are you?**
  

We are looking for individuals who are driven, curious, and have a passion for learning and solving complex problems. You are a technical enthusiast and would love to further explore your critical thinking, logical reasoning, and creativity in your daily work. You thrive in a social and communicative environment and long for a workplace with talented engineers who prioritize teamwork and believe that magic happens when great minds work together.


**The program**
  

These positions are a part of the Earn Your Wings talent program which is a collaboration between Hubbau and Jeppesen. During the yearly talent program, you will be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant in your specific role at Jeppesen. After that, the ambition is that your journey instead turns into employment directly at Jeppesen. Our goal is for you to have a fun and rewarding first year where you will be equipped with the best conditions for the future at Jeppesen and your professional life.
  

  

**The cherry on top**
  

During the year, you'll expand your network and skills through dedicated training days. These sessions cover both technical and soft skills, helping you develop problem-solving techniques and see failure as part of the learning process. At Jeppesen, curiosity, creativity, and the courage to challenge ideas are highly valued, equipping you with the mindset and tools to approach technical challenges in new ways. On top of that, you’ll become part of a strong community, enjoying plenty of fun activities and social events throughout the year.
  

  

**Other information**


We are looking for six individuals for this role and the talent program starts on the first of September 2025 (2025-09-01).  

These positions are full-time employment located at Jeppesen's office in central Gothenburg. We practice ongoing selection, so do not hesitate to express your interest.

title: Entry Level Cloud Developer
description:
**About the role**


We are looking for a Junior Cloud Developer to join the Optimization as a Service (OaaS) team within the Software Engineering & Advanced Technology department. This cross-functional team of talented engineers is leading the transition towards cloud-native solutions, as Jeppesen now transitions their products from on-prem to the AWS cloud. This role involves close collaboration with multiple teams, therefore we are looking for you who is outgoing, enjoys helping others, and really thrives in a team environment.
  

  

You will work in a technology stack designed for modern cloud-native development, embracing a DevOps culture with continuous integration, delivery, and deployment. Examples of the technologies you will work with are GitOps, AWS services, Kubernetes, OpenTelemetry, and more.  

  



**Some responsibilities for the team**

* Develop cloud-based services to support Jeppesen’s Planning Solutions product
* Enhance deployment infrastructure and security
* Build tools and applications to improve customer interaction
* Support the transition to a cloud-based infrastructure

Collaborate with teams across Software Development, Support, Sales, and Customer Solutions to define and shape the SaaS product  

* 

  

**Qualifications**

* Recent graduate with a bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field
* Strong interest in cloud development and modern software engineering
* Proficiency in programming, preferably in Python
* Basic Linux knowledge

Fluent in English  

* 

  

**Bonus skills**


* Experience working with AWS, Terraform, and microservices architecture
* Interest/knowledge of cloud security

**About Jeppesen**
  

One third of the pilots and cabin crew worldwide are flying with schedules produced by Jeppesen's innovative solutions. One million pilots use their navigation products, and every day some 70,000 routes around the world are planned with the help of Jeppesen. At Jeppesen in Göteborg, over 400 employees from over 50 countries develop, implement and support cutting-edge resource optimization systems for airlines and railways. Jeppesen's crew planning and optimization product lines are mainly developed in Gothenburg. Jeppesen has more than 3500 employees worldwide and is a subsidiary of Boeing.
  

  

**About the talent program**
  

  

**Who are you?**
  

We are looking for individuals who are driven, curious, and have a passion for learning and solving complex problems. You are a technical enthusiast and would love to further explore your critical thinking, logical reasoning, and creativity in your daily work. You thrive in a social and communicative environment and long for a workplace with talented engineers who prioritize teamwork and believe that magic happens when great minds work together.


**The program**
  

These positions are a part of the Earn Your Wings talent program which is a collaboration between Hubbau and Jeppesen. During the yearly talent program, you will be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant in your specific role at Jeppesen. After that, the ambition is that your journey instead turns into employment directly at Jeppesen. Our goal is for you to have a fun and rewarding first year where you will be equipped with the best conditions for the future at Jeppesen and your professional life.
  

  

**The cherry on top**
  

During the year, you'll expand your network and skills through dedicated training days. These sessions cover both technical and soft skills, helping you develop problem-solving techniques and see failure as part of the learning process. At Jeppesen, curiosity, creativity, and the courage to challenge ideas are highly valued, equipping you with the mindset and tools to approach technical challenges in new ways. On top of that, you’ll become part of a strong community, enjoying plenty of fun activities and social events throughout the year.  



**Other information**  

The talent program starts on the first of September 2025 (2025-09-01).
  

This position is a full-time employment located at Jeppesen's office in central Gothenburg. We practice ongoing selection, so do not hesitate to express your interest.

title: Junior mjukvaruutvecklare med C# och .NET sökes!
description:
Vi söker en junior mjukvaruutvecklare till ett ledande företag inom videoövervakning. Du kommer att vara en del av ett engagerat utvecklingsteam som arbetar med att skapa banbrytande lösningar för både desktop- och mobilplattformar.

Låter det intressant? Vänta in med att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare med ett intresse för att arbeta med HIL
description:
Vill du arbeta som konsult, i ett spännande uppdrag som mjukvaruutvecklare inom fordonsindustrin?

*Med en lång erfarenhet inom branschen så har vi hittat vår grund som vi tror på och som vi utgår ifrån när vi bygger upp Nexer Mobility tillsammans med våra medarbetare. I vårt dagliga arbete är du som individ i fokus då vi utgår från varje medarbetares utgångspunkt och förutsättning. Hur vi arbetar, kommer vi att berätta mer om när vi träffas.*

**Om rollen**


Rollen innebär ett konsultuppdrag och arbete hos någon av våra kunder i Göteborg, inom automotive. I rollen **kan** arbetsuppgifterna bland annat handla om att...

* arbeta med mjukvaruutveckling nära HIL-riggar och fordon.
* felsökning, testning och planering för användning av testriggar.

  

Vi erbjuder ett brett utbud av uppdrag och därför kan arbetets karaktär variera. Gemensamt för alla uppdrag är att de är långsiktiga, kvalificerade och utmanande, samtidigt som du garanterat har roligt på jobbet! Vi utgår alltid från dig som person och dina intressen.

 **Det är meriterande om du som söker har något av följande**

* Minst en kandidatexamen inom elektroteknik, datateknik eller likvärdig utbildning.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i Python
* Erfarenhet/Intresse för att arbeta med HIL riggar
* Erfarenhet och kunskap inom Docker och Kubernetes
* Ett intresse för mjukvaruutveckling i allmänhet och att du trivs med att arbeta nära fordon.
* En god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.

**Ansökan**


Du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan nedan. Tyvärr kan vi inte ta emot ansökningar via e-post, men har du frågor så är du välkommen att kontakta Johanna Rydén på johanna.ryden@nexergroup.com.

**Nexer som arbetsgivare**


Jobbar du på Nexer får du en modig och entreprenörsdriven arbetsgivare med internationell närvaro. Vi är stolta över att leda den digitala revolutionen och vara i teknikens framkant, alltid med ett agilt och framåtlutat förhållningssätt. Här får du unika möjligheter att drömma stort, agera smart och utvecklas. Vi är ett familjeägt bolag med långsiktiga strategier, vilket innebär att du är nära de som fattar beslut och kan vara med och påverka. Dessutom erbjuder vi en flexibel arbetspolicy, där det finns möjlighet att arbeta på distans när det passar dig och ditt uppdrag.

**Vår kultur**


Vår vision är Promising future – det är viktigt för oss att göra skillnad och bidra till en bättre framtid. Vi har ett engagemang för våra kunder och en uppriktig omtanke om varandra. Vi omfamnar mångfald och tror att människor med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter gör vårt arbete och vårt företag bättre. Vi värdesätter innovation och viljan att utvecklas och ta nästa steg – framåt och uppåt. Dessutom har vi roligt på jobbet!


#LI-LB2

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**

**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**


Do you want to help build the future of customer experiences? We are looking for a driven and dedicated **Senior** **Fullstack Engineer** to strengthen our Insurance team. With us, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting and challenging projects in a fast-growing and innovative environment.

**About the Role**
------------------


As a Senior Fullstack Engineer, you will play a key role in the development and maintenance of our customer-facing applications and mission-critical backend services. You will work in a cross-functional team within a multi-product organization, where you will contribute to creating scalable and robust solutions for both the frontend and backend.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------


In the position you will design, develop, and maintain customer-facing applications and mission-critical backend services. You will collaborate within a cross-functional team in a multi-product organization to build and maintain scalable and resilient frontend and backend solutions. Ensuring the performance and accessibility of our customer-facing products, you'll work with component libraries, adhere to brand guidelines, and conduct A/B testing and experimentation to optimize user experience.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Must-Have:**

* Solid experience with JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, Node.js, and React.
* Experience building and maintaining mission-critical backend APIs.
* Experience developing customer-facing products with a focus on performance and accessibility.
* Experience working with cloud-hosted applications and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience managing complex state management in React/Redux.
* Experience with MySQL and MongoDB.

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience in React Native.
* Experience in Next.js.
* Eye for design and UX.
* Experience in AWS.
* Experience contributing to design systems.
* Experience with tracking user events.
* Experience running A/B tests.
* Experience from fintech or insurance focused businesses.
* 

**What we offer:**

* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.

  

We have an office-first policy on a monthly basis to promote a balance between physical collaboration and flexibility, while the remote days can be spent anywhere in the world.


Please note!
  

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Frontend utvecklare
description:
I rollen som mjukvaruutvecklare hos vår kund får du inte bara chansen att arbeta med banbrytande teknik, utan även uppleva spännande och exotiska destinationer.

**Om företaget:**


Vår kund är ett ledande teknikkonsultbolag som arbetar genom hela utvecklingscykeln – från systemering, arkitektur och design till implementation och verifiering. Här kombineras djup teknisk expertis med glädje och en trivsam arbetsmiljö. Företaget verkar globalt med huvudkontor i Sverige och spelar en avgörande roll i att stärka flera nationers försvarsförmåga. Som konsult får du möjlighet att arbeta inom olika branscher som industri, försvar, medtech, fordon och telekom.


Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Futuria People men du kommer anställas direkt hos kund.

 **Om rollen:**


Som mjukvaruutvecklare kommer du att fokusera på front-end utveckling för en AI-driven databas och en dynamisk radarplattform. Du kommer även att vara en del av ett internationellt team och resa på påkostade, roliga tjänsteresor ungefär en vecka varannan månad – en fantastisk möjlighet att kombinera arbete med äventyr!

  

Programmeringen sker främst i **Python, React, Golang**, och i en Linux-miljö med Kubernetes, och du kommer att vara delaktig i hela utvecklingsprocessen – från planering till leverans och problemlösning.

**Du erbjuds:**

* **Spännande projekt**: Arbeta i ett brett spektrum av branscher och teknologier, där du får bidra till hållbara och säkra lösningar.
* **Internationella resor**: Varje månad får du chansen att resa till inspirerande platser, vilket gör att du får både variation och nya perspektiv på arbetet.
* **Skräddarsydda roller**: Din roll anpassas efter dina intressen, kunskaper och karriärmål, tack vare företagets stora och varierande kundbas.
* **Karriärutveckling**: Möjlighet att utvecklas till en teamledarroll eller andra avancerade positioner när du är redo för nästa steg.
* **Hållbar arbetsmiljö**: Ett företag som värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv, där långsiktig utveckling och välmående prioriteras.

**Vi söker dig som:**


För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är en lagspelare som motiveras av att lösa problem tillsammans med andra. Du har en analytisk förmåga och ett starkt fokus på kvalitet i arbetet. Du är även positivt inställd till att resa och ser det som en fördel att arbeta i internationella sammanhang.

* **Erfarenhet** av programmering i något/några av programmeringsspråken **React, Golang samt Kubernetes**.
* **Akademisk examen** inom Data, Elektro, Mekatronik, Systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Behärskar **svenska och engelska** obehindrat i tal och skrift.
* **Svenskt medborgarskap** är ett krav.
* Positiv inställning till **tjänsteresor** och att arbeta internationellt.

**Övrig information**

* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
* Omfattning: Heltid
* Placering: Göteborg
* Eventuella frågor besvaras av rekryteringskonsult Ebba Strömberg:
* ebba.stromberg@futuriapeople.se


Passar det här in på dig eller känner du någon som skulle passa bättre för jobbet? - Tipsa gärna!


Intervjuer sker löpande, välkommen med din ansökan idag!

***Futuria People*** *är rekryteringsföretaget som hjälper individer att ta nästa steg i sin karriär och företag att attrahera nya medarbetare. Genom uppsökande rekrytering och kvalitativ annonsering har vi hjälpt hundratals kandidater till ett nytt jobb och en mer stimulerande vardag.*

title: Systemutvecklare ServiceNow
description:
**Företaget**  

Vår kund ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kultur, kollektivtrafik och regional utveckling i Västra Götaland. Kundens verksamheter leds av regiondirektören. Regiondirektörens uppdrag är att, tillsammans med Västra Götalandsregionens drygt 56 000 anställda, genomföra de politiska beslut som fattas av folkvalda politiker i styrelser och nämnder.


Vår kund arbetar för att du som bor i Västra Götaland har tillgång till god hälso- och sjukvård. Det gör de bland annat genom sjukhus, vårdcentraler och Folktandvården. De ansvarar för att det finns kollektivtrafik i hela Västra Götaland och äger Västtrafik. De driver egna kulturverksamheter som Göteborgsoperan, Göteborgs Symfoniker, Regionteater Väst och flera museer och ska också utveckla området Västra Götaland genom att bidra till att det finns utbildning, jobb och en bra fritid.  

  



**Om Koncernstab digitalisering (KSD)**  

Digitalisering och IT hos vår kund är inte som digitalisering och IT någon annanstans. De är en av Sveriges största organisationer inom området. De är runt 900 personer som arbetar med allt från strategi till support med ansvar för utveckling, arkitektur, IT-säkerhet, förvaltning, drift och support av IT-stöd för de olika verksamheterna. Vår kund strävar efter att alltid ligga i framkant när det gäller kompetens och teknik. Deras storlek och deras breda verksamhet gör att det finns unika möjligheter att utvecklas hos vår kund.  

  



Vår kund har spännande saker framför sig. Just nu digitaliserar de flödet i vården för att möta morgondagens utmaningar och möta invånarnas behov av vård på ett mer patientnära och effektivt sätt. De ska också utveckla nya sätt att använda data för att skapa värde för såväl patienter som medarbetare och göra den digitala arbetsmiljön bättre för de 56 000 medarbetarna. Samtidigt ser de till att deras IT-miljö fortsätter att rulla på stabilt och säkert.




Vår kund söker efter kvalificerade, engagerade och utvecklingsorienterade konsulter. Som en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare kan de erbjuda intressanta arbetsområden. Hos vår kund får du chansen att utföra ett meningsfullt arbete där du med dina insatser bidrar till vår kunds vision ”det goda livet”, samtidigt som du får ett intressant arbetsinnehåll.

 **Uppdraget:**  

Som Systemutvecklare inom ServiceNow (SN) ansvarar du för genomförande av systemutveckling och konfiguration inom Koncernstab digitaliserings (KSD) centrala plattform SN, som är kärnan i kundleveransen samt hur de arbetar internt. I din roll bidrar du med vidareutveckling av effektiva lösningar med SN-plattformen som verktyg.  

  



Du kommer att vara en viktig del av ett utvecklingsteam som förvaltar och utvecklar verktyget fö r behoven frå n verksamheten. Du kommer arbeta i teamet med en agil systemutvecklingsprocess och med mycket vä l fungerande planering och samarbete med vå ra kravstä llare. Du arbetar bland annat med att vidareutveckla funktionalitet fö r SN, utveckla anvä ndarvä nliga Serviceportaler och servicekataloger, workflows och integrerade flö den samt att utveckla externa integrationer med stö d av vå r integrationsplattform. I plattformen har de ITBM Module, ITOM Module, ITAM Modul och ITSM Module för att nämna några.

 **Bakgrund:**  

Plexus är en IT-tjänsteplattform som stödjer KSD uppdrag och totala leveransprocess, ett kärnsystem för verksamheten. Västra Götalandsregionen är en av SN:s kunder som ligger i framkant med användningen och systemets moduler i plattformen och har en av Sveriges största installationer. Med en snabb takt utvecklar vår kund plattformen och implementerar nya moduler. De behöver förstärka deras agila utvecklingsteam för att möta upp utvecklingsbehov av 5G-projekt och andra innovationsbehov.

 **Kompetensprofil:**  

Som person ser de att du har lätt för att kommunicera och kan omvandla önskemål till lösningar inom ramen för rollen. Du är strukturerad med gott ordningssinne och har god samarbetsförmåga, självgående och har ett gott bemötande.  

  



**Obligatoriska krav (ska):**

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta eller utveckla i HTML, CSS, JavaScript
* Du har minst 3 års erfarenhet som systemutvecklare i SN:s plattform
* Mycket god kunskap inom systemutveckling
* Mycket god erfarenhet att jobba inom stordrift av IT-miljö
* Mycket goda erfarenheter i att uttrycka sig i svenska i tal och skrift
* bör ha relevanta certifieringar inom SN.
* bör ha erfarenhet att arbeta inom politiskt styrda organisationer

bör ha minst 3 års erfarenhet i att arbeta i agila team  
* 

**Ansökningsförfarande**  

Tjänsten är ett 100% konsultuppdrag start2025-03-03 till 2026-02-27.

  

Vi tillämpar löpande urval så vänta inte med att söka. Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Elisa Herrmann på mejl elisa.herrmann@skill.se

title: Fullstack Web Developer - Help Us Build the Ultimate...
description:
**At Prisjakt, our mission is to empower consumers to make better decisions by providing a trustworthy and unbiased overview of the market. We're now looking for a talented Fullstack Web Developer to help us continue building the best price and product comparison service out there.**


Your vibe and tribe


As a Fullstack Web Developer at Prisjakt, you'll shape the core of our product, ensuring an excellent experience for our users. And here's the fun part: you won't be alone on this adventure. You'll be a part of an agile, cross-functional team with experts in backend, frontend, UX and more. Together, we tackle challenges and create solutions.


Experimenting/data


At Prisjakt, data is at the heart of everything we do. We're constantly experimenting and iterating based on insights from our large user base. You'll work in a dynamic environment where A/B testing and small releases allow us to quickly adapt and improve. With your teammates by your side, you'll learn from what didn't go as planned, adapt and celebrate together when you hit the sweet spot. What we'll end up with is epic functionality that our users love!

**What you´ll bring:**

* Strong experience with Node.js, TypeScript and GraphQL
* Experience of Next.js and a deep understanding of React
* Experience with continuous releases and agile development
* A problem-solving mindset with a passion for experimentation and collaboration
* Comfortable with pair programming

**Bonus points if you know:**

* GCP or other cloud services, MySQL, Microservices, Headless CMS

 *When*: We would like you to start tomorrow but we understand that you might have obligations today and those need to be handed over first.

*Where*: You will be located at our beautiful Malmö or Ängelholm studios.

*What we offer: The very core in our employee experience is to care for our employees. With us you have flexible hours and a hybrid way of working where we meet 3 days per week in the studio. You get two paid working hours each week dedicated to working out and you’re always off on your birthday. If you’re curious to know more about life at Prisjakt, our* *benefits* *or* *why we exist* *you should definitely explore our* *career site**. Want to meet the brilliant people and get a feel for the vibe at our studios? Make sure to follow us on Instagram @**Prisjaktlife**.*

title: System Developer with CI/CD and DevOps Expertise –...
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a**  

  

  

  

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**

**About VIPAS :**


Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

**Job Description:**


Are you an experienced system developer with strong CI/CD and DevOps skills? We are looking for a consultant for our client in Gothenburg for a long-term assignment where you will work with modern development methods and technologies in a dynamic environment.

 **Key Responsibilities:**


In this role, you will focus on developing and improving CI/CD processes as well as system development in a Linux-based environment. You will be an essential part of the team, contributing with your expertise in automation, scripting, and platform development. The assignment requires strong collaboration and communication skills, as you will work closely with both developers and operations teams.

Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathianantu@vipas.se


Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.

Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Entry Level Software Application Developer
description:
**About the role**

This team is a part of the software core platform organization at Jeppesen and are developing their product that handles crew planning and crew schedules. This product is used by Jeppesen’s clients to maximize the efficiency of their crew scheduling and improve the work-life balance of their staff.


The team builds features in a Full Stack capacity ranging from AngularJS to Java/Python backend as well as deployment using Docker, Kubernetes and AWS Cloud. They collaborate closely with implementation teams at Jeppesen that work directly with clients and build and ship features that directly impact their operations.


You will be part of a diverse team with both experienced and early-career colleagues, where a strong team culture is key. Mondays and Tuesdays are designated team days at the office, and every third week, the team holds a planning session for the coming weeks. Since they work closely with clients, digital meetings are common, but they also meet in person for workshops when needed.


Depending on the candidate, the role could focus on either backend or frontend development. If you also have an interest in UI, it is certainly welcome.


**Example of work tasks**

* Programming
* Participate in code reviews
* Participate in daily standups and other planning activities
* Collaborating with your team members as well as other internal Jeppesen teams

**Qualifications**


We think that you are curious and motivated to make a difference. You should be comfortable working with others and enjoy collaborating in a team environment.


* Recent graduated with a Bachelor’s or Master´s degree in a relevant area
* Programming skills in either Java/Python OR Angular/Typescript
* Strong communication skills in English




It´s a great bonus if you also know a bit about AWS cloud and have had some exposure to Kuberbetes and Docker.

  



**About Jeppesen**
  

One third of the pilots and cabin crew worldwide are flying with schedules produced by Jeppesen's innovative solutions. One million pilots use their navigation products, and every day some 70,000 routes around the world are planned with the help of Jeppesen. They are solving some of the hardest combinatorial optimization problems you can imagine, in one of the most exciting and dynamic industries you can find.


At Jeppesen in Göteborg, over 400 employees from over 50 countries develop, implement and support cutting-edge resource optimization systems for airlines and railways. Jeppesen's crew planning and optimization product lines are mainly developed in Gothenburg. Jeppesen has more than 3500 employees worldwide and is a subsidiary of Boeing.
  

  

**About the talent program**
  

  

**Who are you?**
  

We are looking for individuals who are driven, curious, and have a passion for learning and solving complex problems. You are a technical enthusiast and would love to further explore your critical thinking, logical reasoning, and creativity in your daily work. You thrive in a social and communicative environment and long for a workplace with talented engineers who prioritize teamwork and believe that magic happens when great minds work together.


**The program**
  

These positions are a part of the Earn Your Wings talent program which is a collaboration between Hubbau and Jeppesen. During the yearly talent program, you will be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant in your specific role at Jeppesen. After that, the ambition is that your journey instead turns into employment directly at Jeppesen. Our goal is for you to have a fun and rewarding first year where you will be equipped with the best conditions for the future at Jeppesen and your professional life.
  

  

**The cherry on top**
  

During the year, you'll expand your network and skills through dedicated training days. These sessions cover both technical and soft skills, helping you develop problem-solving techniques and see failure as part of the learning process. At Jeppesen, curiosity, creativity, and the courage to challenge ideas are highly valued, equipping you with the mindset and tools to approach technical challenges in new ways. On top of that, you’ll become part of a strong community, enjoying plenty of fun activities and social events throughout the year.


**Other information**


The talent program starts on the first of September 2025 (2025-09-01).

  

This position is a full-time employment located at Jeppesen's office in central Gothenburg. We practice ongoing selection, so do not hesitate to express your interest.

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Job Description
  
  

At Our Company, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
  
  

Our company, is one of the largest software development companies in Gothenburg. We develop innovative optimization solutions for the world’s leading airlines. We are dedicated to continuous improvement, delivering more value to our clients, and exploring emerging technologies such as quantum computing, AI and big data analytics.
  
  

At Our Company’s office in central Gothenburg you will work in a one-of-a-kind software development organization with fascinating solutions that make a real difference to people around the world. You will be working in an agile learning organization, surrounded by a team of talented, creative and dedicated colleagues. You will learn and broaden your perspective by working with 400 professionals from more than 30 different nations, but also be part of a global organization allowing for collaboration with customers and colleagues across the world. Most importantly, you will be expected to make a difference.
  
  

**Position Responsibilities:**  

We are looking for a Senior Software Developer to join our team in Gothenburg. In this role, you will have a central position to develop and maintain specific software for our generic product packaging, which will be a vital part of our business in order to scale our Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions. The team is responsible to develop our Configuration Environment, which is a collection of programs and services that in a standardized way serves as the foundation for our customers. The Configuration Environment is used to host, build, test and deploy the individual customer's product configuration.
  
  

Currently, the work involves porting the application to the AWS cloud. The Configuration Environment has historically existed as a collection of virtual machines, and we are currently working on replicating this setup in the cloud. We are also working on moving the services into a Kubernetes context. Most of the daily work involves writing Bash and Python scripts that manage the platform, which consists of a GitLab instance that serves the CI/CD processes and various connecting components. Each customer has their own such instance and can modify various aspects themselves. Our team create and maintain the foundation of this setup.
  
  

You will work together with a dedicated team of software engineers where collaboration and helpfulness are at the heart of our work culture. We work closely with both internal customers and other development teams as well as airline customers to develop solutions and improve user experience.
  
  

We value high product quality where our build environment, tests and CI/CD in combination with a DevSecOps mindset are crucial parts for success in our journey from on premises solutions towards Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions in a cloud environment. We strive to have strong and empowered teams that takes full responsibility and have the autonomy to be high performing, driving continuous improvement and innovation.
  
  

As a senior software developer, you are expected to possess both the ability and experience to drive, guide, and coach the team on technical aspects such as AWS, Kubernetes, and product security. A deep understanding and mastery of Linux, coupled with a tinkering mindset, is essential. Additionally, you should demonstrate a strong analytical approach to problem-solving, excellent communication skills both within and outside your team, and a genuine interest in both technology and human relations. A good understanding and experience of agile methodology is highly valued. We also think you are driven, committed, have a positive attitude and are comfortable with continuous team growth and having fun. You will have great opportunities to influence, learn and grow as a software developer and individual. We offer several education and training possibilities to get under the hood of our product solutions technically and also from a customer point of view.
  
  

**Basic Qualifications:**  

Bachelor of Science or Master of Science in computing engineering or other relevant or equivalent education or experience
  
  

Very good knowledge in using Linux environments (system admin) and Bash scripting
  
  

Very good knowledge and skills in Python
  
  

Very good knowledge and skills in Docker and Kubernetes
  
  

Very good knowledge and skills in AWS and cloud environments in general
  
  

Very good knowledge and skills in Java
  
  

Strong security mindset and security skills with a focus on integrating security into the design and development process
  
  

Fluency in English (our corporate language), spoken and written
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Good knowledge, skills and interest in DevSecOps
  
  

A curious mind and a true continuous improvement mindset
  
  

A team player with high integrity
  
  

Experience in using and understanding agile methodology
  
  

Relevant experience in Istio
  
  

Relevant experience in Helm charts
  
  

Relevant experience in Spring Cloud
  
  

Good experience working with Go
  
  

Relevant experience and interest in identity and authentication management
  
  

This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite 2-3 days a week. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.
  
  

**Join us if you want to:**  

Get professional skills development with our virtual learning tools and platforms (Digital Campus, LinkedIn Learning, Degreed, EdX, Enterprise Mentoring, and Communities of Excellence & Practice)
  
  

Broaden your experience in international projects, technical workshops and hackathons
  
  

Our Company is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world.

title: Business Developer - Southeast Asia
description:
In a world where product size labels are unreliable, Volumental is the footwear industry's leading FitTech company. Our vision is a world without sizes, where every body fits. Our FitTech uses 3D scans and a one-of-a-kind, AI-powered recommendation engine to match everyone with the shoes that fit them best.


With top brand and retail partners worldwide, including New Balance, Red Wing Shoes, Fleet Feet, The Athlete's Foot, Ecco, Intersport, and XXL, our footprint spans 3000+ stores across 54 countries, and growing!


We are now looking for a Business Developer to join our Commercial Team and help us grow and nurture our partnerships in Southeast Asia. This role requires a creative and proactive thinker who thrives on building relationships, driving revenue, and delivering real impact for our customers.

  

You’ll be the bridge between Volumental and our customers—ensuring they are set up for success while also identifying opportunities to expand their engagement with our solutions. The person in this role will be based locally in Indonesia, working closely with regional and global teams to expand Volumental’s footprint in the market.


From onboarding and training to performance monitoring and strategic account growth, you’ll work closely with stakeholders across the footwear industry, from HQ decision-makers to in-store teams.  

  



  

**What You’ll Do**

* Identify and secure new business opportunities and upsell or expand existing partnerships to drive revenue growth.
* Own and grow a portfolio of international footwear retailers and distributors across Southeast Asia, ensuring they maximize the value of Volumental’s solutions.
* Lead customer onboarding and training, ensuring smooth rollouts and high product adoption.
* Monitor customer performance at organizational and store levels, providing actionable insights to optimize product usage.
* Collaborate with internal teams, including Product and Customer Experience, to ensure successful implementation and long-term customer success.
* Monthly travel within Southeast Asia to meet customers, support store launches, and build strong relationships.

**Who You Are**

  

* A relationship-driven professional with 3+ years of experience in account management, sales, or customer success, ideally in SaaS, retail tech, or footwear.
* A strong communicator who can influence stakeholders at all levels, from store staff to C-suite.
* Someone who loves both strategy and execution – you can spot big-picture opportunities while also rolling up your sleeves to make things happen.
* Passionate about technology and retail, with a curiosity to learn and innovate.
* Fluent in English and Bahasa Indonesia.
* Based in Indonesia and comfortable with frequent regional travel, plus occasional trips to our Stockholm HQ to collaborate with Swedish colleagues and engage in global projects across time zones.

  


**Bonus!**


Don’t let these stop you from applying, but please let us know if they fit you:

  

* Experience working with footwear retailers or distributors in Southeast Asia.
* Experience working with sales of SaaS solutions.
* Experience selling to footwear retailers or brands.
* Experience working with e-commerce platforms.
* Familiarity with other regional languages.

  


**What we offer you:**

  

* Competitive remuneration and attractive commission structure.
* Opportunity to work with a dynamic, international team.
* The chance to be a part of a growing global brand.
  

  

This is a full-time, remote position reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer at Volumental, with opportunities to travel to our Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden—where you'll collaborate with our talented Swedish colleagues and experience our innovative work culture firsthand.


At Volumental, we value innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to customer success. We strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment where all team members can thrive. We encourage a diversity of applicants to apply!

title: Senior Embedded Software Developer (MedTech) -Malmö/Lund,...
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Senior Embedded Software Developer (MedTech)**  

  



**Location:** Malmö/Lund, Sweden

**Job type:** Fulltime , Onsite

 **Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Senior Embedded Software Developer (MedTech)**

**About VIPAS :**


Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

**Job Description:**


Vipas AB is seeking a **Senior Embedded Software Developer** for a long-term assignment with one of our clients in the **MedTech** industry. This role requires a strong system understanding of software development for medical devices, including hardware connections and embedded system architecture. We are looking for a candidate with a deep passion for embedded development and experience working with multiple embedded platforms and operating systems.

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and optimize embedded software solutions for **MedTech products**.
* Understand and interpret customer needs and transform them into manufacturable designs.
* Work with various **embedded platforms** and **operating systems** to build robust solutions.
* Collaborate with hardware teams to ensure seamless integration of software and hardware components.
* Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and simple manner.
* Contribute to **device driver development** and **real-time operating systems (RTOS) integration**.
* Participate in team discussions and support both **small and large project teams**.


**Requirements:**

* **5+ years of experience** in embedded software development.
* Strong proficiency in **C/C++ for embedded systems**.
* Experience in **device driver development**.
* Familiarity with **real-time operating systems (RTOS)**.
* Open-minded and passionate about embedded development.
* Excellent communication skills in **spoken and written English**.

**Preferred Skills (Nice to Have):*** Experience with **medical device software development (IEC 62304 compliance)**.
* Knowledge of **open-source development** and **configuration management tools** like Git, Gerrit, Jenkins, GitLab.
* Familiarity with **connectivity standards** (Bluetooth, WiFi, NFC, LTE).
* Debugging experience using **Jlink, ST-Link, Lauterbach, Trace32**.
* Hands-on experience with **measuring instruments** such as oscilloscopes and logic analyzers.
* Security expertise in **keys, certificates, TLS/SSL**.
* Experience with **electronics hardware bring-up and bootloaders**.
* Understanding of **Embedded Linux, Yocto, Buildroot**.
* Cloud communication knowledge using **MQTT or REST**.
* Exposure to **safety-classified software** development

  


**Why Join Us?**



Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.


You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at sandhya@vipas.se**

**Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.**

 **How to Apply:**


Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!

  

Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Systemutvecklare Java

* Medverka i sprint- och inkrementretro.

Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av programmering i Java eller Kotlin som del av ett utvecklingsteam varav 3 de senaste 5 åren.

**Meriterande**

Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med Kubernetes eller Kafka.


**Om oss**


Centios övergripande mål är att vara ett konsultbolag som erbjuder smarta och hållbara lösningar som utvecklar samhället på ett positivt sätt.


Våra medarbetare erbjuds villkor som är anpassade för individen. Det innebär att arbetstider, arbetsomfattning, arbetsplats och kompetensutveckling så långt som möjligt anpassas utifrån medarbetarens behov.


Bland våra medarbetare hittar du engagerad personer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Vi jobbar i små grupper där du kan bidra med dina erfarenheter samtidigt som du får ta del av andras kunskap och erfarenhet.


För oss är det viktigt med välmående och att hitta en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Därför har vi en nollvision mot stress och sätter trivsel och hälsa främst.

title: Senior Android-utvecklare
description:
B3 Beyond är ett utmärker oss genom vår familjära kultur och vårt fokus på kompetensdelning. Vi är ett konsultbolag som specialiserat oss på att leverera förstklassiga teknologilösningar till en mångsidig kundbas. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av våra kunder och stöttar dem i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi söker en skicklig Senior Android-utvecklare för att ansluta sig till vårt team och hjälpa oss att leverera mobila lösningar till våra kunder.

**Ansvarsområden:**

* Utveckla, underhålla och optimera Android-applikationer för olika kunder.
* Samarbeta med produktchefer, designers och backend-utvecklare för att skapa sömlösa mobila upplevelser.
* Ge teknisk expertis och strategiska rekommendationer till kunder.
* Säkerställa kodkvalitet, säkerhet och prestanda genom best practices och kodgranskningar.
* Hålla sig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna, ramverken och verktygen inom Android-utveckling.
* Felsöka och lösa komplexa tekniska problem.
* Snabbt anpassa sig till olika projektkrav och kundbehov.

**Krav på kompetens & erfarenhet:**

* 5+ års erfarenhet av Android-utveckling.
* Gedigen kunskap i Kotlin (Java-erfarenhet är ett plus).
* Djup förståelse för Android SDK och Jetpack-bibliotek.
* Erfarenhet av MVVM eller andra moderna arkitekturmönster.
* Erfarenhet av att använda Coroutines och Flow för asynkron programmering.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av RESTful APIs, GraphQL och backend-integration.
* Kunskap om beroendeinjektionsramverk som Dagger/Hilt.
* Erfarenhet av Jetpack Compose och moderna UI-utvecklingsmetoder.
* Bekantskap med enhetstestning, UI-testning och automationsramverk (JUnit, Espresso, MockK etc.).
* Förståelse för Google Play Store-riktlinjer, appdistribution och analys.
* Förmåga att optimera appar för prestanda, skalbarhet och säkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Agile/Scrum-miljöer.
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och förmåga att kommunicera komplexa koncept effektivt.
* Svenska – flytande i tal och skrift.

**Vad vi erbjuder:**


Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Beyond är otroligt viktigt. Särskilt uppskattat är vårt stora fokus på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:

* Generös kompetensutveckling
* Attraktiv lönemodell
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning

  

**Om B3**  

  

B3 Beyond är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa."

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!**


Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig för denna tjänst, Hanna, på hanna.winso@b3.se

title: Systemutvecklare Test och automation
description:
Vi söker en systemutvecklare inriktning mot testautomation till myndighet inom det svenska kraftsystemet.

  

Tjänsten är på heltid, och säkerhetsprövning krävs.


Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden vilket ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och samarbetsförmåga.

**Uppdraget**


Myndigheten är den som ansvarar för att elöverföringssystemet är säkert, miljöanpassat och kostnadseffektivt - idag och i framtiden.

  

Som systemutvecklare ingår konsulten i ett av myndighetens nio utvecklingsteam och bygga programvara som stöttar landets elförsörjning med fokus på användarbarhet, robusthet och säkerhet. Myndighetens teknikstack är Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, Angular och Kubernetes. Myndigheten använder sig utav SAFe-metodik med en inkrementlängd på fyra sprintar och en sprintlängd på tre veckor.


Ett typiskt utvecklingsteamhar följande bemanning:

* Produktägare
* Scrum master
* Utvecklare (Tech lead)
* Utvecklare (Security champion)
* Utvecklare 3 – 5 (t.ex. backend och frontend)
* Testare


Med den här annonsen försöker myndigheten ändra profilen för deras testare från att vara en person som jobbar med manuella tester och/eller testledning till att vara en person som jobbar med systemutveckling med inriktning mot testautomation. Myndighetens utvecklingsteam gör redan ett gediget arbete när det gäller enhetstester och integrationstester men eftersom deras leveranser ingår i ett större ekosystem så vill de förbättra sig på att testa helheten. I uppdraget kommer konsulten fördela sin tid mellan utveckling av funktionalitet, utveckling av teamets testautomation, t.ex. hur effektiva testerna är och hur lång tid de tar att exekvera, samt delta i en arbetsgrupp med andra likasinnade med att skapa en testbädd för att testa hela ekosystemet ur flera perspektiv t.ex. funktionalitet, prestanda och, i viss utsträckning, säkerhet.

Skriva kod och konfiguration.  

* Skriva tester.
* Skriva dokumentation.
* Medverka i standup-möten.

Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av programmering i Java eller Kotlin varav 3 de senaste 5 åren.

**Meriterande**

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att sätta upp testautomation ände till ände för system som är baserade på mikrotjänster som levereras av flera team.  

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att sätta upp testautomation för mutation testing, property-based testing, eller automatiserade prestandatester.

* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med Kubernetes eller Kafka.

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 18-02-2025 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: ETL Developer
Senior Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

* Skriva kod och konfiguration.
* Skriva tester.
* Skriva dokumentation.
* Medverka i standup-möten.
* Medverka i sprint- och inkrementplanering.
* Medverka i sprint- och inkrementdemo.
* Medverka i sprint- och inkrementretro.
* Medverka i arbetsgrupp för förmågeutveckling inom testautomation.

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av programmering i Java eller Kotlin varav 3 de senaste 5 åren.

  

**Meriterande**  

* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att sätta upp testautomation ände till ände för system som är baserade på mikrotjänster som levereras av flera team.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att sätta upp testautomation för mutation testing, property-based testing, eller automatiserade prestandatester.

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att sätta upp testautomation för kaostester.  
* 

  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 18-02-2025 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Software Test Developer
description:
*Are you passionate about Linux and believe that testing is the key to quality? If so, we want you to join our team as a Software Test Developer at Westermo!*


At Westermo, we develop software for our own hardware, running on a Linux-based operating system called WeOS. We integrate a variety of Open Source packages along with a significant amount of software developed from scratch. Our Software Test Team is now looking for a new colleague!

 **Are you our new Software Test Developer?**


Do you love taking projects from start to finish? If so, you'll fit right in with our Agile team! As a Software Test Developer at Westermo, you'll be diving into the exciting world of developing test cases in Python for our Linux-based operating system, WeOS. Your journey will include everything from requirement analysis and design to coding, integration, quality assurance, and troubleshooting.


But that's not all! You'll also be involved in other development teams, evaluating test scopes, developing and maintaining automated tests, and exploring and troubleshooting various challenges. With your team by your side, help and support are always just a step away!

**What You'll Be Doing:**

* Reviewing requirements and writing automated tests for regression testing.
* Reviewing and approving requirements and tests written by WeOS developers.
* Performing various forms of manual testing.
* Configuring different testing tools, focusing on cybersecurity, performance, and stability.


As a team, we value openness and sharing of knowledge, recognizing that all members are juniors on some topics and seniors on other. We give no refuge to holy cows or the status quo, new ideas about how we should build our platform are always welcomed and encouraged. We pride ourselves on being able to change our minds the second we hear a better solution to a given problem.

**So, who are we looking for?**


We believe in the power of teamwork and value those who think the team's success is more important than individual achievements. As we develop network technology based on embedded Linux we see that knowledge, and a genuine interest, in Network Technologies and experience from working in a Linux environment is key in this role.

 **In other words:**

* Someone who enjoys both coding and testing.
* A holistic thinker who brings systematic thinking to the team.
* A communicative and pedagogical individual who loves working with others.
* An explorer who likes to try, test, and learn with colleagues.

**Requirements:**

* Professional experience in programming languages such as C, C++, Python, or Java.
* Experience working in a Linux environment.
* A genuine interest in software testing methodologies and troubleshooting.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.

**Bonus points for:**

* Knowledge in Networking Technologies such as switching, routing and security protocols.


Oh, and don't worry, if you’re not an expert in all the things described – you'll learn.

**In return, we offer:** You will be working at the forefront of technology in a friendly, open culture where we you get the opportunity to learn from skilled colleagues every day. A mature and caring leadership in a flat organization. Through our collective bargain agreement you will be covered in terms of insurance, pension and other benefits. We like to have fun together and we regularly enjoy sports and other social activities as a team. We believe that magic happens when people meet. We are a learning organization and we truly love to try new things, think outside the box and be innovative together!

**Basic information:**

* Location: Kopparlunden, Västerås
* Job type: Full time
* Employment contract: Permanent

**Don’t miss out on this opportunity – apply today.** **For further information please contact:**


Recruiting manager Alexander Falk; alexander.falk@westermo.com or Elin Sandell, Recruiter at elin.sandell@westermo.com

***About Westermo:***

*Welcome to a rapidly growing international company, thriving at the forefront of cutting edge technology. Westermo develops and manufactures advanced devices for industrial data communication, used in mission**-**critical installations and harsh industrial environments. The very robust and secure communication networks built with our products provide a high value for our customers.*

*We are focused on leveraging growth opportunities in our market* *and are devoted to delivering the world's best industrial networks. This is achieved through a very dynamic work environment where teamwork and loyalty are valued.* *Strong and honest relationships with colleagues, customers, and suppliers are important to us. We have an open culture where we share knowledge, learn from one another and explore new ideas, allowing us to constantly improve.*

*Westermo is a leading provider of Industrial Data Communications equipment to the global market. Sales are conducted through our own offices in key markets in Europe, North America, Australia and Asia, as well as through distributors and OEM customers worldwide. Development and manufacturing take place in Sweden, Ireland, Germany**and Switzerland. Westermo was founded in 1975 and today has over 480 employees with a turnover of around 1 Billion SEK. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ependion, listed on the Nasdaq OMX Nordic stock exchange.*
company_addresses: Westermo Network Technologies, Metallverksgatan 6, SE-721 30 Västerås, Sweden
company_description: We are a leading supplier of robust, reliable and easy-to-use Industrial Data Communications equipment to the global market, devoted to delivering the world's best industrial networks.

title: Developer Verification
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Ericsson Radio Performance Verification (RPV) within Integration Verification & Certification (IVC) department at Product Engineering Unit (PEU) Radio, responsible for ensuring product quality, securing test method and test environment to fulfill all the assigned test activities within approved cost, time and quality frame.

  

As a verification developer you will be an important member of our team and participate in the design of Ericsson´s next-generation radio network products! We are the team verifying the Radio Performance in the radio products to fulfill the 3GPP/CE/ETSI requirements. There are many opportunities as we have a broad responsibility within the radio performance verification domain in both HW and SW.

 **What you will do:**


As a developer in verification, you will be working with Radio performance test:

* Establish integration & verification scope
* Design and develop test method and work on software solutions for our test environment
* Execute test cases
* Complete test report, analyze test results and troubleshoot if any issues
* Help to maintain and enhance the hardware development for lab environment
* Work on software solutions for our test environment
* Contribute to the overall success of the Radio Verification team goals

 **The skills you bring:**

* Bachelor's or master's degree in data science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Knowledge of Radio RF technology (3GPP, CE, FCC, Telec, etc.).
* Experience in test method design and test environment setup.
* Familiarity with 3GPP standards (ETSI, series 51, 25, 36, 37, 38).
* Programming skills using the major languages like Java, phyton, C, C++
* Understanding of Lean and Agile methodologies.
* A service-minded attitude with strong networking and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement.
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Digital Design Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**

  

We are looking for a Digital Hardware Developer to join our Radio Hardware Development Team in Lund. In this role, you will work closely with talented teams both locally and globally, contributing to the design and development of next-generation radio hardware. Our team plays a key role in shaping cutting-edge wireless communication technologies, ensuring that Ericsson stays at the forefront of innovation to meet customer and business needs worldwide.

  

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic and collaborative environment where you can explore various aspects of radio hardware development. You’ll have the chance to work with advanced technology and make a meaningful impact in the future of wireless communication. If you're passionate about innovation and eager to contribute to world-leading solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

 **What you will do**

* Work with radio digital design from architecture through to volume production.
* Design (specifications, schematic, and reviews etc.), test, introduce into the factory and support hardware.
* The work include design from optical interfaces to analog, PDN network, and high-speed communications among others. Simulation experience with 2D and 3D simulators is beneficial.
* Investigate and resolve engineering problems.
* Encourage continuous improvements of design, processes, and product quality.
* Prepare lab environment including both equipment and software components, experience in Python is a plus.
* Implement test and validation methods for efficient design test coverage.
* Produce documentation as per radio development processes.
* Solving problems, including support on debugging field return units.

 **Skills you bring**

* B.Sc. or equivalent in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, with a Master’s degree preferred, bringing a strong foundation in hardware development.
* Experience in digital hardware design, implementation, and verification, ensuring high-performance and reliable solutions.
* Proficiency in Standard tools used to perform schematic capture and layout (e.g. Cadence)
* Expertise in board-level power and grounding strategies, particularly for multilayer mixed digital/analog/RF designs, optimizing performance and integrity.
* Hands-on experience with high-speed serial interfaces, applying best practices in signal integrity and design optimization.
* A good understanding of digital board design, contributing to robust and scalable hardware solutions.
* Familiarity with SI simulations, EMC constraints, and timing analysis, ensuring compliance with industry standards.
* Previous exposure to radio transceiver digital design and testing, bringing valuable insights into RF hardware integration.
* Experience in designing products for volume production, balancing performance, cost, and manufacturability.
* Excellent English communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced, diverse team environment.
**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary Recruiter:** [[Anitha Pulluru]]

title: Next Generation: Software Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**
---------------------------

  

We are looking for an entry-level software developer to our development team. You will be working at our R&D department in Stockholm which is responsible for SW design and maintenance of Digital Baseband Units in the Ericsson Radio System.

  

Our Module “Radio Control System – Execution Environment” (RCS EE) is an enabler for 5G. We develop the execution platform which has multiple modules/development areas and provide the infrastructure to enable 5G connections and different 5G use cases such as virtual and augmented reality, automated driving etc. Major development activities are ongoing to enable 5G network, cloud execution, and Internet of Things. We are now looking for you who are at the beginning of your career and is eager to learn from senior colleagues.

  

We are actively seeking the next wave of tech talent through our NextGen graduate initiative in Stockholm. This opportunity is for recent graduates with 0-3 years of experience who are eager to launch a meaningful career in technology. Although we have an exceptional team in place, we are always focused on building for the future. If you're ready to make an impact, this is your chance to join us.

**What you will do:**
---------------------

  

In this role, you will join our team of skilled engineers and work with software development. You will have the opportunity to:

* Work in all product lifecycles from early studies to product design and maintenance of Execution Environment SW
* Design and drive optimal solutions based on product requirements
* Work closely with product guardian group in defining and implementing improvements
* Participate in predevelopment projects
**We offer****:**
-----------------

* Challenging work and focus on your career development and career path
* High standard working climate and competent colleagues
* Opportunity to work with the latest technology to enable 5G
* A decisive impact on the success of the Radio Base Stations in the 5G network

**You will bring:**
-------------------

  

* A Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent
* Deep understanding of Linux as a development environment
* Experiences in embedded software application
* Good programming skills, experiences with C and C-family languages
* Basic in script programming (Python, Perl and Java)
* Understanding of SW Integration and verification
* Experiences with and understanding of common Linux development tools, for example GIT, GITHUB, Gerrit, Jenkins
* Understanding of cloud infrastructure and basic awareness of virtualization is a plus
* Knowledge of Agile and Lean methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban is a plus
* Good skills in English and communication
* Both self-driven and able to work in teams
* A productive, creative mindset which can help you interact easily with other people

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 As a Backend Software Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Strong professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Mobile SDK development experience


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Python Developer
description:
