You’ll search every rock, inventory every clue, hunt every mismatch. We do that, too - together we’ll be armed with state-of-the-art monitoring tools and an impressive amount of data, and join you in the adventure.
* You don’t take shortcuts. You’re speaking up for the future user, the edge case, the doomsday design. You know product engineers want to build it with you, and see them as allies, where you give them the power and knowledge to access greater things.
* You’re someone who cares about what you do and the team you do it with, and want to work with others who do as well. You’ll be on interview panels choosing your next colleagues, and you’ll take that seriously. You only want to work with people who make you better, and want to make you better.
* You’ve built infrastructure at a slightly later stage than Ashby is at - you know how to deal with millions of data points, have seen great (or not great) infrastructure make or break customer experience, and have automated everything from provisioning to monitoring and release process.
* You’re a Swiss army knife (all nationalities welcome ;) ). You’ll be the third SRE, so you’ll get every hard problem the company faces. You’ll get to do infrastructure updates, security enforcements, database optimization, Kubernetes debugging, and digging through Typescript traces figuring out what doesn’t work. You probably don’t feel like an expert at at least some of that... and that appeals to you.


All that makes for a pretty specific kind of role, and the job isn’t to everyone’s tastes! You should not apply if:

* You don’t want to make your own decisions on what is the best paved road to build for Ashby, and expect a lead or manager to make the final call on what that is. Our leads (and managers) give ample commentary and feedback on technical decisions and how they’re made, but you ship what you want to build and are accountable for it.
* You hate SQL. We have a lot of features built around making the best out of data, and our platform engineers also sometimes dive into a gnarly report or advise engineers on a more performant data model to use.
* You don’t want to code. Our SREs are some of our best software engineers and they are just as responsible for the application as the other engineering teams - albeit at a platform level. Reviewing code and submitting code changes will be part of your day to day.
* Your primary mode of communicating best practices to engineers is live meetings. We’re a very async culture and written communication (and code) is how changes get made. As an Ashby SRE, you will need to share new tooling and best practices with engineers faster than your next meeting opportunity will take you.
* You’ve never delivered a project, on your own, without someone prodding you for updates. We have no project or delivery managers to fill your calendar with busy work, but the flip side is you have to do your project management, seek the help you need to get unstuck and cut scope when it’s worthwhile.

**Technology Stack**
====================


I’m sharing our tech stack with the caveat that we don’t require previous experience in it: TypeScript (frontend & backend), Node.js, React, Apollo GraphQL, Postgres, Redis.


We use Datadog and Sentry on 100% cloud-based (AWS) infra. We take developer experience and reliability seriously: all engineers are on call in a follow-the-sun model, and everyone contributes to developer tooling.

**What We’re Building**
=======================


Talent teams aspire to build a hiring process that identifies great candidates, moves them quickly through the interview process, and provides an excellent experience for the candidate. To accomplish this, recruiters perform thousands of daily tasks to coordinate and relay information between candidates, interviewers, and hiring managers. Teams struggle to keep up!


Scheduling a final round is an excellent example of our customers' challenges. A recruiter needs to collect availability from the candidate, identify potential interviewers, perform “Calendar Tetris” to find who is available to interview the candidate, schedule on the earliest date possible, and perform any last-minute adjustments as availability changes. They must perform this while considering the interview load on each individual and whether interviewers need to be trained and shadowing others.


Ashby provides talent teams with intelligent and powerful software that provides insights into where they’re failing and automates or simplifies many of the tasks they’re underwater with. We put a lot of effort into designing products that are approachable to beginners but mastered and extended by power users. In many ways, spreadsheets set the bar here.


We have many customers, great revenue growth, years of runway, and amazing investors like YCombinator, Elad Gil, and Lachy Groom. I’ll share more once we meet.

**Engineering Culture**
=======================


Our engineering culture is motivated by Abhik and Benji’s (our co-founders) belief that a small talented team, given the right environment, can build high-quality software fast (and work regular hours!).

**Collaboration is Natural, Communication is Deliberate**
---------------------------------------------------------


Our engineering team (and the team at large) consists of lifelong learners who are humble and kind (meet them here!). These attributes create an environment where collaboration happens naturally (we filter for it in interviews). We combine this with research, prototyping, and written proposals to see around corners and get feedback from the team across time zones. Focus time is something that we hold sacred, and, with thoughtful and deliberate communication, engineers can focus 36h out of a 40h work week (Abhik wrote about it here). Even managers can rely on getting consistent time (and support to make, if necessary) to focus and do creative work without the demand of constant meetings.

**Increase Leverage, not Team Size**
------------------------------------


We built Ashby with the quality, breadth, and depth that many customers would expect from much larger teams over larger time scales. We’ve done this through investment in:

* **Great developer tooling.** Our CI/CD takes ~10m, and we deploy at least 5x a day. Everyone on the team has contributed to developer experience
* **Building blocks to create powerful and customizable products fast.** At the core of Ashby is a set of common components (analytics modeling and query language, policy engine, workflow engine, design system) which we are constantly improving. Each improvement to a common component cascades throughout our app (short video on it here).


Here’s an impromptu quote from Arjun in our company Slack of what it’s like to build a feature at Ashby:


“Working on a generic framework for Surveys is really paying off! I was able to add the Automation Rules feature to EEOC Forms really quickly because I had some generic components and backend code. Took about 10 minutes and ~50 lines of code to do!”

**Give Engineers Ownership & Autonomy**
---------------------------------------


We, as engineers, find clever ways to solve problems, which amplifies when we deeply understand the problem. All of us in technical leadership did our best work as engineers when we had a deep understanding of the end-user and the business and ownership over the solution. Our engineering culture reflects this experience: engineers own projects end-to-end, from speaking with users to writing product specs to UX design. These are skills that we often don’t get to practice as engineers, and, as a manager at Ashby, you’ll provide mentorship and feedback to engineers to ensure they are successful when delivering projects.

**Put Effort into Diversity**
-----------------------------


Diverse teams drive innovation and better outcomes. Having seen his mother and partner build their careers as minority women in non-diverse fields, Abhik wants to make sure Ashby creates opportunities for the next generation of engineers from underrepresented groups (including my daughter!).


Today, 26% of engineers at Ashby are from underrepresented groups. It’s not great, and we are taking conscious steps to improve, like sourcing diverse candidates, providing generous paid family leave, no leetcode interviews, and more.

**Interview Process**
=====================


At Ashby, our team and interview process want to help you show your best self. We’ll dive into past projects and simulate working together via pair programming, writing tech specs collaboratively, and talking through decisions (no leetcode or whiteboard exercises). Our interview process is three rounds:

* 30-minute introduction call
* A technical screen (60-minute in-person)
* A virtual on-site of 2 hours and 45 minutes (can be split across two days)


Our VP of Engineering, Abhik will be your main point of contact and prep you for interviews. You’ll meet your manager, 4 to 6 people in engineering (with 15 minutes in each interview to ask them questions) including our entire current SRE team. If we don’t give an offer, we’ll provide feedback!

**Your First Two Months at Ashby**
==================================


We want an exceptional onboarding experience for every new hire. At Ashby, your dev environment sets up with a single script, you push your first change on day one, and we spend the rest of the time building your confidence in our codebase and practices culminating in the delivery of a prominent, impactful feature. We’ll pair you with a peer who’ll guide you through your first tasks and be someone you rely on, from answering questions to pair programming.

**Benefits**
============

* Competitive salary and equity.
* *10-year exercise window for stock options*. You shouldn’t feel pressure to purchase stock options if you leave Ashby —do it when you feel financially comfortable.
* Unlimited PTO with four weeks recommended per year. Expect “Vacation?” in our one-on-one agenda until you start taking it .
* *Twelve weeks of fully paid family leave in the US.* We plan to expand this to employees in other countries as situations arise.
* Generous equipment, software, and office furniture budget. Get what you need to be happy and productive!
* $100/month education budget with more expensive items (like conferences) covered with manager approval.
* If you’re in the US, top-notch health insurance for you and your dependents with all premiums covered by us.


Ashby’s success hinges on hiring great people and creating an environment where we can be happy, feel challenged, and do our best work. We’re being deliberate about building that environment from the ground up. I hope that excites you enough to apply.


Ashby provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.


Compensation Range: £130K - £190K

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Payments (Micro-frontend, React)
description:
### **Description**

 *YOUR JOURNEY STARTS HERE...*
  

**About WeTravel**  

  

Travel gives people new experiences and brings them together, sometimes in life-changing ways. That’s especially the case for *group travel and multi-day travel* where the trip participants (travellers) get to really immerse themselves. Passionate travel organizers make this magic happen and WeTravel is here to support those travel companies. We help them publish their trip offerings, generate leads and follow through to convert them to bookings, process payments around the world, pay suppliers/vendors, and digitize their operations. This helps multi-day travel organizers get more bookings, save time, and save money.  

  

OUR VALUES  

  

This position presents the opportunity to work in a business-critical role in a rapidly growing company. You will also uphold our four core values:  

Be the solution - take ownership, drive collaboration  

Be resourceful - strive for new wins every day  

Be honest - default to transparency  

Be respectful - treat others like you want to be treated  

### **About the role**

  

We are seeking a highly skilled Frontend Engineer to join our **payments** team and guide the charge in crafting exceptional user interfaces. If you possess an in-depth command of the **React framework**, a discerning eye for design, and a strong commitment to code quality, we want to hear from you.  

This role presents an opportunity to be a key member of our agile, cross-functional team of 9-10 professionals, where you will play a pivotal role in delivering cutting-edge digital solutions.  

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate effectively within an agile framework, participating in the end-to-end application lifecycle.
* Engage with modern technologies and libraries within a microservices architecture to tackle intricate obstacles.
* Collaborate closely with backend developers to smoothly integrate user-facing components with server-side rationality.
* Produce immaculate, high-quality code, while also prototyping solutions, troubleshooting issues, and optimizing performance.
* Develop automated tests to ensure robustness, meet business requirements, and facilitate regression testing.
* work closely with **payment service providers** and implement complex payment flows
* build robust and secure payment user interfaces that handle real-time transactions

implement and maintain PCI compliance requirements on the frontend  
* 

If you are interested to learn more about our tech stack, check out our stackshare.io profile!### **Preferred Experience**

 **Preferred Experience*** Proven track record of developing and deploying high-quality web applications using HTML5, CSS3/LESS/SASS, and JavaScript (ES6).
* Proven expertise in guiding frontend web frameworks such as React, AngularJS, or Vue.js. Solid foundation in object-oriented software design and development, employing languages like Ruby, JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Java, or Go.
* Solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals, algorithms, and data structures.  

Exceptional problem-solving skills and clear communication abilities, both written and verbal.
* Experience integrating multiple payment service providers (e.g., Stripe).
* Strong understanding of payment flows, authentication methods (3DS), and checkout optimization.
* Experience handling sensitive payment data and implementing PCI DSS requirement.

**Desirable Skills*** Experience thriving in an Agile Software Development environment.
* Familiarity with containerized applications (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker) on major Cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP).
* Exposure to both relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and non-relational databases (e.g., MongoDB, Neo4j).

**Valued Additions*** Notable contributions to open-source projects within our tech-stack.
* Proficiency in UX design to complement technical expertise.

Join our team and be a driving influence in shaping the future of digital experiences. Bring your expertise to the table and contribute to the success of complex projects that push the boundaries of frontend engineering.### **Job Benefits**

  

* Attractive compensation.
* Unlimited Paid Time Off!
* Annual team off site.
* Access to Headspace, ensuring piece of mind and well being
* Maternity and Paternity benefits even for Contractors - wherever you are in the world.
* The latest Apple tech you need to be successful.
* A'Dam Program for you to visit us in Amsterdam for 2-4 weeks every year.

  

### **About WeTravel**


Founded in 2016, WeTravel provides a complete booking and payments platform for multi-day and group travel companies of all sizes. We give your clients an easy booking experience while also helping you manage financials, payments to partners or your bank, registration information, and client communication all in one place.  

  

Headquartered in San Francisco, with our secondary hub in Amsterdam, our team is driven to continuously improve our technology; ensuring that our clients always have the best possible solutions at their fingertips.

title: Product Manager with UI/UX Expertise
description:
**About Us**

ClickGUARD is a SaaS startup operating in a domain where ad tech meets cybersecurity. Our platform helps Google Ads advertisers protect their investment and maximize their ROI by detecting and removing wasteful ad traffic from their advertising campaigns. We’ve built the absolute best solution for a significant problem for PPC advertisers and we need your help taking it to the next level of user experience.

We're a fully remote company with a close-knit team that’s figured out how to onboard employees the right way and build an awesome team spirit even when spread out across the globe. So come take a look, and maybe join us.

**The Role**   
We are seeking a **customer-centric, data-driven Product Manager** who can deeply understand our customers, anticipate market trends, and drive innovation that **differentiates ClickGUARD from the competition** through exceptional user experience and data-driven decisions.

**This role is NOT about managing internal corporate tools and processes.** Instead, you’ll lead a **customer-facing Product-Led Growth (PLG) team in a fast-moving, highly competitive market**, where **understanding customers, competitive positioning, and delivering measurable value** are key.

**UI/UX design experience is essential.** While this is not a designer role, you must have a **strong grasp of UI/UX principles, user psychology, and design best practices** to create intuitive, high-converting, and user-friendly experiences.

**About the role**

* **Deeply understand customer needs** - Obsessive user engagement, analyze feedback, and translate real-world pain points into product solutions.
* **Own the product's user experience** – Identify UX pain points, optimize user flows, and collaborate closely with UI/UX designers to ensure a seamless and intuitive experience.
* **Competitive intelligence** – Continuously analyze industry trends, competitors, and market shifts to uncover opportunities for differentiation and growth.
* **Data-driven prioritization** – Make product decisions based on analytics, user behavior, and business impact, not just internal stakeholder requests.

**Key Responibilities**

* Own and execute the **product vision and roadmap** based on market research, customer needs, and business strategy.
* **Own UI/UX strategy and drive design** - Create wireframes, and ensur visually appealing, high-converting interfaces.
* Conduct **customer interviews, surveys, and usability studies** to ensure product decisions are grounded in real user experiences.
* Perform **competitive analysis** to identify opportunities for differentiation and growth.
* Work closely with **marketing, sales, and customer success** teams to ensure alignment between product strategy and go-to-market initiatives.
* Define and track **key product metrics**, ensuring that feature development leads to measurable improvements in customer retention and revenue growth.
* Translate strategic priorities into well-defined product requirements and work with the **engineering team** to execute efficiently.
* Continuously track and apply emerging industry trends to enhance product competitiveness and usability.

**What we're looking for**

* **Deep understanding of UI/UX best practices** – You can confidently evaluate design, improve user flows, and provide feedback on usability.
* **Experience with UI/UX tools** - (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, etc.) is a strong plus.
* **Analytical mindset** with experience using product analytics tools.
* **Strong business acumen** – You understand **how product decisions impact growth, retention, and revenue**.
* Ability to work **lean and iterate quickly**, balancing speed with delivering real value.
* Experience working in **competitive markets** where differentiation and positioning are key.
* Strong understanding of **digital advertising, PPC campaigns** is a plus.

**What’s in it for you?**

* **Competitive salary** - Compensation that reflects your expertise and contributions.
* **High-impact role** – You’ll be leading product decisions in a company that values speed, innovation, and customer obsession.
* **Hands-on environment** – We operate lean, so your contributions will be direct and meaningful.
* **Fast-growing industry** – AdTech / MarTech is a quickly evolving space, making this an exciting space to bein.

If you’re passionate about building products that solve **real customer pain points**, understand **competitive markets**, and thrive in **a high-growth SaaS environment**, we’d love to hear from you!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From 55 000,00kr per month

Work Location: Remote

title: Software Engineer - Frontend
description:
**Why Tendium?**  

Tendium is a tech company working in the space between technology and customers. Through advanced machine-learning technologies, we are revolutionising industries with modern, efficient methods, creating new possibilities to democratise both the public and private sector markets. The team at Tendium is expanding, with everyone from data scientists to salespeople working side by side, and now we want you to join us.


We are an ever-growing company comprised of some of the sharpest minds in Sweden. With such talent, we at Tendium naturally believe in a flat hierarchy where everyone has responsibility, autonomy, and the opportunity to provide input. Since we are increasing in size significantly, new opportunities are constantly emerging. We require ambitious, conscientious, and value-driven new colleagues to help grow the business. If you are successful in becoming a part of our team, we promise to provide a dynamic and intellectually stimulating workplace. We believe that personal and professional development is crucial, and as such, you will have the opportunity to take on real responsibility from day one.

**The Job**  

As a frontend-focused software engineer, you'll work in an agile, self-sufficient team with full ownership of the products and features you develop. The work is organised into project cycles, balancing larger projects with smaller tasks. Many projects require cross-team collaboration, creating a dynamic and cooperative work environment. Each team possesses a wide range of skills, including backend, frontend, infrastructure, and dev-ops.  

  

As a member of the Super1 Team, you will work together with the other developers in your team, closely with the product side as well as developers in the rest of the tech organisation. The team's area of responsibility within the organisation is developing and maintaining our customer-facing web platform. As a frontend developer in the team you will be working with developing new user-facing features, building reusable components and libraries, and collaborating closely with our backend developers and designers to ensure a good UX/UI experience. We encourage a high level of knowledge sharing, where you learn from and coach others in the team's development and strive for maintaining and implementing a high level of code quality and best practices.


We strive to use state-of-the-art technology and stay at the forefront of development. Agile practices ensure we build minimum viable products with high-quality code. We encourage all team members to contribute ideas, regardless of their expertise.


We prefer candidates based in Stockholm and value in-person collaboration. While we operate in a hybrid environment, we thrive on working together in the office, fostering a friendly and informal atmosphere.  

  

*This is a permanent full-time position (swe: tillsvidareanställning) with a 6-month probation period.*

 **Requirements:**

* Relevant MSc degree in Computer Science, Media Technology, or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in frontend development with React.
* Experience with frontend architecture.
* Residence in Stockholm or surrounding areas.
* High proficiency in English.
* Eligible to work in Sweden.


**Meritorious****:**


* Experience with GraphQL.


**Our current stack:**


* + Frontend: React/TypeScript
	+ Backend: GraphQL/TypeScript

**Who We Are Looking For**  

For this position, we seek an individual who can demonstrate responsibility and initiative. You should value structure and possess a good ability to write readable and high-quality code. At Tendium, our tech teams prioritise continuous delivery, aiming for quality code without over-engineering. We appreciate constructive problem-solving and a willingness to take on new tasks and technologies. We value continuous learning and improvement, whether through deep expertise in one area or broad skill development.



Effective teamwork is essential and we are looking for those qualities in you. Ideal candidates should have at least three years of frontend development experience, preferably gained in professional settings.


**Application**  

We look forward to your application. We recruit on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. Successful candidates will initially be invited to a video interview where you will have the opportunity to meet the team.  



To make this process even more efficient, feel free to sign in to your Connect profile and add your references at any stage.

  


Please find additional information on our recruitment process *here.*  

If you want to know more about our culture and what you can expect when working at Tendium you can read more about it*here.*  

  

**Equality and inclusion statement**  

At Tendium we celebrate diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, recognising that a diverse team enhances creativity and innovation. Join us in creating an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute their unique perspectives.

title: Game Designer
description:
**Join an Award-Winning Team!**  

  

We’re a recognized, award-winning company known for our outstanding work and company culture. At Just For The Win you’ll be surrounded by talented, supportive colleagues who genuinely enjoy working together. We believe in collaboration, innovation, and creating an environment where everyone can thrive. If you’re looking for a workplace that values both professional growth and great team spirit, we’d love to have you on board!  

  

**Job Overview**


We are looking for a talented **Game Designer** with a passion for digital slot machines. In this role, you will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and refining slot game mechanics, themes, and fun features. You will collaborate closely with developers, artists, and mathematicians to create compelling gameplay that keeps players engaged.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and develop new slot game concepts, mechanics, and features
* Create detailed game design documents, including layouts, gameplay mechanics, and dynamics
* Work closely with artists, developers, and sound designers to bring games to life
* Ensure games comply with regulatory and market-specific requirements
* Conduct research on player behaviors, industry trends, and competitor games to optimize player engagement
* Balance and tune game mechanics to ensure an enjoyable and fair player experience
* Collaborate with data analysts to refine games based on player feedback and performance metrics

Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in digital gaming  
* 

**Qualifications**

* 3+ years of experience in game design, preferably in the digital slot machine or casino gaming industry
* Strong understanding of slot game mechanics and math models
* Experience with game design documentation, wireframing, and prototyping
* Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate design ideas effectively
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Good communication and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively guide and motivate a team
* Passion for gaming and a keen eye for detail

Proficiency in English is essential for this role  
* 

**Bonus Skills:**

* Knowledge of player psychology and engagement strategies for slot games
* Experience working with RNG-based game systems
* Understanding of compliance and regulations in the online gaming industry
* Background in graphic design, animation, or UI/UX design

Working with ChatGTP, Midjourney or other AI tools for concepting  
* 

**What we offer**

  

* Work in a collaborative, dynamic company
* Hybrid work opportunity
* Opportunity to influence quality of product, refine processes, and implement your ideas
* 30 paid vacation days per year
* Pension plan
* Professional growth
* Conferences, events and team building

 **All applicants must be eligible to work in Sweden.**

*Just For The Win is an award-winning game studio founded in 2016. It employs 50+ creative, professional, and inspirational people in its fields, representing over 15 nationalities. Just For The Win has been awarded the Gasell by Dagens Industri, two years in a row, and the Sweden Tech Fast 50 by Deloitte for being one of the fastest-growing companies in Sweden.*

title: Junior Application Configuration Specialist (fixed term)
description:
**Responsibilities**


As an Application Configuration Specialist at Benify, you will be responsible for ensuring the portal aligns with both internal and external requirements, managing the process from portal creation to launch. Your role involves designing, building, and updating benefit solutions according to business rules within the Benify platform for our international clients.


You will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, as well as globally dispersed cross-functional teams. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to contribute to and support the product roadmap to facilitate further improvements. While you will be part of the Application Configuration function, your daily work will take place in an Agile squad alongside various other functions to ensure successful implementation, delivering a coherent, compliant, and fully tested solution.


As an Application Configuration Specialist, you will:

* Work in a T-Shaped manner within an Agile cross-functional globally dispersed squad, owning the full delivery lifecycle.
* Become an expert in the functionalities of Benify's platform – from creating a new portal to Go-live.
* Design, build, update and quality assure the configuration of all types of Benefits in line with best practices, business rules and financial details.
* Collaborate with clients to meet eligibility requirements within the portal, including attending client meetings to consult on our products.
* Troubleshoot and investigate configuration issues.
* Contribute and support the product roadmap.

**Personal Attributes**


We are looking for a strong **problem solver** to troubleshoot and resolve diverse issues and client requirements. You'll **collaborate** with both internal and external stakeholders, so confidence in **communication** is key. **Attention to detail** is crucial, as is the ability to take initiative and contribute to developing new ways of working within the team.


We are looking for candidates who have:

* Bachelor's degree in systems science, Web design, Media technology, Business Administration or equivalent
* Around 6 months experience in web design, UX/UI or application specialization
* Some experience from writing HTML code
* Proficient in English, both oral and written

**The company**

Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 550 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1500 customers and approximately three million users around the world . We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included "Because People Matter".

**Perks of being a Benifyer**

* Collective agreement
* Generous wellness allowance
* 30 days vacation
* ITP1 Pension and Lifeplan - a pension tool that provides you with personalized advice to optimize your retirement planning
* Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid work model
* A variety of social events and activities in the offices
* You're responsible for your own development and we offer internal career opportunities

**Practical information**


Start: As soon as we find the right fit!


Extent: Full-time, 100%- fixed term until March 2026


Location: Stockholm or Gothenburg, Sweden.


*Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.*

*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*

title: Content Manager Web
description:
**Är du en talang inom content och digital försäljning?**

Winn Hotel Group söker en **Content Manager** som vill jobba med webbar som engagerar och driver försäljningsresultat! Hos oss får du jobba med flera olika varumärken och sidor. Du kommer att sitta tillsammans med Winn Hotel Groups kommersiella team centralt i Stockholm. Tjänsten är ett vikariat på 1 år.


**Om rollen:**


Som Content Manager Web blir du en viktig del av vårt digitala team, där du skapar webbinnehåll för våra hemsidor. Du kommer att få jobba med flera olika av våra varumärken. Du kommer skapa landningssidor, förbättra befintligt material, göra konverteringsoptimeringar och hålla sidorna uppdaterade med nya paket och erbjudanden.


**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter:**


* Redaktionellt arbete på alla webbar som hanteras av Winns centrala team
* Skapa landningssidor med fokus på konvertering
* Copy och bildredigering
* Samarbeta med vårt team för att bidra till att alla kampanjer är synkroniserade och effektiva
* A/B-testning
* Webanalys i Google Analytics
* Enklare UX och design i Webflow

**Vem du är:**


* Du har en relevant utbildning eller arbetslivserfarenhet som t.ex webbredaktör eller content manager
* Erfarenhet av CMS och med fördel Webflow
* Erfarenhet av SEO och CRO är ett plus
* Du ska ha jobbat med innehåll för web eller digitala plattformar
* Du är en kreativ och affärsmässig person som vågar testa nytt och har ett genuint intresse för digital försäljning
* Flytande i svenska och engelska i skrift.

**Vi erbjuder:**


En kreativ och inspirerande miljö där du får utrymme att växa och utvecklas! Här får du arbeta med ett engagerat team där ditt arbete får ett direkt genomslag på våra hotellvarumärken och deras framgång.


* Kollektivavtal med pensionsavsättning
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Personalrabatt på Winn Hotel Groups hotell och restauranger för dig och din familj

  

**Anställningsform:** Vikariat 1 år

**Tillträde:** Enligt överenskommelse


**Lön:** Enligt överenskommelse


**Plats:** Centralt i Stockholm

  



**Sök rollen som Content Manager Web idag och bli en del av vårt marknadsteam!**

  



***Om Winn Hotel Group:***  

*Winn Hotel Group AB är en hotellkoncern med huvudkontor i Gävle och är ett av få bolag i Sverige som specialiserat sig på hotell- och restaurangmanagement under olika varumärken. Det innebär att våra 12 hotell har olika utseenden, namn och företagsidentiteter. En del är designade cityhotell, medan andra är moderna möteshotell i unika miljöer. En del äger vi själva, andra driver vi i samarbete med hotellkedjor som Strawberry och Radisson Hotel Group. Läs mer om oss på* *winn.se*

title: UX Designer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Collaborate across Business Areas, Group Functions and IT departments and solution suppliers to enhance the user experience.
* Conduct interviews with key stakeholders and operations representatives to gather insights and requirements.
* Assess current solution and explore the possibilities offered by the latest platform version
* Design and define UX solutions that engage business operations and streamline daily workflows.
* Engage with ongoing cyber security initiative to ensure compliance with initiative needs

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Strong leadership experience to independently drive the project
* Strong teamwork abilities, self-motivated, with a commitment to delivering impactful results
* Proven experience in UX strategy and design
* Basic understanding of IT-security principles
* 3-8 years relevant experience

  

**Meritorious**  

* Knowledge of working according to agile principles
* Experience from software development
* Strong Communication and Stakeholder skills

  

**Application deadline:** 21-02-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Affärsutvecklande konsultchef
description:
Som Affärsutvecklande konsultchef på Drakryggen kommer du att spela en avgörande roll för dina medarbetares välmående och personliga utveckling samt för verksamhetens utveckling mot en betydande hållbarhetsaktör inom IT-området i Göteborgsregionen.
  

  

Du kommer nå framgång i din roll genom ditt naturliga engagemang i medarbetarnas utveckling samt genom ditt självgående driv att nå affärsmässig framgång. Du kommer ha ett starkt stöd av ledningsgruppen och med stor frihet kunna använda din expertis och tidigare erfarenhet för att lyfta verksamheten till nästa nivå.

#### **Dina ansvarsområden**

* Personalansvar för vårt Göteborgsteam, idag bestående av fem personer som jobbar inom systemutveckling, UX och projektledning.
* Etablera och upprätthålla ett relevant affärsnätverk för att identifiera och skapa affärsmöjligheter.
* Taktiskt och operativt jobba för att attrahera och rekrytera talangfulla medarbetare som drivs av samma värderingar som Drakryggen.
* Ansvara för att utveckla och stärka företagets varumärke på den lokala marknaden i Göteborgsregionen.

#### **Dina kvalifikationer**

* Intresse för och erfarenhet av personalledning
* Ett starkt affärsnätverk inom IT-området i Göteborgsregionen
* Framgångsrikt nått resultat inom försäljning och affärsutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av rekrytering samt utveckling av varumärkesstrategier.
* Du är så pass tekniskt kunnig och verbal inom IT-området att du kan föra professionella värdeskapande dialoger med potentiella eller befintliga kunder.

#### **Personliga egenskaper**

* Du känner dig naturligt överens med Drakryggens värdegrund - att vara ett prestigelöst företag uppbyggt av professionella individer som står tryggt i humana värderingar där alla har ett lika värde.
* Du inspireras av och vill bidra till Drakryggens engagemang för en hållbar framtid.
* Du är en ödmjuk och resursstark ledare med en stark drivkraft att nå resultat.
* Du är starkt självmotiverad och kan identifiera, prioritera och utföra relevanta uppgifter för verksamhetens välmående utveckling.
* Du är en prestigelös lagspelare med långsiktigt perspektiv i din roll hos oss.


Vi uppmuntrar ansökningar från personer av alla kön och bakgrunder för att återspegla den mångfald som finns inom vårt företag och samhället stort.


Du behöver dock tala svenska och engelska på en professionell nivå och ha rättighet att bo och arbeta i Sverige.

#### **Vilka är Drakryggen?**


Vi på Drakryggen vill göra saker som är roliga eller viktiga. Och utvecklande. Ibland är det vi gör både roligt och viktigt samtidigt som det är utvecklande. Då har vi lyckats.


Du kanske undrar vad vi menar med viktigt? Vi definierar det som att allt som positivt bidrar till något av de 17 globala hållbarhetsmålen är viktigt.

#### **Vad kan vi erbjuda?**


Vi tror på en hälsosam arbetslivsbalans och en miljö som bidrar till teamets utveckling. Du får inom rimliga ramar fri arbetsplats och flexibel arbetstid. Marknadsmässig men ej marknadsledande lön. Vi ger dig möjligheter att utveckla nya färdigheter i en inkluderande arbetsmiljö tillsammans med proffsiga och ödmjuka kollegor.


Du kan läsa mer om Drakryggen och om oss som redan jobbar här på vår **hemsida**.

title: Integrations Product Manager
description:
Pleo is the spending solution for forward-thinking teams 💪
   

  

 We empower employees of thousands of companies through smart virtual and physical cards and a modern expense management app 🙏
   

  

 Cash is old school. We want every employee to feel valued and trusted when spending company money. After all, if you're trusted enough to be hired, you should be trusted enough to spend money responsibly!
   

  

 We are now looking for a new star to come in and help us build and grow our
 **Integration Management team 🚀**
 We are a fairly new team - and we are looking for someone equally motivated who wants to make their mark, help us shape things, and have a sizeable impact on the growth of Pleo. If this gets you excited, please keep reading!
   

  

 But let us introduce you to the domain this role will be part of 💪
   

  

 The
 **Integration Management team** 
 ensures the seamless availability of Pleo across the software and service ecosystem, through the creation of high-impact distribution partnerships and powerful product integrations.
   

  

 As part of the
 **Integration Management team** 
 , you will be directly responsible for growing and expanding Pleo’s technical integration capabilities, by building integrations with Europe’s most commonly used and loved SaaS providers, including accounting software, HR software, Payroll systems, Project Management systems, and merchants. The creation of these integrations is a key component of Pleo’s long-term strategy to become a key ecosystem player.
   

  

**What Is Expected In The Role... 💡**
* Find and engage with partners to build integrations with Pleo, and manage incoming requests from partners wanting to build and publish a Pleo integration
* Support partners to understand the Pleo product and how to build an integration, answering questions about Pleo, the APIs, and publishing processes
* Partner with Sales, Customer Success, Support, Product, Engineering, and partners to advocate for integration development in line with customer needs
* Manage partners and help them through the process of designing, building, and publishing an integration/ application. Help to design and safeguard the user experience of integrations being built and published, and as always, act as a main point of contact about the Pleo product and Pleo APIs
* Support internal teams in designing building, and publishing integrations between Pleo and other products
* Request, feedback on, and validate partner proposals, including commercial, product, UX, and technical aspects
* Be the primary interface and single point of contact between a partner and Pleo, and coordinate contact with different teams and people throughout Pleo
* Work with product teams and drive product improvements by collecting product and API feedback from partners and customers
* Continuously improve playbooks, processes, technical and process documentation, and experience, to improve the overall experience for external developers, and ultimately lower the Pleo partner time and effort needed for an integration
* Manage the coordination and success of go-live for integrations, and ensure value from integrations through internal (Sales, CX, CS) enablement. Continuously improve playbooks and processes to streamline the launch of, and maximize, the impact from new integrations
* Become a subject matter expert in how Pleo best integrates with other types of software, and, on all existing and new integrations.


**What Great Looks Like ⭐️**
* Experience in driving the process of defining, building, and launching integrations with partners and internal teams, from start to value
* Knows what it takes to effectively manage relationships with partners, whilst supporting them in the process
* Holds experience in managing the technical and delivery aspects of 3rd party integrations, whilst aligning closely with support and product development teams where needed
* Possesses the ability to work cross-functionally across commercial and product development functions, being able to find support when blocked, and gain important insights to maximise value
* Has the ability to evaluate, negotiate, and agree on partner agreements that are commercially viable for Pleo
* Possesses great attention to detail, and the ability to read documentation in order to guide partners in how best to integrate Pleo with other products from user experience and data mapping perspectives
* The willingness to learn and become fluent in the Pleo product and APIs
* Possesses strong project management and time management skills
* Holds the ability to work as an individual contributor with minimal supervision
* Knows how to anticipate customer needs in the context of the Pleo product and champion the customer


**Nice to haves 📋**
* Hold experience working with integrations in the accounting/ ERP and IDP/ HRIS space
* Knows what it takes to work with partners to build integrations and apps for SaaS customers
* Possess experience working in SaaS and financial or accounting services
* Experience in outlining user flows and creating wireframe designs


**Your colleagues say you 👇**
* Are structured and have an eye for detail, always putting the customer first
* Are proactive and have a strong sense of ownership and drive
* Are adaptable and open to finding new ways of problem-solving


**Show me the benefits! 🥁**
* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
* Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
* For our Partnerships team we offer flexible and remote working
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please be aware that a valid work permit is a mandatory requirement to be considered for the role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
* Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
* Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
* Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
* Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements


**Requirements**
* Expert level UX and UI design skills
* Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
* Highly proficient in Figma
* Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
* You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
* Genuine passion for great UX
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
* Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
* Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
**Do you want to join the technological revolution? Tendium is looking for a
 *UX/UI Designer* 
 to join the team.** 




  





 Do you consider yourself a visionary thinker on the prowl for a fresh challenge? Do you also have a proven track record in the SaaS industry? Then we want you to join us on our journey!
 



  





**Why Tendium** 




 Tendium is a tech company working in the space between technology and customers. Through advanced machine-learning technologies, we are revolutionising industries with modern, efficient methods, creating new possibilities to democratise both the public and the private sector markets. The team at Tendium is expanding, with everyone from data scientists to salespeople working side by side, and now we want you to join us.
 



  





 We are an ever-growing company comprised of some of the sharpest minds in Sweden. With such talent, we at Tendium naturally believe in a flat hierarchy, where everyone has responsibility, autonomy and the opportunity to provide input. Since we are increasing in size significantly, new opportunities are emerging constantly. We require ambitious, conscientious and value-driven new colleagues to help grow the business. If you are successful in becoming a part of our team, we promise to provide a dynamic, intellectually stimulating workplace. We believe that personal and professional development is crucial and as such you will have the opportunity to take on real responsibility from day one.
 



  





**The Job** 




 As a UX/UI Designer at Tendium you will play a pivotal role in driving the creative direction and design strategy of our organisation. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product Owners, Software Engineers, and our Marketing Team, to ensure that design initiatives are seamlessly integrated into our products and services.
 



  





 We imagine that you will be responsible for guiding and inspiring our team to create innovative and impactful solutions. Your excellent design knowledge and leadership skills will be instrumental in creating our brand's future and bringing our users only the best possible experiences.
 



  





 Simply put, you have a passion for design, innovation, and a keen eye for detail.
 



  





*We are primarily looking for candidates in Stockholm and the surrounding areas. This is a full-time position with a 6-month probationary period.* 




  





**As a UX/UI Designer at Tendium, your main focus areas will be:** 



* Setting the creative direction and design standards for our organisation, ensuring that our design language and brand identity are consistently upheld across all touchpoints.
* Collaborate with Product Owners, Software Engineers, and other stakeholders to define design goals, requirements, and project timelines, and develop strategies to meet those objectives.
* Drive the end-to-end design process, including research, ideation, concept development, prototyping, and execution, while ensuring a user-centered approach.
* Turning complex user flows and advanced features into intuitive, seamless experiences by seeing the big picture and optimising connections.
* Create and maintain design systems, style guides, and UI/UX patterns to streamline design workflows and ensure consistency.
* Conduct regular design reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure high-quality design outputs and continuous improvement.
* Stay updated with the latest design trends, tools, and technologies, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance our design capabilities.
* Advocate for user experience and accessibility, championing the importance of usability, clarity, and inclusivity in all design deliverables.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse user feedback, conduct usability testing, and iterate on designs to optimise user satisfaction and engagement.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 3+ years of experience working in a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced and innovative tech-environment.
* Previous experience working as a Designer for SaaS companies.
* Proficiency in using Figma.
* Bachelor's degree in design, visual communication, or a related field.
* Strong portfolio showcasing your design expertise across a variety of projects, including digital interfaces (and preferably prototypes and process of the same), print materials, branding, and visual storytelling.
* Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritise tasks, manage timelines, and drive projects to completion.
* Experience with design thinking methodologies and conducting user research is highly desirable.



  





**It is merited if one or more of the following points apply to you:** 



* 5+ years of experience designing for SaaS companies.
* Knowledge of front-end development technologies is a plus.
* Proficiency in creating clickable prototypes.



  





**Application** 




 We look forward to your application. We recruit on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. Successful candidates will initially be invited to an initial interview where you will have the opportunity to meet the team.
 



  





 To make this process even more efficient, feel free to sign in to your Connect profile and add your references at any stage.
 



  





 Please find additional information on our recruitment process
 *here.* 
 If you want to know more about our culture and what you can expect when working at Tendium you can read more about it
 *here.* 




  





**Equality and inclusion statement** 




 At Tendium we celebrate diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, recognising that a diverse team enhances creativity and innovation. Join us in creating an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute their unique perspectives.

title: Visual Designer Intern
description:
**About Braive:** 




 Braive offers a mental health treatment platform that helps clients and supports clinicians by delivering evidence-based treatment programs (ICBT), diagnostic screenings, and AI-supported clinical tools.
 



  





 Braive is improving access to mental healthcare services and helping people all over the world who suffer from mental health issues, such as depression, anxiety, and work-related stress. By utilizing AI and ML, we can go beyond traditional research in predicting treatment trajectories and recommending effective treatment protocols.
 



  





**Your Role:** 




 We are looking for a
 **Visual Designer Intern** 
 to join our team. You will play a key role in creating compelling visual assets that enhance our brand and support our marketing and sales efforts. Your work will span across a variety of materials, from marketing presentations to social media content, as well as helping us prepare for expos and events.
 



  





 You will work closely with our Head of Communication and Engagement, who will be your primary mentor, and collaborate with the sales team and designers to ensure our visual messaging aligns with our brand strategy.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Design visual assets** 
 for marketing and sales, including roll-ups, flyers, posters, and other visual material.
* **Assist in designing our new website.**
* **Develop new vector graphics** 
 and custom illustrations from scratch.
* **Design compelling social media posts for LinkedIn** 
 and other social media platforms.
* **Assist in the creation of** 
**marketing and sales presentations** 
 that effectively communicate our value.
* **Ensure consistency in branding and messaging** 
 across all visual materials.
* **Contribute to increasing brand awareness** 
 through engaging visual content and strategic design.
* BONUS: Be able to create
 **simple vector animations** 
 .



  





**What We Offer:** 



* **Real Impact** 
 : Contribute to a mission-driven company improving mental healthcare worldwide.
* **Mentorship & Growth** 
 : Work closely with experienced professionals in marketing, communication and design.
* **Creative Freedom** 
 : Opportunity to experiment with new design concepts and bring ideas to life.
* **Flexible Working Hours** 
 : We understand the importance of work-life balance.
* **Monthly Mental Health Days** 
 : Your well-being matters to us.
* **Cozy Office Location** 
 : A welcoming office in
 **Gamla Stan, Stockholm** 
 .



  





**Who You Are:** 



* **Proficient in Figma, or Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), or any equivalent design tool**
* **Strong design skills** 
 with an eye for typography, layout, and branding consistency.
* **Looking for experience in creating marketing materials** 
 , such as flyers, posters, and presentations.
* **Basic knowledge of web design** 
 .
* **Ability to create vector graphics** 
 and develop unique illustrations.
* **Ability to collaborate** 
 effectively and meet deadlines.
* **Self-motivated and eager to learn** 
 , with a passion for branding and visual storytelling.
* **Experience with social media graphics** 
 , especially for LinkedIn, is a plus.
* **Bonus** 
 : Basic motion design skills for
 **simple vector animations** 
 (e.g., After Effects, Lottie).



  





**About the Role:** 



* **Stockholm-based** 
 – work from our office in Gamla Stan.
* **Start date:** 
 Flexible, but preferably start as soon as possible.
* **Internship Duration:** 
 4-6 months.
* **Full-time position** 
 .
* **You** 
**must have a valid work visa in Sweden** 
 .



  





**Join Us:** 




 Become a part of Braive and help shape the future of mental healthcare through the power of visual storytelling, design, and brand awareness. If you're a creative thinker looking to expand your design skills in a supportive and innovative company, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Designer
description:
Vi söker en designer med minst 5 år på CV:et. Erfarenhet från byrå eller som frilans är ett plus. Du gillar att jobba tvärs över alla discipliner – reklam, design, digitalt, film, event och innovation. Känslan för design har du och jobbar obehindrat i creative suite gör du. Utöver det vet du vad det innebär att jobba i team och kan lyssna, argumentera och sälja dina och byråns idéer. Samtidigt ställer du dig ödmjuk inför våra kunders erfarenhet, kompetens och förutsättningar. Du står stadigt med båda fötterna på jorden och är samtidigt beredd på lite skit under naglarna. Hos oss är det högt och lågt oavsett uppdrag och alltid med fullt fokus på kund. Vilka är vi? Humblestorm är en
 



 fullservicebyrå med kontor på Jungfrugatan i Stockholm. Vi har funnits sedan 2002 och jobbar idag nordiskt med kunder som Mastercard, Spotify, F-Secure, Telia, Workday med flera.
 



  





 Ansök gärna direkt via LinkedIn. Portfolio kan även skickas till: jobb@humblestorm.se

title: Grafisk Designer
description:
**Grafisk Designer – Vikariat 10 månader** 




 Är du en idéstark och initiativtagande designer som vill utvecklas i en dynamisk byråmiljö? Då kan detta vara något för dig!
 



 Vi söker en
 **designer** 
 i början av karriären, gärna med viss erfarenhet från en etablerad byrå. Du har en naturlig känsla för koncept och det stora perspektivet, men är också snabb, lösningsorienterad och drivs av att förverkliga idéer i genomtänkt design.
 



**Hos oss får du:** 




 ·      Driva projekt tillsammans med kunder och kreatörer.
 



 ·      Arbeta med design för varumärken, sajter och trycksaker.
 



 ·      Bli en del av ett prestigelöst och engagerat team där idéhöjd möter hantverk.
 



 Du är
 **full av idéer, har ett starkt hantverkskunnande och är en lagspelare** 
 , samtidigt som du tar egna initiativ och gillar att jobba både självständigt och i team. Du besitter djup kunskap om typografi och layout och är av uppfattningen att bra design bygger på starka idéer. Självklart är du vass i hela Adobe-sviten samt Figma.
 



  





**Tjänsten är ett vikariat på 10 månader med start 1 april.** 
**Skicka din ansökan till** 
**career@hummingbirds.se** 
**senast 21 februari.**




**Om oss:** 




 Hummingbirds the Hybrid Agency är en specialistbyrå som i över 20 år har hjälpt förflytta varumärken. Vi kombinerar strategi, koncept, design och kommunikation för att skapa effekt. Vi skapar allt från kampanjer och förpackningsdesign till varumärkesidentiteter och digitala kampanjer.
 


* Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: iOS Developer Intern
company_industry: Software Development and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated IOS Developer Intern to join our team for an Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in frontend development and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



 As an IOS Developer Intern at XR Solutions, you will work closely with our developers.
 



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficient in using Xcode - mainly oriented on
 **SwiftUI.**
* Perfect understanding of
 **async/await** 
 ,
 **actors** 
 and
 **multithreading** 
 .
* Experience utilizing
 **API's** 
 in Swift code.
* Ability to implement clean and structured SwiftUI Views according to
 **Figma** 
 designs.
* Basic understanding of UX/UI designs methods.
* Proficiency using
 **Git tools** 
 (
 **GitHub** 
 ,
 **Bitbucket** 
 ) in team environment.
* Experience with
 **ARKit** 
 /
 **RealityKit** 
*(Meritorious).*
* Aware of latest features that Swift language adds like
 **SwiftData** 
 ,
 **Observation** 
 ,
 **SwiftTest**

 **Xcode** 
 ,
 **ARkit, Hoppscotch, Unity.**

 **AWS** 
 (Amazon Web Services),
 **CI/CD pipelines.**
* Project Management:
 **Jira** 
 for task management and collaboration.

 for team communication and coordination.

 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in IOS development.
