We believe machine learning and AI are about to redefine what it means to be a creative, who can be part of a creative process and that creativity and AI are a uniquely powerful combination and an incredibly exciting field work in. We pride ourselves on our ability to rapidly adopt new developments, stay curious, and adapt quickly to changing circumstances.
 



  





**In this role you will** 




 Do R&D
 


* Stay up to date with the latest research and advancements in the field of visual generative AI and machine learning.
* Design, prototype, and evaluate new models and approaches that push the boundaries of what's possible.
* Conduct experiments that drive product innovation and uncover novel solutions.



  





 Build and launch
 


* Implement state-of-the-art machine learning models with clean and efficient code.
* Set up infrastructure and tools for fine-tuning and deploying models at scale.
* Build and maintain data pipelines needed for your models.
* Work closely with our engineering team to ensure seamless functionality and a high-quality user experience.
* Monitor the performance of deployed models, making necessary adjustments to improve accuracy, efficiency and creativity.
* Work closely with product managers, designers and engineers, to help shape the direction of our product.



  





**In your first** 




 Week
 


* Set up your local development environment and dive into our codebase and existing model architectures.
* Explore our product—experiment with generating art.
* Deliver a small bug fix or quality-of-life improvement to production.



  





 3 Months
 


* Review the performance and retrain many of our production models.
* Conduct experiments and iterate on your models, incorporating feedback from the team and customers.
* Develop at least one novel approach to solve a customer need.
* Set up monitoring and alerts for all critical AI infrastructure.



  





 6 Months
 


* Develop deep expertise in visual generative AI.
* Optimize our model deployment and training infrastructure to drive enhanced performance while improving cost-efficiency.
* Accelerate our R&D process to drive continuous product innovation.



  





**You'll be a great fit if** 




 Requirements
 


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (Master's or Ph.D. in related fields preferred) or equivalent work experience.
* 3+ years of hands-on experience with machine learning projects, focusing on visual/generative AI (computer vision, diffusion models, transformers).
* Solid understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques, as well as their underlying mathematical principles.
* Experience transforming research projects into scalable production services.
* Proficiency in Python and strong overall programming skills.



  





 Nice to have
 


* Strong interest in creative applications of AI and a passion for pushing boundaries.
* Contributions to AI research or applications in the form of publications or open-source projects.
* Familiarity with advanced diffusion pipelines.
* Experience deploying to GPU-accelerated cloud environments.
* Prioritize delivering value to users over perfecting models.



  





**What we offer** 



* A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to contribute to the development of a groundbreaking creative product.
* A supportive, collaborative, and innovative work environment with a team of like-minded individuals.
* An opportunity to join an early-stage company and influence how we build the company before there are too many processes and structures in place.
* Competitive salary and an attractive equity program in a start-up funded by top investors Creandum (1st investor Spotify, iZettle, depop) and EQT Ventures (Einride, Sonantic). 🦄
* A learning environment, with interesting challenges to solve and an ambitious team to support you.
* Office located in the heart of Stockholm.
* Work in an organisation where AI is not an afterthought and a “side interest” but something that is there and has a seat at the table from the start.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on backend technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern technologies.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer with a genuine enthusiasm in building robust solutions to power innovative digital experiences.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Backend Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Building high-performance backend systems using modern languages like Go, NodeJS, Python, and Kotlin to power innovative experiences
* Using modern backend frameworks such as Fiber, Ktor, Express and FastAPI to create robust solutions.
* Designing and implementing cloud-native solutions across AWS, GCP and Azure, using Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) for resource management
* Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines with containerized deployments and scaling strategies
* Developing robust data models and database architectures to support application requirements
* Participating in projects & teams alongside some of the largest and most forward-thinking brands on the planet


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

**Career Framework**
 We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance**
 At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

**Innovations And Learning**
 Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

**Skills Over Degrees**
 We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

 Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?
   

  

 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Teknisk testare till kund i offentlig sektor
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Teknisk testare med 5+ års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Du kommer att spela en ledande roll i att skapa och upprätthålla automatiserade testlösningar som säkerställer kvaliteten på mjukvaruprodukter och system. Du kommer attansvara för att utforma, implementera och optimera automatiserade testfall. Du kommer ha ett nära samarbete medmjukvaruutvecklingsteam för att säkerställa att produkterna uppfyller höga kvalitetsstandarder.
   

  

 Som teammedlem hos oss på CGI får du möjlighet att vara med och förändra på riktigt. Du får skapa lösningar tillsammans med våra kunder, som bidrar till att skapa hållbara resultat för det samhälle vi lever i. Det kan handla om att skapa effektiva och innovativa lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att leverera bättre service, öka sin säkerhet eller effektivisera sin verksamhet
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Att jobba som konsult på CGI innebär en omväxlande vardag. I rollen som teknisk testare i våra nu aktuella agila utvecklingsteam erbjuds du möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult i projekt som vi driver åt kund. Som konsult på CGI kommer du dessutom över tid att erbjudas många andra möjligheter till utvecklande uppdrag, såväl lokalt som globalt.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Erfarenhet av manuella eller automatiserade tester, API-tester och verktyg som ReadyAPI eller Postman.
   

  

* Kunskaper inom prestanda, säkerhet och användarvänlighet.
* Certifiering enligt ISTQB (minst Foundation).
* God förståelse för systemutveckling och agila metoder.
* Obehindrat kunna tala och skriva på svenska.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Solutions Engineer (EMEA) - GelatoConnect
description:
**Job Title** 
 : Solutions Engineer (EMEA) - GelatoConnect
 



**Locations** 
 : London, Berlin, Barcelona, Madrid, Stockholm or Oslo
 



  





**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**What You Will Be Doing** 




 Gelato sits at the intersection of critical global trends: the rise of the creator economy, evolving global supply chains, the rapid growth of e-commerce, and the shift toward more sustainable production methods. These trends are transforming the printing industry, creating new opportunities for printers to scale efficiently and profitably. GelatoConnect empowers printers by providing an integrated production platform that addresses these challenges.
 



  





 As a
 **Solutions Engineer** 
 for GelatoConnect, you will collaborate with internal teams and customers to design solutions that meet customer requirements while demonstrating the full value of GelatoConnect. You will play a critical role in the sales process, bridging the gap between technical functionality and business needs.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Collaborate with the sales team to understand customer needs and requirements.
* Work with customers to gather requirements and understand their business challenges.
* Prepare and deliver technical presentations and product demonstrations to existing and new customers.
* Develop proposals, including scope, cost estimates, and implementation timelines.
* Design and recommend solutions that meet customer needs
* Answer technical questions and address customer concerns during the sales process.
* Provide input on sales strategies and tactics to improve customer engagement.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, acting as a trusted advisor.
* Conduct training sessions and workshops for customers and internal teams.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, product, engineering, and customer support, to align service delivery with overall business objectives, prioritize customer needs, and drive product enhancements based on customer feedback.
* Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive products.
* Enable Account Executives to provide overview product demonstrations.



  





**Who you are** 




 You have a start-up mentality, incredible stamina, resilience, and grit. You’re a doer. You change until you win. You feel comfortable getting your hands dirty while never losing sight of long-term ambition. You are confident in your abilities and experience, yet humble and curious in your execution. Embracing change, complexity, and ambiguity while also navigating a little bit of chaos is essential for success in this role. Working in Gelato means not only thriving in such an environment, but also finding comfort in being uncomfortable.
 



  





**Our requirements for the role include:** 



* Experience working directly with commercial printers, ideally in a product specialist role.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, business, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience (3+ years) in a similar role within the software industry, with a focus on presales.
* Ability to translate complex technical concepts into understandable terms for non-technical audiences.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with clients and internal teams at all levels of the organization.
* Demonstrated ability to drive results, manage stakeholder expectations, and navigate challenging situations with diplomacy and professionalism.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Familiarity with print software solutions and related technologies is a plus.



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

title: Project Manager
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


**Requirements**
* At least 10 years of experience as a Project Manager.
* Conduct a pre-study analysis on changes in the Meter-to-Cash process, considering current systems, regulations, and technological advancements.
* Collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to define the target picture, change strategy, and business case.
* Plan and secure resources, prepare the budget, monitor project progress, and ensure inter-team alignment throughout the program.
* Manage time, budget, and quality while navigating smoothly between IT and Business Units.
* Coordinate project resources, ensuring all stakeholders are kept informed throughout the program.
* Oversee stakeholder management, resource efficiency, and risk and issue management.
* Lead pre-study coordination, including the preparation of business cases and high-level architecture understanding.
* Mandatory experience in the energy market.
* Proven ability in stakeholder management, time and scope management, and risk/issue management.
* Strong understanding of high-level architecture and business process coordination.
* Strong communication and problem-solving skills.
* Structured work methodology and a results-oriented mindset.
* Ability to quickly understand new business processes, requirements, and technologies.
* Experience working with cross-European project teams and large organizations, especially in coordinating interfaces between technical and business stakeholders.


**Benefits**
* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Sommarjobb på Quality Unit
description:
Vill du ha ett meningsfullt och utvecklande sommarjobb inom kvalitetskontroll, laboratoriearbete eller kvalitetssäkring? Hos oss på Octapharma får du chansen att få praktisk erfarenhet inom din utbildning samtidigt som du bidrar till att rädda liv! Vi tillverkar biologiska läkemedel med högsta kvalitet och söker nu engagerade studenter som vill bli en del av vårt team under sommaren.
   

  

 Är du den vi letar efter?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är noggrann, analytisk och trivs i en dynamisk miljö. Du har en stark vilja att lära dig och bidrar till en positiv arbetsgemenskap.
   

  

**För att sommarjobba inom Quality Unit behöver du ha:**
* Pågående naturvetenskaplig högskoleutbildning, exempelvis apotekare, biokemi, kemiteknik, bioteknik, mikrobiologi
* Du har läst minst ett år av din utbildning
* Erfarenhet av laborativt arbete
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


 Arbetstempot kan vara högt, vilket kräver god planeringsförmåga och flexibilitet. Du är serviceinriktad, har god samarbetsförmåga och är kvalitetsmedveten
   

  

 Kandidater som är tillgänglig hela eller större delen av anställningsperioden kommer att prioriteras i urvalet.
   

  

 Våra sommarjobb är placerade på olika avdelningar och sektioner och kan innebära lite olika typer av arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Quality Unit på Octapharma
   

  

* Övergripande ansvar för kvalitetskontroll och kvalitetssäkring av våra läkemedel
* Efterlevnad av regelverk och kvalitetssäkring för omfattande system
* Tillverkning av biologiska läkemedel medför extra höga kvalitetskrav
* Arbetar tillsammans med övriga funktioner relaterat till allt från den blodplasma vi använder som råvara till slutlig frisläppning av färdig produkt till våra patienter


 Som Sommarjobbare Hos Oss Kommer Du Att Arbeta Inom Quality Unit, Som Ansvarar För Kvalitetskontroll Och Kvalitetssäkring Av Våra Läkemedel. Inom Quality Unit Finns Flera Avdelningar Med Olika Arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

**Quality Assurance, Assessment & Release, Quality in Operation och Corporate QC Stability**
* Säkerställer hög kvalitet på våra produkter
* Arbetar med kvalitetssäkring och frisläppning av våra produkter


****Här Sommarjobbar Man Bland Annat Med Att:****
* Granska och godkänna olika typer av kvalitetsdokumentation
* Hantering av instruktionssystemet
* Intern frisläppning av intermediat och färdig produkt
* Utredning av avvikelser
* Framtagande av dokumentation för t ex myndighetsfrisläppande
* Inlagring av och provuttag från stabilitetsstudier kan ingå i arbetsuppgifterna såsom en del arkivering


****QC Operations, Plasma Quality Och QiO Sterility Assurance:****
* Arbetar med kemiska, biokemiska och mikrobiologiska analyser samt levererar provsvar till berörda avdelningar
* Laboratorieingenjör hos Plasma Quality säkerställer, via minipooltestning och produktionspoolstestning med PCR-teknik, att plasmaråvaran är fri från virus
* Kvalitetsingenjör hos QiO Sterility Assurance arbetar med provtagning för att säkerställa att renhetsklassade lokaler uppfyller hygieniska krav
* Allt arbete sker i enlighet med GMP
* Utöver provtagnings- och analysarbete kan deltagande i förbättringsarbete ingå


****Här Sommarjobbar Man Bland Annat Med Att:****
* Lära sig 1–3 olika analysmetoder för att sedan självständigt kunna utföra
* Delta i det dagliga arbetet på laboratoriet
* Hjälpa till med provmottagning och skickning av prov
* Kontakt med externa laboratorier
* Arkivering och övriga administrativa sommarprojekt


*"Jag har haft tre toppensomrar på Quality Unit! Det har varit så givande att se hur mina studier faktiskt har kommit till användning i jobbet vilket har gjort arbetsuppgifterna både intressanta och engagerande. Jag har alltid känt mig väldigt välkommen i teamet och det har varit så kul att lära känna alla kollegor!”*
*/ Anna Bevin, sommarjobbare 2020-2022 och numera anställd som QC IT inom Octapharmas International Early Career Program*
 Vad är det bästa med att jobba hos oss?
   

  

* Du bidrar till att rädda liv - Varje dag är meningsfull då vi tillverkar livräddande läkemedel
* Familjära värderingar - Långsiktigt perspektiv gällande personal och relationer
* Fantastiska kollegor & värdefullt nätverk – Du får arbeta med engagerade och kunniga kollegor, bygga relationer och skapa en stark grund för din framtida karriär inom branschen
* Bistro bryggeriet – Varje dag serveras hemlagad mat och vi har ett eget bageri/kafé


 Ansök idag!
   

  

 Vi rekryteringsspecialister, Annie, Johanna och Josefina, kommer guida dig genom processen. Håll utkik efter mejlutskick från oss! Har du frågor om tjänsten, hör av dig till oss på se1rekrytering@octapharma.com.
   

  

 Vi vill redan nu informera om att vi, även fast vi gärna skulle vilja, inte har möjlighet att återkoppla individuellt på CV eller testresultat.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-28, tjänsten kan tillsättas dessförinnan.
   

  

**Så Här Går Rekryteringsprocessen Till:**
 Vi vill att vår rekrytering ska vara så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt. Därför använder vi oss av flera steg i rekryteringsprocessen:
   

  

* Arbetspsykologiska tester för ett objektivt och rättvist urval
* Kortare digital intervju
* Gruppintervju 3 och 4 april (du behöver vara tillgänglig båda dagarna)
* Obligatoriska drogtester för alla som erbjuds anställning
* Tillträde i början av juni men enligt överenskommelse med chef


 Vill du lära känna oss bättre? Lär mer om Quality Unit på vår hemsida och följ oss dag för dag på LinkedIn!

title: Music Composer and Sound Designer | Audio, Dev Services
description:
**Craft:**
**Job Description:**
 Do you want to craft immersive audio experiences that bring games to life?
   

  

 King is looking for a Music Composer and Sound Designer to join our team and help shape the soundscapes of our games. You’ll be composing original music, designing high-quality audio assets, and implementing them into our games, working closely with our development teams to ensure a polished and engaging player experience.
   

  

 As part of your application, please provide a link to a demo reel showcasing your music composition and sound design.
   

  

 Your application must be provided in English.
   

  

***This opportunity is open to Hybrid and Remote work***
**Your Role Within Our Kingdom**
* Contribute to the creative and technical execution of the game’s audio vision, ensuring consistency and quality across all assets.
* Compose, design, and implement high-quality music and sound effects using DAWs, middleware like Wwise, and game engines such as Unity.
* Record, edit, and refine audio assets, ensuring smooth integration and optimal playback across platforms.
* Test and review your work regularly with senior team members to maintain a cohesive audio style.
* Collaborate with developers, artists, producers, and marketers to enhance the game’s overall experience through audio.
* Identify opportunities for innovation in sound design and proactively propose creative and technical solutions.


**Skills To Create Thrills**
* 3-4 years of experience in game music composition and sound design for mobile or AAA games, with at least one released or live title. Together with being a team player with in-house game development experience, also be open to feedback and able to provide constructive critique.
* Experience with game audio implementation using industry tools and proprietary editors, together with strong skills in composition, sound design, editing, and mixing,
* Ability to create and implement audio across different styles, from casual to cinematic, for both in-game experiences and marketing materials.
* Solid understanding of game production processes, workflows, and pipelines.
* Be self-motivated, organized, and capable of meeting deadlines while taking ownership of your tasks.
* Have a passion for sound and music in games and other forms of audio-visual entertainment.
* Really like video games (and make sure to mention which is your favourite in your application!)


**Tasty Bonus Points**
* Experience recording and designing SFX, Foley, and voiceover (including casting and directing voice talent).
* Basic scripting knowledge for audio integration and automation.


 Join us and help shape the future of audio in King’s games! 🎵
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Key Account Manager (Sweden)
description:
*Would you like to apply your expertise in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life-changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you!*
 Our AstraZeneca Nordic Marketing Company employs around 450 people and has offices located in Espoo, Stockholm, Copenhagen, and Oslo. AstraZeneca Nordic is a recognized leader in its core therapy areas and aims to improve the lives of millions of people. This is an area where you are free to be more – you are encouraged to challenge traditional ways and test your curiosity. We drive innovative science, deliver key launches, build close collaboration and partnerships within health care.
   

  

**Introduction to role**
 We are strengthening our Sales team in Sweden and as a Key Account Manager in the Primary care team, you will become part of AstraZeneca’s strong Cardiovascular – Renal – Metabolic franchise (CVRM), one of our key growth platforms. Our responsibility includes key cardiovascular brands where we have a strong heritage and new treatments and indications to be launched in the future. The role will focus on diabetes type 2, heart failure, and chronic kidney disease. Be part of delivering our vision to be the leader in Cardiovascular, Renal, Metabolism, Respiratory, and Immunology by 2025.
   

  

 You will drive sales activities towards general practitioners in the primary care sector.
 **The role is Field based and responsible for Uppland, Västmanland, and Gävleborg** 
 .
   

  

**Accountabilities**
* Pro-actively identifying business opportunities, communicating value propositions aligned to customer needs and objectives, and recommending solutions to drive and develop business
* Develop robust understanding of needs and perceptions of prescribers and other key partners
* Drive cross-functional and cross-regional collaboration to fully maximize AZ's account management capabilities
* Secure account and market access by driving activities with the right customers within the right accounts
* Build, develop and manage long-term external relationships
* Drive and implement our digital and omnichannel approach towards our customers.


**Essential Skills/Experience**
* Relevant sales experience, preferable – but not required – from Pharma industry
* An academic degree or an equivalent healthcare or commercial background (LIF training, MGU)
* The ability to understand and communicate complex information, flexibility to adopt scientific data
* A strong commercial innovation mindset – the ability and a proven track-record of developing, shaping and completing impactful, customer/stakeholder focused activities to achieve long-term business goals
* Strong digital skills and able to drive omnichannel approach
* Good leadership skills - ability to coordinate, align and engage cross-functional team to drive activities and address needs of individual accounts
* A true teammate with high trustworthiness
* Excellent interpersonal skills and proficient in both written and spoken English and Swedish
* Ability and readiness to travel within region and according to role needs
* Driver´s license required.


**We kindly ask that you submit your CV in English.** 
 Thank you!
   

  

 We evaluate applications and extend offers on a rolling basis. If you're interested, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That's why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we're not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.
   

  

 AstraZeneca is committed to making an impact – achieving our bold ambition of eliminating cancer as a cause of death. In our Oncology Business Unit, we relentlessly follow the science, challenging the status quo to deliver more effective treatments to patients in need. Our commitment means we purposefully push back the limits of knowledge to change the practice of medicine. To ensure no patient is left behind, no matter what stage of disease. It’s our launch excellence and commercial effectiveness that will make the difference, empowering us to deliver the true value and potential of our life-changing medicines. From shaping the cancer care environment and empowering patient care teams to transforming the patient experience.
   

  

 Ready to make a difference? Apply now!

title: Senior Project Manager - Corporates PM
description:
**Main Responsibilities**
* Being the main project lead for large and complex tenant refurbishment/relocation projects.
* For smaller projects, being the project oversight ensuring the quality of project management and delivery
* Strategically advise tenants in their needs analyses, site selection and lease negotiation processes.
* Tender and procurement of consultants, suppliers, and contractors.
* Being responsible for establish and strengthen relationship with clients.
* In collaboration with colleagues, sell in and identify new potential assignments.
* Assessing and elevating the maturity level of the project management processes and tools.
* Supporting in business development for our occupier services


**Experience And Knowledge**
* At least 10 years’ of experience in a similar role as a project manager for office refurbishment/relocation projects.
* Leadership experience (not necessarily as a manager/supervisor)
* Extensive experience in managing budget and time schedule.
* Experience in advising on technical parts (project related appendices) of lease agreements
* Have worked on fit out or development projects and have experience of the construction process as well as IT, data infrastructure, AV and security solutions.
* Has knowledge and experience of government processes.
* Has understanding of change management processes related to the integration of new ways of working.
* Sees an advantage and appreciates the international business environment.
* Good communication skills in both English and Swedish.
* Highly skilled in MS projects and Office 365.


**Education**
 An academic degree relevant to the position, for example from a civil engineering programme or similar.
   

  

**Personal qualities**
 You should have a natural leadership profile with the ability to manage, direct and plan your work overall. Furthermore, you should possess good business acumen and be good at involving other project staff in the management of objectives. You should have the ability to quickly form an overall picture of complex issues and are not afraid to make decisions. As a person, you describe yourself as prestige less and somebody that proactively takes initiatives. For the role, it is important that you are someone who can build and maintain good relationships with customers, partners and suppliers, while taking great pride in doing a good job, at all levels. Furthermore, we believe that you are:
   

  

* Business driven with a holistic approach
* Accurate and analytical
* Outgoing and a good networker and relationship builder
* Good communication and teamwork skills
* Sees opportunities, enjoys challenges and has a positive attitude
* Has energy, perseverance and an inner drive
* Committed and results-oriented


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 You will be involved in growing our project management business. You will have the opportunity to work with interesting clients, both Swedish and international. You will work in an international and interdisciplinary work environment together with many competent and ambitious colleagues.
   

  

 You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
   

  

 Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay.
   

  

 Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...
   

  

 Apply today at jll.com/careers.

title: Fonus HR avdelning söker en administratör med inriktning lönehantering
company_industry: Individual and Family Services and Civic and Social Organizations
description:
*Vill du arbeta med härliga kollegor i en värderingsstyrd organisation? Då ska du läsa vidare.* 




  





  





 Fonus HR-avdelning söker en strukturerad och engagerad administratör med inriktning på lönefrågor, avtalsskrivning, pension, försäkringar och förmåner. Tjänsten är ett vikariat på heltid med start omgående till och med 30 augusti 2026.
 



  





  





**Om rollen** 




 I denna roll är du en viktig medarbetare inom HR-administration och lönehantering. Du kommer att arbeta med administrativa uppgifter kopplade till lön och personalförmåner, samt vara en viktig kontaktperson för både chefer, medarbetare och vår outsourcade lönebyrå. Några av arbetsuppgifterna är att:
 


* Hantera lönefrågor och fungera som kontaktperson gentemot vår outsourcade lönebyrå
* Upprätta, administrera och hantera anställningsavtal
* Sköta administrativa uppgifter inom pension, försäkringar och förmåner (t.ex. friskvårdsbidrag)
* Hantera HR-relaterade ärenden via HR:s funktionsbrevlåda
* Stödja och rådgiva chefer och medarbetare i allmänna HR- och lönefrågor
* Kontera fakturor för HR-avdelningen
* Säkerställa att vi följer aktuella lagar, avtal och policys inom lön och HR



  





  





**Vad har du med dig** 



* God erfarenhet av löneadministration och HR-administration
* Erfarenhet av att hantera lönefrågor
* God kunskap om anställningsavtal, pension, försäkringar och förmåner
* Kunskap om arbetsrätt, kollektivavtal och gällande lagstiftning inom HR och lön
* God administrativ förmåga och vana av att arbeta strukturerat
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i HR- och/eller lönesystem
* Erfarenhet av att kontera fakturor



  





  





**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Agda PS eller annat lönesystem
* Erfarenhet av att hantera lönefrågor i samarbete med en outsourcad lönebyrå
* Erfarenhet av pensionshantering



  





  





**Vem vi letar efter** 




 För att trivas i rollen som löneadministratör hos oss på Fonus tror vi att du har följande personliga egenskaper:
 


* Noggrann och strukturerad – du har en förmåga att hantera detaljer och följa upp processer
* Självgående – du tar initiativ och driver dina arbetsuppgifter framåt
* Kommunikativ och serviceinriktad – du trivs med att ge support och förklara HR- och lönefrågor för andra
* Lösningsorienterad – du har en positiv inställning och ser möjligheter istället för hinder



  





  





**Det här erbjuder vi** 




 Hos oss får du en spännande och varierad roll inom HR och lönehantering där du arbetar tillsammans med engagerade och stödjande kollegor. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att skapa en bra arbetsmiljö och förenkla för våra chefer i verksamheten. Några av våra andra förmåner är:
 


* Kollektivavtal inkl. försäkringar & tjänstepension
* Personalrabatter
* 4 000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag varje år
* Subventionerad lunch
* Flexibelt arbete med möjlighet till hybridarbete



  





  





**Så här ansöker du** 




 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-23, men eftersom vi går igenom ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande kan tjänsten tillsättas innan detta datum.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om rollen eller oss som arbetsgivare, tveka inte att kontakta Heléne Hansell Medrano, HR-Partner & Teamleader för HR-adminteamet på 079-142 45 51 eller Eva Mallander, HR administratör på 072-080 23 61.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





  





**En familj inom Fonus ekonomisk förening** 




*De flesta förknippar namnet Fonus med begravningar. Men sedan starten 1945 har vi utvecklats med långsiktighet inom två huvudområden; begravning och juridik. Fonus drivs som en ekonomisk förening och vårt gemensamma mål är att erbjuda prisvärda och kvalitativa tjänster. Inom Fonus ekonomisk förening finns förutom Fonus även Familjens Jurist, Företagarens jurist, Momentobyråerna, Farväl och Fondkistan.* 




  





*Fonus ekonomisk förening har ett 50-tal centrala roller som arbetar med att stödja begravnings- och juridikverksamheterna. Det är allt ifrån controllers till HR-businesspartners, till marknadsförare och IT-specialister samt generalister.*

title: Senior SEM Specialist
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 Publicis Groupe is looking for a performance driven
 **Senior SEM Specialist** 
 to join our team, delivering excellent service to our clients and capable of defining the future of paid search and performance at Publicis.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you need to be curious, open-minded and solution-oriented, both internally and towards clients. You will be responsible for developing, executing, and optimizing SEM strategies working closely with cross-functional teams to drive campaign success.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Strategic proposals for optimization of lead generation, providing recommendations for campaign improvement, including reporting and performance analysis.
* Establishing SEM plans and proposals, ensuring tactical execution aligns with business objectives.
* Creating and monitoring of paid search campaigns on Google, Bing and Amazon platforms.
* Communicating effectively with clients and internal teams within Publicis agencies.
* Deliver both short-term and long-term solutions that support client growth.
* Staying ahead of industry trends to keep our search offerings innovative and competitive.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of four years of hands-on experience in SEM
* Experience in participating in client pitches, with the ability to articulate complex strategies clearly and persuasively.
* A strategic thinker with a deep understanding of digital media and performance marketing.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to identify trends and drive data-driven decision-making.
* A strong communicator who can effectively present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English is required


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Sr. Sales Manager
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
****Job Req ID: 25846****
**About Supermicro**
 Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The Sales Manager is responsible for driving the overall go to market strategy for Supermicro. This includes building plans and programs that will drive business in new markets and new customer segments that leverage our channels, the existing and emerging strategic partnerships. The role will be involved in all aspects of building the strategies and execute in order to generate revenue. This individual must be very strong at working cross functionally at all levels of the organization.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
 Job included but not limited to:
   

  

* Represent and sell the entire Supermicro portfolio of products and services to large enterprise customers.
* Establish a high level of personal credibility as a trusted advisor to key client executives.
* Research and understand the client's industry. Deeply understand client business strategies and challenges.
* Act as a trusted advisor to client leaders, aggressively shape deals early in the sales cycle. Advance opportunities that result in profitable revenue growth for Supermicro.
* Demonstrate in depth knowledge in aligning Supermicro capabilities to client business, IT priorities, and positioning relative to competitors.
* Build and execute an Account Business Plan (ABP) that includes both transactional and strategic initiatives to grow Supermicro's presence and share in the account.
* Actively drive ABP results through effective account management and reviews.
* Identify, nurture, and close new solution opportunities that result in substantial growth in Super micro share, revenues, and margin.
* Meet or exceed quarterly and annual revenue and margin quotas. Uses margin management techniques.
* Qualify and close large deals of moderate to high complexity and cross-GBU scope.
* Work with all levels of decision-makers in the client organization including the CEO.
* Participate in account investment decisions in pricing and resources.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferably in high tech industry
* Minimum 3-7 years of direct sales experience selling server and storage to enterprise and fortune-1000 companies preferred
* Strong communication skills across multiple disciplines, cultures and geographies
* Track record of building relationships with senior executives and decision makers
* Demonstrate ability in the following areas: pre-call planning, opportunity qualification and objection handling, call structure and control, time and territory management
* Experience entering, tracking and reporting data on lead activity
* Consistent track record of meeting of exceeding sales target
* Must have Microsoft Excel Knowledge
* Multi-task and time management skills are a must
* Proficient in English and additional language is a huge plus


****EEO Statement****
 Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

title: Character Artist - Games
description:
As a Character Artist at Embark you will play an important and creative role being part of designing, building and implementing the characters and creatures.
   

  

 You will work closely to programmers, animators, technical artists, technical animators etc. to be part of changing how we build characters in the future, within games and digital entertainment.
   

  

 Your passion is to surprise players with well-tuned and beautifully built experiences. You enjoy a variety of games — sometimes deconstructing and analyzing, other times just playing.
   

  

 You think hard about how players explore and experience games, and you imagine a future where players can be part of creating their own unique experiences.
   

  

 You know that experimenting is a gamble. But you have a knack for choosing the smartest route, and you know when it’s time to declare success or failure. You make sure to balance meaningful innovation with executing best practices.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Model and texture highly detailed game character and creature models
* Participate in playtests and provide feedback on the game
* Scan characters and clean up photogrammetry
* Collaborate with your fellow game makers


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* 2 years of relevant professional experience within the game industry
* A strong passion for art, games and relevant technologies
* Excellent visual skillset and deep artistic understanding and knowledge
* Great understanding and ability to work according Game and Art Direction as well as technical constraint
* Professional English communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Mechanical, Electrical and Control & Pumped Drainage (MEP) Systems Engineer (f/m/d) Stockholm
description:
As Switzerland’s leading construction and real estate service provider, Implenia develops, builds and manages homes, workplaces and infrastructure for future generations in Switzerland and Germany. It also offers tunnelling and related infrastructure projects in further markets. The company brings together the know-how of its highly skilled development, planning and execution units under the umbrella of an integrated leading multinational construction and real estate service provider. More information can be found at
 **implenia.com** 
 .
   

  

 Implenia Construction is a company within the Implenia Group and is specialized in providing intelligent engineering services. Implenia is one of the leading companies in tunneling. We realize complex projects domestically and abroad. For realizing our hybrid projects in infrastructure, we count on your knowledge and skills. Support us as a
 **Mechanical, Electrical and Control & Pumped Drainage (MEP) Systems Engineer (f/m/d)** 
 .
   

  

 Your first place of work is in our
 **project City Link** 
 in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

 Main tasks:
   

  

* Support the MEP Manager with daily tasks related to mechanical, electrical, control, and drainage systems.
* Coordinate MEP design between the client's designer, suppliers, subcontractors, and civil/building works.
* Oversee MEP installations to ensure they meet design specifications and align with timeline, budget, quality, and HSE goals.
* Conduct inspections, tests, and ensure proper documentation (e.g., As-Built documents) to guarantee quality and safety.
* Prepare progress reports, assist in MEP procurement, and participate in site meetings and toolbox talks.
* Support the billing, payment, and handover of MEP works to the commissioning team.


 Qualifications and capabilities:
   

  

* Degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Building Services Engineering with a first professional experience
* Professional experience with MEP systems and construction processes, ideally in the construction industry or on larger infrastructure projects
* Fluent in English, other languages such as Swedish or German are an advantage
* Basic knowledge of coordinating different trades and ensuring quality, safety, and timeline compliance
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* Proactive and solution-oriented approach
* Experience with project documentation and reporting is a plus


 Implenia-Employee package
   

  

* Exciting and challenging projects in Germany and abroad
* Home travel arrangements every month and a flat nearby the project in Stockholm
* 30 days of holiday and special leave days
* A permanent position in a steadily growing company
* Attractive salary
* Structured onboarding and on-the-job training opportunities
* Development possibilities to commercial project manager for large-scale projects
* Flat hierarchies and cooperation in a highly professional team with competent colleagues
* Benefits in the Implenia Group (e.g. discounts in gyms, leasing of bikes, company pension)
* Find out more under: Employee package


**Do you share our passion for building?** 
 Then become part of Implenia. At Implenia, we value and embrace diversity. Our recruitment process is therefore geared towards supporting diversity, equality and inclusion. Applications from people with disabilities are expressly welcome. We look forward to receiving your online application stating your earliest possible start date! Is this position not of interest for you, but perhaps for one of your friends or acquaintances? Share the career opportunity via
 **social media channels** 
 or with the "Share" button on our website.
   

  

 For supporting more transparency as an employer, you can find us on kununu at
   

  

**Implenia Germany as an employer: Salary, career, benefits (kununu.com)**
 Do you have questions?
   

  

 Moritz Will will be happy to answer them. Give us a call or send us a message.
   

  

 T +49 6142 8737-298, moritzyannick.will@implenia.com
   

  

 The recipient of your data is the central HR department
   

  

 Implenia Deutschland GmbH, Am Prime Parc 1, 65479 Raunheim, Germany
   

  

 The entity responsible for data collection is the company issuing the position
   

  

 Dela via e-post
   

  

 Dela via e-post

title: Sommarjobb: Redovisningsekonom till Leverantörsreskontra på Preem
description:
*Har du ett intresse för och vill utvecklas i en roll som Redovisningsekonom?
 ********Vill du sommarjobba på Sveriges största drivmedelsföretag
 **som har hållbarhet högt upp på agendan?**********
 Då kan du vara den sommarvikarie vi söker!*
**Om rollen**
 Avdelningen Leverantörsreskontra ingår i Preems ekonomiavdelning som idag består av åtta medarbetare och rapporterar till avdelningschefen för Leverantörsreskontra. Gruppen arbetar bland annat med hantering av leverantörsfakturor, matchning av fakturor, bokföring, att registrera betalningar och ge god service till Preems interna kunder samt leverantörer.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Ansvara för att bokföring och avstämning sker på ett korrekt sätt och att reskontrasystemen kontinuerligt följs upp och analyseras.
* Samarbete med affärsdrivande affärsområden och inköp.
* Registrera fakturor och matcha fakturor mot inköpsorder.
* Hantera krav och påminnelser.
* Stämma av moms - att inga felbokningar skett på momskonton och att alla fakturor bokats med rätt moms.
* Stödja och utbilda verksamheten i hantering och redovisning av leverantörsfakturor.
* Betalning och kontering av fakturor.


**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Du blir en viktig del av Preem – en arbetsplats som präglas av välkomnande stämning, förtroende för medarbetarna och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi arbetar utifrån syftet att göra resan till en bättre framtid möjlig. Just nu genomgår vi den största omställningen i vår historia där det fossila successivt fasas ut och ersätts av förnybara alternativ. En omställning vi gör för att vi vill, kan och måste. Hos oss får du frihet under ansvar och uppmuntras att ta egna initiativ för att utveckla verksamheten framåt. För oss är det viktigt att du delar våra värderingar, Ansvarstagande, Nyskapande och Inkluderande eftersom de ligger till grund för allt vi gör.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på heltid med önskemål om start den 9 juni fram till 29 augusti, med placering på Preems kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

**Har du den här bakgrunden**
* Pågående högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av Leverantörs- och/eller kundreskontraarbete är meriterande.
* Intresse för redovisning.
* Behärska Officepaketet och framförallt Excel väl.
* Du har ett allmänt intresse för IT, inköpssystem och gärna erfarenhet från ERP-system.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift, då båda språken förekommer i det dagliga arbetet.


**Är det här du**
 I rollen som Redovisningsekonom är det viktigt att du är noggrann, strukturerad och har ett starkt driv. Du avslutar det du påbörjar och kan anpassa dig i en föränderlig arbetsmiljö. Arbetet innebär många kontaktytor, både internt och externt, vilket förutsätter en god samarbetsförmåga. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Sommarvikariatet är en bra möjlighet för dig som studerande att få din första erfarenhet inom en ekonomiavdelning, där du får chans att utvecklas och lära dig nytt i en stor organisation med många kollegor.
   

  

**Nästa steg**
 Om du har frågor om sommarjobbet är du välkommen att kontakta Markus Saarikoski, chef för Leverantörsreskontra på markus.saarikoski@preem.se eller Recruitment Partner Caroline Ohlsson på caroline.ohlsson@preem.se eller på mobilnummer 0761-489299. Du ansöker smidigt genom att bifoga CV samt besvara urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval.
   

  

 Sommarjobbet kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men allra senast 26 februari 2025.
   

  

 Då Preem bedriver en samhällsviktig verksamhet genomförs alltid bakgrundskontroll samt alkohol-/drogtest inför ett anställningserbjudande. Vid intervju ska för Sverige godkänd ID-handling kunna uppvisas. Preem är även till del ett säkerhetsklassat företag och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kan därför genomföras vid behov. Säkerhetsprövningen genomförs i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Facklig kontaktperson finns
 **här.**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Preem är Sveriges största drivmedelsbolag. Vår vision är att leda omvandlingen mot ett hållbart samhälle. Senast 2035 har Preem som mål att producera cirka 5 miljoner kubikmeter förnybara drivmedel och vara klimatneutrala i hela värdekedjan.*
*Preems raffinaderier räknas till de mest moderna och miljöanpassade i Europa med en raffineringskapacitet på över 18 miljoner kubikmeter per år. Vi förädlar och säljer drivmedel, eldnings- och smörjolja samt andra produkter till företag och privatpersoner.*
**Vi har ett rikstäckande servicenät med ca 500 stationer för privat- och yrkestrafik. Preem AB har cirka 1 500 anställda varav 1 100 arbetar vid raffinaderierna. För helåret 2023 var Preems omsättning 138 miljarder SEK.**

title: Senior Water & Wastewater engineer
company_industry: Civil Engineering and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Do you have a strong interest and experience in working in Water and Wastewater Projects? Are you eager to contribute your expertise to our exciting and challenging projects? Then this could be the next step in your career!**







  

  
   

  





  




**Join our National Water & Wastewater Team**







  




 We belong to the the Infrastructure unit in COWI Sweden, where you'll find the national team within Urban Water and Utilities with Water and Wastewater Design Engineers, Utility Coordinators, Project Managers, and Analysts among us. Our team's competence and breadth within the company allow us to offer our clients both specialized services and total commitments, which provides our employees with stimulating and developmental tasks. Our group collaborates effectively with colleagues across Sweden, Scandinavia, and internationally.
   

  








  

  
   

  





  




**Your role as a Senior Water and Wastewater Engineer:**







  




 In this role, you will be part of a competent and experienced team working broadly on design projects and studies for both public (authorities and municipal) and private clients.
   

  








  




 Your responsibilities will include leading teams in designing water and wastewater systems, serving as either a Technical Lead or a Project Manager. There is also an opportunity to combine the role with work as a Utility Coordinator or Analyst specializing in pipe networks or stormwater management.
   

  








  

  
   

  





  




**Your expertise. Our team. Together we're shaping the future.**







  




 We believe that to succeed in this role, you are engaged and meticulous. You are good at working independently as well as in a project group. Since we value knowledge exchange among employees and functions, we want you to enjoy sharing your experiences. For this position, you will have:
 





* A Degree of Master of Science within Engineering, preferably within Infrastructure and Environmental Engineering.
* Experience leading teams as a Technical Lead (project larger than 5 MSEK) or Project Manager (project larger than 1 MSEK).
* Have more than 6 years of relevant experience in water and wastewater design.
* Proven problem-solving skills and fluency in the Swedish and English language, both written and verbal.



  




**A place to work and so much more**







  




 At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity - and sometimes even our courage - to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
   

  








  




 We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you at work and at home.
   

  








  




 With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America, and India, we are currently 8000 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy, and environment into play.
   

  








  

  
   

  





  




**Equal Opportunities for All**







  




 At COWI, we value equal opportunities for all employees and applicants based on individual circumstances without regard to gender, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or age.
   

  








  

  
   

  





  




**Got more questions?**







  




 Please feel free to contact Mikael Bengtsson at +46 10-850 13 95 or email mlbn@cowi.com, to have a non-committal Teams meeting where we can tell you more about the position and COWI as a workplace.
   

  








  

  
   

  





  




**How to apply**







  




 Apply via the link to express your interest and start a dialogue with us!

title: DevOps konsult
description:
OM INFINITY IT CONSULTING: Infinity IT Consulting är ett konsultföretag inom IT och Management med en stark företagskultur och teamkänsla. Ditt välmående är vår framgång och vi menar att de bästa konsultaffärerna blir av och genomförs med stolthet när du som medarbetare mår som bäst, så gör även företaget och våra kunder det. Vi jobbar med IT-kunder och partners i hela Skandinavien inom både telekom, verkstadsindustrin, retail, sport & mode och många andra. Vi bygger teamet utifrån våra värderingar som genomsyrar hela företaget. Pannben – Viljan och förmågan att lösa uppgiften, ta ansvar och känna ägarskap, men alltid våga ta hjälp. Enkelhet – Vi krånglar inte till det, varken för oss själva eller för andra! Sunt förnuft och kundnöjdhet i fokus. Laganda – Vi ställer upp för varandra, gör varandra bättre och skrattar varje dag! Långsiktighet – Vi är besatta av att göra bra saker och saker bra, vi låter kortsiktiga vinningar stå tillbaka för långvariga affärsrelationer. Stolthet – Vi är rakryggade, på riktigt och vågar gå vår egen väg! Din IT-karriär kan starta hos just oss och vi ger förutsättningarna för det, eller så är du senior med många års erfarenhet och då ger vi utrymme för allt leda, kompetensutveckla och ge stöd åt våra mer juniora konsulter, och på det viset har vi en härlig mix i konsultteamet av olika utbyten i erfarenhet, intressen och kompetens.### **Vi söker en DevOps Engineer till konsultuppdrag**



Vi på **Infinity** söker nu en erfaren **DevOps Engineer** för ett spännande uppdrag hos en av våra kunder. Är du en person som brinner för **automatisering av infrastruktur, systemintegration och IT-säkerhet**? Vill du arbeta i en **säkerhetskritisk miljö** där du får utveckla och förvalta både **Windows- och Linuxbaserade tjänster**? Då kan detta vara rätt uppdrag för dig!


### **Om uppdraget**



Som **DevOps Engineer** kommer du att ingå i kundens DevOps-team och arbeta med **automatisering, systemintegration och IT-infrastruktur** i en miljö med **höga säkerhetskrav**. Du kommer att ha en central roll i att säkerställa att system och tjänster fungerar effektivt och säkert.


**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**  

✔ Automatiserad uppsättning av nya miljöer  

✔ Systemintegration genom automatisering  

✔ Underhåll och drift av IT-infrastruktur  

✔ Felsökning och optimering  

✔ Dokumentation och kunskapsdelning


### **Vem vi söker**



Vi letar efter en **driven och lösningsorienterad DevOps Engineer** med förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team. Du har en stark teknisk grund och trivs i en miljö där du får ta eget ansvar och bidra till förbättring av processer och rutiner.


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**  

 Erfarenhet som **DevOps Engineer** med kompetens inom **Windows och/eller Linux**  

 Goda kunskaper i **Python, PowerShell eller andra programmeringsspråk**  

 Erfarenhet av **systemintegration och mjukvarukomponenter**  

 Kunskap inom **nätverk och infrastruktur**  

 Erfarenhet av **Infrastructure as Code**, exempelvis med **Ansible**  

 Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


### **Varför välja oss?**



Som konsult på Infinity får du möjligheten att arbeta med spännande och tekniskt avancerade uppdrag. Vi erbjuder en **utvecklande arbetsmiljö och** en **stark gemenskap.**



Låter detta intressant? Skicka in din ansökan så berättar vi mer!  

  

För frågor kontakta hanna.sundin@infinityitc.se

title: DevOps IAM Specialist
description:
**For our client we are looking for a IAM Specialist, the team handles Microsoft 365, AD & EntraID, trying to create great user experience. Their teams work in a DevOps setup, meaning the team owns the full scope of their product – new development, operational development / continuous improvements and support. They work with relentless automation of repetitive work and for an increased level of self-service for the users and are therefore looking to strengthen the team with a developer who can contribute and drive this area.** **You will belong to a team working in an agile way to together solve problems and create solutions based on modern software development practices. The team has its own Azure subscription and are moving to working within the boundaries of the event driven architecture. They are looking to strengthen the team with a developer / tech lead or hands-on solution architect who can help modernize and automate the EntraID- & AD ecosystem.**


### **Requirements**


* EntraID.
* Group policies, conditional access & MFA config.
* Event based integrations between EntraID & AD and systems like ServiceNow, SuccessFactors.
* Hybrid AD & EntraID setup.
* PowerShell or other script languages.
* Azure.
* Modern software development practices (Infrastructure as Code, GitOps etc).
* GitHub & GitHub Actions.
* Event-driven architecture (PubSub, Streaming etc).
* Serverless / Azure functions.

title: Observability konsult
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
emagine söker en konsult med fokus på **Observerbarhet** till vår kund. Man kommer arbeta nära utvecklare, drifttekniker och andra intressenter för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och prestanda i våra nuvarande och framtida lösningar inom observerbarhet.


Start: enligt överenskommelse


Längd: löpande men minst 6 månader


Placering: Stockholm och 1 dag i veckan från kontoret


Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

* **Behovsanalys och genomgång av befintliga system:** Genomgång av befintliga system och vilket behov dom fyller, går det att konsolidera och använda färre system än idag?
* **Förslag på övervakningsverktyg:** Rekommendation och stöd i implementation av framtida verktyg beroende på behov och systemarkitektur.
* Implementera och optimera lösningar för observability i våra system (inklusive loggning, metrics, tracing och alerting)
* **Identifiera kritiska mätvärden:** Definierar och optimerar de nyckelindikatorer som ger relevant insikt i systemets hälsa, till exempel svarstider, serverbelastning, felrater, databaslatens, och användartillfredsställelse
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation för observability-strukturer och processer
* Bidra till best practices och ständiga förbättringar av våra arbetsflöden och tekniska lösningar
* Delta i incidenthantering och analyser av systemproblem för att föreslå och implementera lösningar

**Person vi söker**

* Har lång erfarenhet av att arbeta med **observerbarhet plattformar**
* Har kunskap inom systemövervakning, logghantering och prestandaoptimering
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med modern infrastruktur, gärna molnplattformar som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud
* Är van vid att arbeta i DevOps-miljöer och har förståelse för CI/CD-processer
* Har goda färdigheter i ett eller flera programmeringsspråk, gärna Python, Go, Java eller Bash
* Är analytisk, noggrann och har en problemlösande inställning
* Har god kommunikationsförmåga och trivs med att samarbeta med olika team och funktioner
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat

**Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av containerisering och orkestrering (t.ex. Docker, Kubernetes)
* Erfarenhet av infrastrukturen som kod (t.ex. Terraform, Ansible)
* Kunskap om ITIL-processer och incidenthantering

  

Några av systemen vi använder idag: Grafana, Prometheus, Splunk, Icinga, Victoriametrics


  
Alex Kouchmeshki
Country Manager


alex@emagine-consulting.se
+46 722005458

title: Scandic Hotels Tech Trainee Program 2025/2026
description:
**Kickstart your career in Software Engineering & Coding with our Tech Trainee Program!**


**About Scandic:**



Scandic is the largest hotel operator in the Nordics, with around 280 hotels and 58,000 rooms across six countries. We’re on an exciting journey, growing stronger every day and reshaping how guests experience our brand. With strong momentum, we’re creating seamless, engaging, and intuitive digital experiences that drive both business growth and customer loyalty. Join us and be part of a team that's creating the next-generation digital customer journey!


You will be part of Group IT and our headquarters, a European function, even though we have most of our presence in the Nordics. Our HQ is situated in newly renovated spaces, of course with a wonderful hotel vibe ;) right by Hagaparken on Sveavägen in Stockholm. We love to be in the office but are a flexible workplace and offer a hybrid setup that suits our team members. Join in on our warm and inclusive culture and take part in all our different social activities.


Scandic Hotels is highly committed and proactive when it comes to Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) initiatives. We are also a responsible corporate citizen and actively engaged in sustainability efforts. Joining Scandic Hotels means becoming a force for good.


**Scandic Tech Trainee Program:**



The program spans over a year, starting in September. You will build a solid foundation in IT and Tech. You will be part of our Customer Journey tech department while also having the opportunity to familiarize yourself with our hotels by visiting different locations multiple times during the year. Additionally, you will gain an understanding of various aspects within our IT department and collaborate with other relevant stakeholders and teams.


Your home base will be our tech department called Customer Journey, where we have our web & app, CRM, Loyalty, API & Integration, and more. We work with modern technologies and processes, including Azure cloud, .NET, Javascript, TypeScript, Next.js 15, React Native, React, Kubernetes et.c. We work agile with devops principles and test automation.


You will be part of a small group of Tech Trainees and other young talents within our organization and engage in training, learning and networking activities. You will be supported by several people in our organization including your team lead, other developers, our tech trainees from this year, a mentor and more. This program is small and we customize it as much as possible to set you up for success. The plan is for you to continue as a Software Engineer with us at Scandic after completing the program.


  
**Who are you?**


* Do you want to be part of shaping the future hospitality experience with us? Are you eager to grow and learn? Do you want to be part of a great and diverse tech team? Cool! Please read further and apply.
* You hold or are pursuing a bachelor’s or master's degree in computer science, software engineering or similar. You will need to have your degree before the program starts.
* You think coding and software engineering is super fun and would like to start your career within this field.
* You have no more than four years of professional experience in your field of study by the start date.
* You have a strong analytical ability and possess strong problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in English is essential, Swedish or other Scandinavian language is a plus.  
* 

**How to Apply:**



We’re happy to see that you’ve made it this far, we can’t wait to get to know you better!


When applying, please share:


* Your CV describing your experiences and skills, please include coding experience
* A short application letter describing why you are interested in joining our Tech Trainee Program
A transcript of grades  
* 

We welcome applications in either Swedish or English.


All qualified applicants will be invited to assessments (personality test and logical thinking test) through our assessment partner Assessio.


If you have ambitions to develop, we will give you the opportunity to grow in your role. The development opportunities within our organization are endless. We have a warm and friendly approach, and we love to welcome new members to our team!


**Important Dates:**



Application period: until 26th of February 2025. Please apply as soon as possible, applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and the recruitment may be finalized before the deadline if we find the right candidates.


Program start: Our Tech Trainee Program will start in September 2025.


Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our website.


We're excited to hear from you soon!


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Professional and personal development


Partner discounts


Family & Friends discounts


Discounts when eating, drinking & staying with us


Flexible office working hours


Competitive pension scheme


  
We know that we reach further when we assent to our differences. At Scandic we want you to be yourself and develop in the direction you want to go, with the foundation of safe conditions and fair agreements. Bring your experiences, engagement and your way of thinking – contribute to a culture where we genuinely care about each other, our guests and our planet. Welcome to Scandic.
