title: Senior Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer
description:
This role is an opportunity for a hands-on, but literally hands-off, senior technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have experience of IT operations automation, Infrastructure as Code and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The IS team at Canonical supports and maintains all of Canonical's IT production services. The team is in charge of running services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.
   

  

 As an Senior SRE & Gitops engineer you'll be in a unique position to drive operations automation to the next level, both in our own private clouds as well as in the public clouds. We do this by utilizing the best of open source infrastructure as code software, software development practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and Canonical's leading products for software operation automation.
   

  

 In addition to defining the infrastructure as code, you will improve Canonical products and the open-source technologies they're based on by providing critical feedback to developers on how their products operate at scale. This is done by submitting bugs (and sometimes writing pull requests) and collaborating on design and implementations with other teams within the company.
   

  

 You'll be part of a global team of SREs that work together and support each other to provide the best possible services to our company, Canonical's customers and the Ubuntu Community.
   

  

**As a Senior Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer you will**
* Drive the development of automation, Gitops in your team as an embedded tech lead
* Closely collaborate with the IS architect to align your solutions with the IS architecture vision
* Design and architect services that IS can offer to the organization as products
* Apply your experience of IaC to develop infrastructure as code practice within IS by constantly increasing automation and improving IaC processes
* Automate software operations for re-usability and consistency across private and public clouds, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systems
* Maintain operational responsibility for all of Canonical's core services, networks, and infrastructure
* Develop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance investigation, Setting up, maintaining and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Elasticsearch; design, implement and maintain monitoring and alerting for various systems and services
* Provide assistance and work with globally distributed engineering, operations, and support peers
* Be given uninterrupted development time to focus on larger projects and automation of manual tasks
* Share your experience, know-how and best practices with other team members in design sessions, mentorship and 'doing work together'
* Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* A modern view on hosting architecture, driven by infrastructure as code across both private and public clouds.
* A product mindset thriving to develop products rather than solutions.
* Python software development experience, with large projects
* Experience working with Kubernetes or other container orchestration systems.
* Proven exposure to manage and deploy cloud infrastructure with code.
* Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls
* Affinity with various forms of Linux storage, from Ceph to Databases
* Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers
* Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies
* Bachelor's degree or greater, preferably in computer science or related engineering field
* Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, chat, video or voice calls and in-person
* Motivated and able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing to ask others when appropriate
* A willingness to be flexible and able to learn new things quickly
* Be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments
* Happy to work within distributed teams
* Be passionate and familiarized about open-source, especially Ubuntu or Debian


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Platform Engineer
company_industry: IT System Custom Software Development and Digital Accessibility Services
description:
My client is seeking a Data Platform Engineer for an initial 6-month contract, with the possibility of transitioning to a permanent role. This position is based on-site in Stockholm and requires an experienced engineer who thrives in a collaborative environment and brings positive energy to their work and team. You’ll play a key role in designing, building, and managing data infrastructure and automation systems that support the company’s data engineering efforts.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 




  




* Develop and maintain data infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC), containerization, and CI/CD principles, primarily with Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, and GitHub Actions.
* Work closely with the data engineering team to build and optimize data pipelines and workflows, leveraging tools like Airflow and dbt.
* Manage and deploy infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with potential to support other cloud environments (AWS, Azure).
* Support and improve automation processes for infrastructure and deployments, ensuring scalability and reliability.



  





**Requirements** 




  




* 4+ years of software engineering experience, with a focus on platform or infrastructure engineering.
* Solid experience with Infrastructure DevOps principles, including IaC, version control, CI/CD, and containerization.
* Familiarity with Python for scripting and data engineering support.
* Strong experience with a cloud platform (preferably GCP).
* Knowledge or interest in data engineering tools and pipelines (Airflow, dbt).



  





**Application process** 




  





 If this opportunity aligns with your experience and you’re interested in working in Stockholm, please apply today.
 



  





**Your consultant** 




  





 Cam Dalziel is our recruitment who specialises in assembling teams in data, AI, design, and technology across Europe. He engages with top talent and is committed to providing a high quality service that delivers results. Get in touch with Cam at
 
 cameron.dalziel@aspire-technology.net
 
 .

title: ETL Developer
Software Engineer - OpenStack
description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and OpenStack. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
   

  

 As a software engineer on the OpenStack Engineering team, you'll be building Charmed OpenStack and Ceph, a suite of open source Python based charms for deploying and managing OpenStack and Ceph. Your work will bring cloud platform technologies to a wide range of users and computing environments, from desktops to bare metal servers. This role requires a python software developer with a passion for automating infrastructure as code.
   

  

 Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.
   

  

 This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week at a time.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
* Write high quality code to create new features
* Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Ensure the success of OpenStack and Ceph on multiple architectures
* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events


 Who you are
   

  

* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have experience with Python
* You have interest and experience with two or more of the following:Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, AI/ML, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, scalable web services
* You have experience with non-x86 architectures, including s390, arm64, power and others
* You have experience with OpenStack, OVN, Openvswitch and other related cloud technologies


 What Canonical Offers
   

  

* Learning and Development
* Annual Compensation Review
* Recognition Rewards
* Annual Leave
* Priority Pass for travel
* Flexible working option


 Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
   

  

 Keywords: python, agile, lean, distributed systems, openstack, ceph, containers, kubernetes, docker, scale-out, orchestration, linux, ubuntu, cloud, devops, open source, serverless, networking, home, remote job, software development, software engineering, openstack

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Cassandra
description:
**Company Description**
 Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  

 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking an Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Cassandra to Tink - delivering open banking solutions as a part of Visa.
   

  

 Perhaps the most dramatic outcome of the digital revolution is the amount of data that is now collected and analyzed. Tink handles billions of events, and this number is increasing at an exponential rate. We are passionate about enabling data-driven decisions for our clients and internal stakeholders. Our goal is to ensure data is collected, transformed, and presented securely with accuracy and reliability. Building the infrastructure and services to support this is hence a key part of what Tink engineers are doing.
   

  

 The Stateful team is the backbone of our data infrastructure and tooling. Playing a vital role in delivering essential database services and developing tools to meet the evolving needs of the Tink organization. We are actively expanding our team, seeking talented Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) and DevOps engineers who can bring their expertise to drive our database services to new heights.
   

  

 What we offer you:
   

  

 A position in the Stateful team means working in an international environment where you will be involved in:
   

  

* Ensuring scalability and reliability of our most critical operational data store. Primarily Cassandra.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the database services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.


 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Stateful team. Working from our office in Stockholm and help us maintain, expand and evolve our Cassandra database offering
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* Proven experience in managing Cassandra databases at scale.
* A strong desire to foster teamwork and collaborative efforts.
* Working in an IaC environment using tooling such as Terraform, or Ansible
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog


 Nice To Have qualifications:
   

  

* Contributing Code to Cassandra or related DB technologies (e.g. Scylladb)
* Familiarity with AWS, RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB, Zookeeper, and Kafka
* Extensive industry experience, including mentoring of junior engineers


**Additional Information**
 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Test Lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
 To plan and lead test execution for global template and pilots + to create concept of future roll-out related testing.
   

  

**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Extensive experience of leading and managing testing services of ERM (Enterprise Resource Management) (SAP S4/hana), MES (Manufacturing Execution System) etc. systems in large transformation program across geographical locations.
* Deep knowledge of testing tools (MicroFocus ALM or equivalent)
* Previous experience in leading testing activities in large transformation programs


**Meritorious**
* Hands on experience of test automation


**Application deadline:** 
 18-02-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
As a Machine Learning Engineer at Fortum, you will join an innovative early-stage venture and contribute to a clean energy future. This is your chance to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about leveraging data to drive innovations in sustainable energy. You will work on cutting-edge projects, utilizing advanced analytics to solve complex problems and optimize energy solutions. Your work will directly impact our mission to create a cleaner world, and you will play a key role in shaping the future of energy. Join us and be part of something bigger.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Fortum, we value creativity, collaboration, and the power of data-driven decision-making. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a supportive environment, with access to the latest tools and technologies.
   

  

 We offer competitive compensation packages, professional growth opportunities, and the satisfaction of knowing your efforts are contributing to a sustainable future for generations to come. If you are ready to make a difference and embrace the challenge of transforming the energy landscape, Fortum is the place for you.
   

  

 Join Fortum’s Data Science & Optimization team to play a key role in our digitalization and AI journey. You'll help develop Hiven, our market-leading demand response solution.
   

  

 Main responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
   

  

  

* Extract value from high-resolution data for ML & optimization pipelines
* Design and automate a stable MLOps pipeline with model re-training
* Develop scalable forecasting and steering models
* Implement aggregation methods for scalability
* Create tractable approximations when needed
* Collaborate with backend, frontend, DevOps, CloudOps, EA architecture, and cybersecurity teams on interfaces, storage, and data protocols
* Support data and control engineers
* Coach the team and learn about the energy domain


 The positions can be based in either Solna, Sweden or Espoo, Finland.
   

  

**About You**
 To thrive in this role, you should have an MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience. A strong background in Machine Learning and MLOps is essential, with at least three years of solid experience in software engineering using Python. You must also be proficient in statistics and data science, having spent a minimum of two years honing these skills. Experience working with cloud solutions, particularly AWS, for over two years is necessary.
   

  

  

* Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers, and DevOps practices.
* Knowledge of Software Engineering principles: SOLID, clean code.
* Excellent communication skills and a willingness to learn about the energy domain.
* Full professional proficiency in written and oral English.


 Preferred additional experience includes:
   

  

  

* Stochastic optimization and control.
* Understanding of electricity markets and flexibility markets.
* Knowledge of chargers for electric vehicles or home energy management.
* Experience with forecast models and parameter tuning.
* Data engineering, architecture development, and deployment.
* IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance, and support.
* Data storage and maintenance methods.
* Familiarity with message brokers and microservice architectures.
* Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IoT devices.
* Experience working in an Agile environment.


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Please submit your application by 2025-02-28 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com. For questions about Hiven, please contact Jani Leirimaa, CEO and founder of Hiven Energy, jani@hiven.energy.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.
   

  

**We are Fortum and Hiven**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonize their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
   

  

 For us working with start-ups and innovation means faster renewal and keeping up to date with the latest technologies. We want to be right at the forefront of innovation, dreaming up a better tomorrow. Therefore, Fortum invests time and resources in supporting innovation and start-ups, both internally and externally.
   

  

 Hiven is one of Fortum’s digital ventures for a cleaner future. Hiven is an innovative new service for companies wanting to deliver greener and smarter services to their customers. Hiven’s products include services such as smart charging with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to electric vehicles and electric vehicle chargers – and smart heating with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to heating appliances. All these devices are connected to Hiven to be steered in a smarter way.

 Do you want to build the next data models for AI, ML, and data warehouse-powered solutions?
 



  





 Nexer Insight invites you to embark on a journey as a

 , where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits.
 



  





 Do you want to be our next
 **”Data Ninja”?** 




 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to work with cutting-edge technologies on
 **Google Cloud** 
 , including BigQuery, Dataflow, and Dataproc. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities.
 



  





 Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.

* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.

 services for data processing, transformation, and storage.

**What We’re Looking For**

**Meritorious Experience** 



* Certifications such as
 **Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer** 
 .
* Experience in Governance tools for GCP , for an exaple Data Catalogue
* Platform modernisation.
* Experience with Google Cloud Infrastructure setup.
* Data Vault modelling.



  





  





**Why Join Us?** 




 At Nexer Insight, you'll work with the latest technology in data engineering while being part of a supportive and innovative team. We are proud of our commitment to personal growth, offering certifications, training, and exciting projects with leading clients.
 



 Apply today to become part of Nexer Insight's jour

title: Systemutvecklare till Sogeti Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker nu systemutvecklare som vill vara med och bygga både nya molnbaserade lösningar och förbättra befintliga system.**
 I rollen som systemutvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta i en spännande och dynamisk miljö där innovation och teknisk utveckling står i fokus. Som systemutvecklare inom molnet kommer du att designa, utveckla och implementera molnbaserade lösningar, där du skriver och underhåller kod samt bidrar till att automatisera och effektivisera arbetsflöden. Du kommer att arbeta med att utveckla skalbara och säkra molnmiljöer och delta i både nyutveckling och förbättring av befintliga system. Tillsammans med teamet löser du komplexa problem och säkerställer att lösningar möter verksamhetens krav på funktionalitet och kvalitet.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Minst 5 år relevant erfarenhet som utvecklare
* God erfarenhet av Azure och molnbaserad utveckling samt erfarenhet av utveckling i C# och/eller Java.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Kubernetes och Docker för containerorkestrering och Terraform, ARM eller Bicep för infrastruktur som kod.
* Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines och automatisering med Azure DevOps, GitHub, Jenkins eller Ansible.
* Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt på både svenska och engelska, med intressenter från olika delar av organisationen.


**Vi Tror Att Du Är**
* En problemlösare med stark analytisk förmåga och en passion för teknik.
* Van vid att arbeta både självständigt och som en del av ett team.
* Strukturerad och noggrann, med ett starkt driv att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar.


 ,
   

  

**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**
* Ditt Sogeti - Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!
* Dina förmåner - Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?


**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande.
   

  

 Hoppas vi ses!
   

  

 /Team Manager, Simon Karlsson

title: Chief Product Owner/Manager Common Cloud Enablers, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
As the Chief Product Owner/Manager for Common Cloud Enablers, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing the budget, vision, strategy, and roadmap for our multi-cloud foundation and infrastructure, APIs, developer experience, and test automation. You will also nurture the performance, development, and well-being of your direct reports.
   

  

**Join us**
 Join PostNord IT as the Chief Product Owner/Manager of cloud infrastructure in a multi-cloud environment (mainly Microsoft Azure and AWS). You’ll lead the journey to cloud excellence and create outstanding developer experience. Collaborating across departments, you will drive productivity, scalability, standardization, and enhance our engineering culture with continuous cost control. If you are passionate about technology and leadership, this role is perfect for you!
   

  

**Job Duties**
 In this role, you will define and communicate the vision, strategy, and roadmap for the Cloud domain, ensuring alignment with company goals. You will streamline PostNord’s cloud hosting footprint, container platform, and API gateway setup. Managing and prioritizing the domain backlog will be one of your key responsibilities. You will provide feedback and guidance to teams, ensuring that deliveries meet quality standards and customer expectations. Leading and coaching your direct reports, you will foster a culture of trust, empowerment, and continuous improvement.
   

  

 You will also handle administrative tasks such as hiring, onboarding, salary, budget, and reporting. Regular performance reviews and career development plans will be part of your routine. Representing the Cloud domain, you will communicate progress and achievements. You will also lead and execute sourcing strategy and governance in cooperation with Vendor Management. Travel may be required to meet with teams in other locations.
   

  

**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
 We are seeking someone with at least 3 years of experience in product management, product ownership, or business analysis in a large-scale agile environment. You also have at least 3 years of experience in people management, team leadership, or coaching within an IT context. Additionally, you have at least 1 year of FinOps experience in a leading or cloud engineer position. A strong understanding of software development, CI/CD, DevOps, and cloud infrastructure is essential. Excellent communication and collaboration skills are crucial, with proficiency in English and Swedish/Danish.
   

  

**Meritorious Experience**
 It would be advantageous if you have a deep understanding of customer needs, business goals, and the technical capabilities of the domain. Experience with agile scaling frameworks (e.g., SAFe, LESS) and strong knowledge of the logistics industry and market trends are beneficial. Ideally, you have at least 2 years of experience working in IT within a large enterprise (over 1,000 employees) and have worked with Developer Experience in a multi-cloud environment.
   

  

**We believe you are a person that is**
* We believe you have a supportive and empowering leadership style, with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* You thrive in diverse and internationally distributed teams, bringing people together.
* Your strategic, creative, and analytical thinking helps you find innovative solutions.
* You are comfortable navigating ambiguity, complexity, and change with grace.
* You work in an inclusive, structured, and responsible manner, creating a supportive environment for everyone.


**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 A variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a supportive group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities.
* Excellent insurance and occupational pension terms.
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord’s own personnel foundation.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com.
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Head of Solution Area Herman Petersson at herman.petersson@postnord.com. Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit:
   

  

  

  

  

  

 We are looking forward hearing from you!

title: Optimization & Control Engineer
description:
Do you want to shape the future of clean energy? Join Fortum as an Optimization and Control Engineer and be at the forefront of innovation! This is your chance to be part of a groundbreaking digital venture, Hiven, that revolutionizes market-leading demand response solutions. You will work alongside a talented team of senior and junior specialists, playing a pivotal role in Fortum’s ambitious digitalization and AI journey.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join Fortum’s Data Science & Optimization team as a key player in our digitalization and AI journey. You will develop Hiven, our market-leading demand response solution, by creating efficient optimization and control solutions that meet customer needs and electricity market regulations.
   

  

 Your responsibilities include:
   

  

  

* Developing scalable forecasting, optimization, and steering algorithms
* Creating aggregation methods for scalability
* Designing tractable approximations when necessary
* Collaborating with backend and frontend teams on interfaces
* Supporting data scientists and ML engineers
* Learning about power system stability and testing requirements
* Coaching the team on system stability, tractability, and performance


 You will work closely with designers, developers, data scientists, and testers to achieve these goals.
   

  

 The positions can either be based in Sweden and Solna or Finland and Espoo.
   

  

**About You**
 We believe you are the perfect fit if you have a passion for innovation and a strong background in engineering and computer science.
   

  

 Here is in detail what we are looking for:
   

  

  

* A master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience
* Over 4 years of experience in stochastic control and optimization
* More than 3 years of solid software engineering experience, preferably in Python
* At least 2 years of experience working with cloud solutions, especially AWS
* Knowledgeable in statistics and data science with at least 1 year of hands-on experience
* Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers, and DevOps practices
* A firm grasp of software engineering principles such as SOLID and clean code
* Excellent communication skills and a keen interest in the energy sector
* Full professional proficiency in written and spoken English


 In addition to these core competencies, it would be a great advantage if you also have experience in the following areas:
   

  

  

* Machine Learning and Generative AI
* Electricity and flexibility markets
* Electrical vehicle chargers or home energy management systems
* Forecast models and parameter tuning
* Data engineering, including architecture development and deployment
* IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance, and support
* Data storage and maintenance methods
* Message brokers and microservice architectures
* Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IoT devices
* Working in an Agile environment


 Join us on this exciting journey where you will collaborate with a dynamic team to shape the future of energy. Your innovative ideas and technical prowess will help drive our mission forward.
   

  

**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Please submit your application by 2025-02-28 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com. For questions about Hiven, please contact Jani Leirimaa, CEO and founder of Hiven Energy, jani@hiven.energy.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.
   

  

**We are Fortum and Hiven**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonize their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
   

  

 For us working with start-ups and innovation means faster renewal and keeping up to date with the latest technologies. We want to be right at the forefront of innovation, dreaming up a better tomorrow. Therefore, Fortum invests time and resources in supporting innovation and start-ups, both internally and externally.
   

  

 Hiven is one of Fortum’s digital ventures for a cleaner future. Hiven is an innovative new service for companies wanting to deliver greener and smarter services to their customers. Hiven’s products include services such as smart charging with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to electric vehicles and electric vehicle chargers – and smart heating with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to heating appliances. All these devices are connected to Hiven to be steered in a smarter way.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Are you passionate about transforming raw data into actionable insights? My name is Wilhelm Windrup, and I lead the Analytics & Strategy Management team here at Telia Finance. Right now, we are seeking a skilled **Data** **Analyst** to join our team and play a critical role in helping us uncover patterns, trends, and insights that drive business decisions.


**Is this your new opportunity?**

As a Data Analyst for Telia Finance, you have a great passion for understanding financing business principles and how analytics play a strategic role in supporting it. To achieve analytical goals, you will need to show strong technical and logical thinking skills in working with structured and semi structured data to improve data quality, provide valuable business insights as well as be good communicator.


By applying various statistical and analytical techniques, such as exploratory, inferential, and diagnostic analysis, you will discover new trends and investigate potential causes. Additionally, you will work with databases, programming languages, and data visualization tools to present your findings in a clear and concise manner, ensuring effective communication for decision-making.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collect, organize, and interpret large sets of data to identify trends, patterns, and underlying causes.
* Work closely with stakeholders to define and test business hypotheses using data-driven insights.
* Apply statistical and analytical techniques, including exploratory, inferential, and diagnostic analysis, to discover new trends and identify potential causes.
* Utilize databases, programming languages, and data visualization tools to present findings in a clear and concise manner for effective decision-making.

**Is this you?**

To be successful in this role, we believe you have great experience in data exploration, insights generation and ensuring good data governance. You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, explore, analyze, and disseminate large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to details while maintaining the focus into what is the most important. We believe you are driven and proactively pursing new ideas and opportunities to improve business through data-driven approach.


Telia Finance is a company regulated by the Financial Supervisory Authority and is subject to specific accounting and regulatory requirements. These roles require at least one year of experience in a credit market company or a similar field.


**Key competencies:**

* Strong skills of data modelling, transformation and exploration using SQL, BI tools and/or Python.
* Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Qlik Sense (preferred), Power BI, Tableau, Looker or similar.
* Cloud platform experience, such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform
* Background from working in a financial company or credit market company
* Experience with data quality improvement along with data governance initiatives.
* Experience with databases, programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R), and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
* Bachelor or higher degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Data Science, or related discipline.
* Experience from working in agile development teams is a plus.
* Fluent skills in Swedish language

**It’s more than just a job**

At Telia Finance, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both professionally and personally. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.


**Interested?**

If you find this interesting, don’t hesitate to apply for this job. If you have any questions or just want to hear more, feel free to contact our Talent Partner Caroline Åberg at caroline.aberg@teliacompany.com or at Linkedin. Location for this position is Solna, Stockholm.


Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. In the last steps of the recruitment process, required controls will be performed.


**Last application date is:** 27th of February


We look forward to receiving your application!


**Welcome to Telia Finance – Home to your next big opportunity!**

title: Global Account Director - Nordics
description:
Change your job, change your workplace, change your future...


**We are actively building diverse teams and welcome applications from everyone**



Role: Global Account Director - Nordics  

Located: Solna, Sweden (Hybrid working)  

Package: Competitive salary, bonus and company benefits

  



(Ricoh operate a vibrant working policy giving you flexible hybrid working options)

  

**About Ricoh:**



Ricoh is a global technology business. As a company born in print, we design and manufacture graphic solutions that transform communications. To keep up with the pace of change in the workplace, we have built an extensive portfolio of innovative, industry-leading digital services spanning everything from Cloud & IT infrastructure solutions to process automation tools.



Everything we do is designed to help individuals achieve fulfilment through work. Through technology, we make work smarter and more creative. Enabling people to lead purposeful working lives and organisations to become more productive, sustainable and profitable.


What you will be doing


As the Global Account Director you will provide strategic account leadership on designated Global Major Accounts to achieve profitable growth for Ricoh and our customers.



Responsible for winning, growing, and maintaining total business globally to achieve both customer and Ricoh Family Group objectives.


* Achieve financial targets in line with defined priority areas such as global revenue, profitability and new services wins
* Own senior customer relationships and be accountable to senior internal Ricoh stakeholders for account performance
* Responsible for total customer business on global basis including hardware, software, services, and annuity
* Formulate and execute global account planning that provides clear vision, objectives, and strategy
* Identify and win new opportunities on a local, regional, and global basis across all Ricoh business areas
* Matrix management across the Ricoh Family Group to ensure virtual teams and resources are aligned in achieving customer objectives
* Deep understanding of the customer landscape including organisational priorities, industry challenges and decision-making process

  


Key Performance Measures

  

**Develop and Implement a Global Account Plan**

* Situational analysis of customer’s business and opportunity bridge to Ricoh strategy and offerings
* Framework for specific account priorities and actions, including activity within each stage of sales cycle
* Clear approach to meet or exceed financial and non-financial targets, including identifying gaps and taking corrective action
* Grow wallet share in strategic new business areas for Ricoh with a particular focus on priority services through co-creation and strategic roadmap activities

  


**Develop and Maintain Global Customer Relationships**

* Build strong senior stakeholder and operational network within the customer’s organization aligning to Ricoh
* Identify, develop, and maintain strong relationships within customer team / i.e. Coach, Influencer, Decision Maker, Executive
* Develop a deep understanding of the customer business and industry / vertical market. Bring thought leadership, share insights, and challenge the customer’s thinking to inspire action
* Understand the customer’s investment and decision-making process

  


**Manage Global Account Satisfaction and Loyalty**

* Accountable for the operational aspects and contractual commitments towards the customer
* Act quickly to ensure operational issues are resolved in a timely manner negating customer escalation
* Create long term commitment through joint business planning and customer engagement
* Turn customers into advocates to support wider Ricoh business, measured through Customer Satisfaction Index

  


**Build and Lead the Global Account Team**

* Motivate and inspire a global team including RGS, Region and Operating Company: sales, technical, and service delivery in line with Global Team Selling approach
* Sales leadership to the Operating Company and Lines of Business teams via a matrix reporting line
* Provide timely and accurate management information for business forecasting and budgeting
* Accountable for global revenues in order of magnitude of $20m per annum


You will ideally have


* Bachelor degree or equivalent required
* Master's Degree such as Executive MBA is desirable
* Fluent in English and local language of designated Global Major Accounts. Additional language(s) beneficial but not required.
* Experienced in global business transactions: knowledge around legal, regulatory, commercial and operational considerations in global business
* General knowledge and appreciation of key technology trends impacting upon customers
* IT literate for Microsoft Office and other business applications
* Travelled and/or lived in other countries and an appreciation of different cultures
* Flexibility in working across global time zones
* 10+ years Global Account Management experience
* 5+ years consultative selling experience
* Proven track record and/or experience in Strategic Acct Selling to Fortune Global 500 companies
* Comfortable operating in highly complex and rapidly changing environments
* Experienced working in cross-functional teams with leaders of other business units and vendors

  


FUNCTION### **Sales and Consulting**

LOCATION### **Sweden**

CONTRACT TYPE### **Permanent**

CLOSING DATE### **12-Mar-2025**

title: Data Scientist
description:
At Choreograph, part of GroupM, we’re leading the way in data-driven marketing solutions. We collaborate with the world’s most ambitious brands to solve complex challenges in media and marketing through data and technology. From econometrics and media buying algorithms to dashboards and strategic consulting, our work has an impact.
At Choreograph, data science plays a key role in how we support some of the world’s largest brands in making informed decisions. By leveraging advanced analytics and innovative methodologies, we empower businesses to optimize their marketing strategies and uncover insights that drive real results.
If you’re passionate about using data to solve challenging problems and want to work with brands such as Samsung, Tele2, Coca-Cola, TUI and L’oreal in a collaborative environment, this could be the perfect role for you!
**What you’ll do**  


We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing team in Stockholm. In this role, you will:* Take the lead in helping our clients understand and measure the true impact of their marketing investment using measurement methods such as Marketing mix modelling.
* You will collaborate closely with colleagues to transform technical output such as outputs from a model built using Python into clear, actionable insights. Your work will involve packaging and presenting these findings in an engaging and accessible way to inform and inspire C-level stakeholders at some of the largest companies in the Nordics.
* You will contribute to exciting and impactful projects, and be able to work on projects involving attribution modeling, experiments, and algorithm development, while also contributing to the development of automated reporting tools and other innovative data science initiatives.
**Qualifications**  


Requirements-Please note that this is an entry-level position (0–2 years of experience), so the competence level of below requirements should align with skills gained through education or limited work experience.* Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business administration or similar.
* A curious and business-oriented mindset, with a willingness to learn about (or prior knowledge of) the marketing industry.
* Strong storytelling and communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues and solutions to non-technical audiences.
* Experience from programming (we use Python as our main coding language)
* Experience applying analytical methods such as time series analysis, statistics, media mix modeling, or econometrics.
* You are fluent in both English and Swedish.
* You have a valid permit in Sweden.
* You have excellent skills in Excel and Powerpoint.
**Nice to have*** Practical experience in a data science, analytics consultant, or similar role.
* Hands-on experience with Marketing Mix Modelling.
* Previous experience of Bayesian statistics.
* Experience with Cloud platforms, SQL, GIT, Power BI, or other relevant technologies.

**Additional benefits at Choreograph*** The opportunity to work with leading global and local brands in a dynamic, innovative industry.
* A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive team culture.
* Access to personal and professional development opportunities within GroupM and WPP, with clear pathways for growth.
* A centrally located office in Stockholm, with flexible hybrid work options to support work-life balance.
* Benefits, including wellness allowances, pension plans, and occupational healthcare, to support your well-being.

**Application**  


The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.
In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.
**Contact**  


If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Lisa Gröning (lisa.groning@choreograph.com) or Viktor Åhlén (viktor.ahlen@choreograph.com). We do not accept applications via e-mail.
**About GroupM**  


GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Choreograph. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.
company_description: We are shaping the next era of media. Every day. Our teams have the privilege to work with the world's most purpose-driven, respected global brands.

title: Receptionist i sommar på Scandic Backadal
description:
Scandic Backadal ligger precis vid E6:an, bara fem minuter från centrala Göteborg. Vi är ett hotell som har en stor variation av gäster, allt ifrån fotbollslag till den inresta affärsgästen. Hos oss erbjuder vi våra gäster en mysig och personlig lobby samt en relaxavdelning redo med både pool och bastu. Vi som jobbar på Scandic Backadal är ett gäng med mycket glädje och engagemang. Vi tror helt enkelt på att nöjda medarbetare med möjlighet att utvecklas leder till bättre service och därmed nöjda gäster.


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Backadal.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning på deltid.


Sommaranställning under både vardagar och helger, from juni tom augusti. Vi söker både dagspersonal samt nattpersonal, procent kan variera.  

Med chans till extraanställning efter sommarperioden.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Product Manager – Customer Data Platforms
description:
**Company Description**  

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

 **Job Description**  

Are you an experienced Product Manager with a passion for delivering outstanding business results? Do you have what it takes to lead the development, improvement, and scalability of modern MarTech solutions? If your answer is yes, then we have an exciting opportunity for you!


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Product Manager to join the **Audience Data Platforms** product team and lead the continuous development and management of our **Customer Data Platform (CDP) solution** and audience targeting and segmentation capabilities. Your team’s mission is to provide modern and relevant audience creation and targeting capabilities to empower business users and regional marketing colleagues and their activation agencies. Your team’s goals are to build, implement and enable the right tools, automate business processes, decrease time to value, and contribute to driving sales and profitability with media and customer experience optimization in mind.


The Audience Data Platforms product team is part of the **Marketing Business Components** area, a global technology team driving core MarTech capabilities for the business. We are on a mission to transform and scale our marketing technology stack, dedicated to delivering exceptional value to our customers through innovative marketing solutions.


The Marketing Business Components area is part of the **Consumer & Sales Unit**, a global cross-functional and customer-centric function within the H&M Business Tech organization, with focus to deliver platforms and systems that enable an outstanding customer experience.

**Responsibilities**


As a Product Manager, you will lead the development and execution of our CDP solution globally, ensuring seamless integration with the rest of the marketing technology stack and our data mesh/data products. You will be responsible for driving the product vision, strategy, and roadmap, focusing on enhancing the audience targeting and segmentation capabilities to deliver personalized customer experiences, across email, site, app & paid media channels, ensuring that the product meets end-user needs and brings value to the business.


You will leverage your subject matter expertise in the business, technical and data areas, closely collaborate with other product managers, business experts, data engineers, data analysts, solution and application experts, as well as the wider business and tech stakeholders.


You will contribute to the ideation, analysis, and business case creation to improve and scale our audience management and activation solutions, implement new use cases including the automation of target segment creation, enabling cross-channel activation, omni-experience personalization and cross-channel orchestration. Simply put, you and your team are the key to enabling the right audience at the right time with the right message on the right channel!


Your key responsibilities will include:

* **Product Leadership:** Lead and manage a cross-functional team to develop, implement, and oversee tech solutions and capabilities on a global scale. Define, align and communicate product vision, strategy, and roadmap with our brand direction and business needs.
* **Customer Value Creation:** Develop and implement solutions to create exceptional value for our customers and business users, through effective adoption of CDP capabilities and audience driven marketing activation strategies.
* **Stakeholder and Partner Collaboration:** Work closely with internal teams and external vendors to ensure alignment with business goals and desired outcomes, understand strategic priorities that address critical business challenges.
* **Business Case Development:** Create hypothesis-driven business cases to outline the expected value from product improvements and secure necessary funding. Manage project risks and issues effectively to ensure successful product delivery. Oversee the timely delivery of new features and products, ensuring resources are allocated appropriately to support business needs.
* **Operational Stability and Security**: Ensure stable operations by implementing appropriate resource monitoring and incident management processes. Define, implement, and track security and performance metrics to ensure continual optimization and secure performance.
* **Value Management:** Maintain the financial health and outcomes of technical solutions by optimizing cost efficiency and ensuring sustained financial viability, with a strong focus on commercial outcomes and value realization.

  

**Qualifications**  

As a Product Manager, you should have the ability to understand and analyze information and determine the best course of action, resulting in business value & end-user satisfaction. You take responsibility, work proactively and continuously measure and improve activities in a fast-paced dynamic and technical and data driven environment. You have great skills in influencing others within the organization and you can effectively communicate your ideas, both within the team and with different stakeholder groups and prioritize what needs to be done based on business requirements and potential impact. You are truly a doer, willing to get hands-on solving any problems needed to help the product move forward.


In addition to this, we’re looking for someone who has:

* Proven experience (5+ years) within the area of marketing and advertising tech solutions related to CDP, CRM, audience management, and channel activation.
* Strong understanding of CDP architecture and functionalities with experience in solution integration, knowledge of data ingestion, data processing, and data activation needs.
* Experience with audience segmentation and targeting capabilities and understanding of marketing analytics and marketing automation tools and platforms.
* Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies and ability to manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables with hands-on experience in agile ways of working and tools (Jira, Confluence, etc.).
* Experience with GCP services, including BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflows, and general knowledge of GCP's data processing and analytics capabilities, security, and compliance features.
* Knowledge of customer data transformation and ETL tools, processes, and best practices to design and implement data pipelines.
* Strong understanding of global data protection and privacy acts such as GDPR, CCPA, etc.
* Experience working with external suppliers and solution providers.
* Strong understanding of user behaviors, customer journey, and end-user feedback.
* Full ownership of the product lifecycle with strong experience in digital product development goal setting and performance measurement frameworks (OKRs and KPIs)
* Strong communication and coordination skills, identify responsibilities, and engage stakeholder community to share best practices.

  

**Additional Information**  

This position is based in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible.  

Apply by sending in your **CV in English**.

**Diversity, Inclusion, and Innovation**


At H&M Group, we're deeply committed to fostering a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We actively seek out qualified candidates regardless of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.  

  

Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.

**Our Offer**


At H&M Group, you're not just joining a team – you're joining a value-driven culture and an expansive tech network. Enjoy perks like staff discount cards, flexible work arrangements, wellness benefits, parental support, and more. Here, you're encouraged to be yourself, experiment, and chart your own growth path. As you flourish, so do we, with opportunities to create tangible impacts and shape the future.

title: Next Generation: RAN Stability Verification Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**
---------------------------

  

Want to start or continue your career development, working in one of the most exciting and innovative industries? This is a unique opportunity for an enthusiastic and hard-working individual, to thrive in one of the most sought-after employers in Sweden. What can YOU bring to Ericsson?

  

We are eagerly searching for a person who brings energy, passion, initiative, a curious mindset, and above all, a passion for learning and growing. Your qualities and values are characteristics that Ericsson strongly encourages, as well as respect for colleagues. Our People and Customers are what drives us forward and underpins everything that we do.

  

The role of RAN Stability System Verification Engineer is located in Kista Sweden. Ericsson promotes and supports, a hybrid workplace environment. This is a full-time, and permanent based position within the Customer Experience (CX) organization. Your main focus will be testing, troubleshooting, and delivering, Ericsson RAN Access Network (RAN) products to our global Customers. You will also be expected to develop your Cloud Native skills, in developing innovative solutions that moves Ericsson further, along the Digitalization pathway.

  

The ideal candidate should bring all of the qualities aforementioned, together with an engineering background, where one is able to demonstrate strong and proven analytical skills. Teamwork is an integral part of this role, and the candidate should have very good communication skills, and be energized working in a strong, team environment

  

We are actively seeking the next wave of tech talent through our NextGen graduate initiative in Stockholm. This opportunity is for recent graduates with 0-3 years of experience who are eager to launch a meaningful career in technology. Although we have an exceptional team in place, we are always focused on building for the future. If you're ready to make an impact, this is your chance to join us.

**What you will do:**
---------------------

* Drive end-to-end system level tests in RAN technologies. Is the product suitable to release to the Customer?
* Perform requirement analysis for feature integration and verification. Does the requirement meet what the Customer expects?
* Perform system level troubleshooting procedures. Is my issue related to product, or environment?
* Deliver software assessments based on a data-driven and analytical approach. Which parts of the data are critical to my decision?
* Participate in customer validation tests. How well did our tests address the requirements?
* Drive continuous improvements of products, structures and processes. How can we improve?
* Develop competence in technical domain. Am I continually upskilling myself?
* Create innovative solutions which increase the teams’ efficiency. How can we reduce the lead-time?

**You will bring:**
-------------------

* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Science or Engineering
* Excellent analytical and problem solving/troubleshooting skills
* Logical and critical thinking skills
* Self-motivator and have a can-do attitude
* Strong team & interpersonal skills
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

 **Additional Assets:**

* NR & LTE knowledge or experience is desired (or a keen interest demonstrated)
* Awareness of Software Development Life Cycle
* Some Data Science exposure, such as Python, R or equivalent
* Knowledge of Cloud Native principles, Machine Learning and AI
* Git/Gerrit
* Jenkins and Linux Shell scripting

title: Named Enterprise Account Executive (Finland focus)
description:
SLSQ426R82



Want to help solve the world's toughest problems with data and AI? This is what we do every day at Databricks.



Databricks operates at the leading edge of the Data and AI space. Our customers turn to us to lead the accelerated innovation their businesses need to gain first-mover advantage in today's ultra-competitive landscape.



We are looking for a creative, delivery-oriented Named Enterprise Account Executive to join the team in the Nordic Region to maximise the phenomenal market opportunity that exists for Databricks. As an Account Executive, you know how to sell innovation and value to existing customers, identify new use cases and grow consumption and can guide deals forward to compress decision cycles. You love understanding a product in depth and are passionate about communicating its value to customers and partners. You will be offered huge potential for career progression with the pace of the team's growth.



This position is based in Sweden and you will report to the Sales Director for Enterprise Sales, Finland.


**The impact you will have:**


* Assess your territory and develop a successful execution strategy
* Drive quarter-on-quarter consumption growth in existing accounts
* Exceed activity and quarterly revenue targets
* Track all customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting in Salesforce
* Identify new use case opportunities and showcase value to existing customers
* Promote the value of the Databricks' Data Intelligence Platform
* Orchestrate and utilise our field engineering teams to ensure valuable outcomes for clients
* Build and demonstrate value with all engagements to guide successful negotiations to close point


**What we look for:**


* Extensive understanding of the data platform, open source and cloud ecosystems
* Highly skilled in prospecting research and ability to map out key stakeholders
* Demonstrated success in Value Selling and developing a mutual action plan
* Ability to influence decision-making and strategy with customer leadership teams
* Ability to establish credibility with the C-suite
* Adept in selling to technical buyers
* Experience growing consumption and closing commit deals in a direct sales role
* Mastery of MEDDPICC
* Bachelor's Degree or relevant work experience
* Fluency in English is required, fluency in Swedish and/or Finnish is preferred

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**



If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.
