title: Senior General Business Sales Executive, Sweden
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

  

**EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS**

* Account and Customer Relationship Management
* Achieve / exceed quota targets in Cloud subscription revenue
* Sales strategies - Develops effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and sustainable growth.
* Develop relationships in new and existing customers and leverage to drive strategy through organization.
* Trusted advisor - Establishes strong relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and commitment to value (value of counsel and expertise, value of solutions, value of implementation expertise).
* Builds a foundation on which to harvest future business opportunities and accurate account information and coaching.
* Customer Acumen - Actively understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and competitive landscape.
* Review public information (e.g. new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the prospect.
* Territory and Account Leadership - Lead designated territory, including accounts, account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles. Encourage all accounts to become SAP references.
* Business Planning – Develop and deliver comprehensive business plan to address customer and prospects priorities and pain points.

  

Demand Generation, Pipeline and Opportunity Management:

* Pipeline planning - Follow a disciplined approach to maintaining a rolling pipeline. Keep pipeline current and moving up the pipeline curve.
* Pipeline partnerships – Leverage support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory.
* Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap.
* Support all SAP promotions and events in the territory.

 **WORK EXPERIENCE**

* 5+ years of experience in selling complex business software / IT solutions
* Strong experience in C-level conversations and negotiations
* Proven track records in business application software sales for Cloud/SaaS solutions.
* Work experience in relevant industry or line of business roles.
* Several years of Large Account Management experience / leading account teams.
* Knowledge of SAPs Service and Support along with understanding of ERP offerings is a plus.
* Demonstrated success with large transactions and lengthy sales campaigns in a fast-paced, consultative and competitive market.
* Outstanding communication and presentation skills in Swedish and English

 **EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES**

* Master’s degree or equivalent in suitable field – business process understanding is needed.
* Exceptional communication skills, able to effectively communicate in every environment, including informing and presenting to CxO level.

title: Sustainability Advisor med fokus på digitalisering
description:
För Fellowmind går hållbarhet hand i hand med digitalisering. Vi vet att digitala lösningar spelar en avgörande roll för att skapa hållbarhetsstrategier som gör skillnad, på riktigt. Som en strategisk Partner till Microsoft är vi experter på molnlösningar i framkant där hållbarhet är ett av områdena som vi tagit en ledande roll inom. Vi ser en stor potential i att hjälpa våra kunder med sin ESG-data, koppla samman den med affärsinformation och se till att våra kunder kan optimera sin hållbarhetsstrategi och ta datadrivna beslut framåt.
  
Vi söker nu en Sustainability Advisor som vill guida våra kunder i digitaliseringsresan tillsammans med våra systemexperter och vara med att bygga vidare på vårt erbjudande inom hållbarhetsområdet. Att du dessutom får chansen att joina Sveriges Bästa Arbetsgivare är ytterligare ett plus!
  
Om rollen
  
Som Sustainability Advisor kommer du ha en nyckelroll i våra kunddialoger och vidareutveckling av våra erbjudande kring hållbarhet.
  
Du kommer vara en självklar kontaktyta och drivande strategisk part för alla våra nya och befintliga kunder, där du tillsammans med dem identifierar hur lagar och rapporteringskrav (CSRD) egentligen påverkar deras verksamhet. Analysen sträcker sig ofta över alla ESG-områden såväl som hållbarhetsrapportering och handlingsplaner som är integrerade i företagets övergripande affärsstrategi.
  
Affärsnyttan för våra kunder kommer du sedan översätta till en digitaliseringsplan som vi skapar genom att koppla samman ESG-data med övrig affärsinformation. Vi tror att du har ett brinnande intresse att förstå hur våra analysplattformar kan göra skillnad för kundens verksamhet och gärna äger kommunikationen kring detta. Även om du själv inte bygger systemlösningarna i Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability och Microsoft Sustainability Manager så kommer du ha ett nära samarbete med våra arkitekter där ni tillsammans säkerställer våra leveranser. För våra befintliga kunder kommer du även driva vidareutveckling av rapporteringsverktygen och analysplattformarna framåt för att de ska få ut så mycket värde som möjligt från sina investeringar.
  
Som Sustainability Advisor kommer du vara delaktig i att inspirera och konceptualisera de senaste trenderna på hållbarhetsområdet i webbinarium och workshops. Du blir även tongivande för hur vi kan utveckla vårt erbjudande gentemot våra olika kundsegment.
  
Då ESG-data inbegriper stora delar av en kunds verksamhetsprocesser ser vi det som en styrka att Fellowmind har kompetens inom allt från Microsofts ERP, molninfrastruktur, dataanalys och AI, till CRM, intranät och Modern Workplace. Digitala helhetslösningar präglar våra leveranser och ligger i linje med vår Connected Company strategi, där hållbarhet har en självklar plats.
  
Vem är du?
  
**Du arbetar idag med ESG-data och hållbarhetsrapportering:** det kan vara inom samtliga E,S och G-områden eller mer specifikt utsläppsrapportering. Du bidrar till att arbeta med hållbarhet på en strategisk och långsiktig nivå och har en aktiv roll i att hjälpa verksamheten vidare i hållbarhetsarbetet. Sannolikt har du idag en roll som hållbarhetsrådgivare, sustainability controller eller kanske till och med som finansiell controller eller redovisningsekonom med fokus på hållbarhet. Du bör ha en god insikt i Sveriges befintliga lagkrav kring hållbarhetsredovisning och därtill de nya med CSRD och vill nu omsätta dessa i affärsnytta genom rätt digitala lösningar för en mer effektiv grön omställning. Du behöver inte ha varit konsult tidigare för att söka rollen, även om vi förstås ser det som meriterande för din ansökan. Då du kommer att jobba mot både svenska och internationella kunder är det en försättning att du kan kommunicera obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
  
Som person tror vi att du är har en stor portion driv och målmedvetenhet som kommer genomsyra dina dialoger med kund och i de projekt som du tar dig an. Likaså att du är positiv, öppen och trygg i kommunikationen med beslutsfattare på olika nivåer i en organisation. Vidare tror vi att du är affärsmässig och genuint intresserad av hur vi kan skapa värde för kundernas verksamheter och liksom vi brinner för digitalisering som en möjliggörare.
  
Det praktiska
  
**Start:** Omgående, men vi har givetvis förståelse för att du har uppsägningstid som vi behöver ta hänsyn till.
  
**Omfattning:** Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är väldigt flexibla här och utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter.
  
**Placering:** På något av våra centralt placerade kontor i Malmö, Göteborg, Helsingborg, Halmstad, Jönköping, Växjö eller Stockholm. Beroende på projekt så kan resor till kund förekomma i tjänsten.
  
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 16/3, men skicka gärna in din ansökan omgående då vi jobbar med löpande urval.
  
Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att bestå av telefonintervju, djupintervjuer, tester/case och referenstagning.

Som Sustainability Advisor kommer du vara delaktig i att inspirera och konceptualisera de senaste trenderna på hållbarhetsområdet i webbinarium och workshops. Du blir även tongivande för hur vi kan utveckla vårt erbjudande gentemot våra olika kundsegment.
  
Då ESG-data inbegriper stora delar av en kunds verksamhetsprocesser ser vi det som en styrka att Fellowmind har kompetens inom allt från Microsofts ERP, molninfrastruktur, dataanalys och AI, till CRM, intranät och Modern Workplace. Digitala helhetslösningar präglar våra leveranser och ligger i linje med vår Connected Company strategi, där hållbarhet har en självklar plats.
  
Vem är du?
  
**Du arbetar idag med ESG-data och hållbarhetsrapportering:** det kan vara inom samtliga E,S och G-områden eller mer specifikt utsläppsrapportering. Du bidrar till att arbeta med hållbarhet på en strategisk och långsiktig nivå och har en aktiv roll i att hjälpa verksamheten vidare i hållbarhetsarbetet. Sannolikt har du idag en roll som hållbarhetsrådgivare, sustainability controller eller kanske till och med som finansiell controller eller redovisningsekonom med fokus på hållbarhet. Du bör ha en god insikt i Sveriges befintliga lagkrav kring hållbarhetsredovisning och därtill de nya med CSRD och vill nu omsätta dessa i affärsnytta genom rätt digitala lösningar för en mer effektiv grön omställning. Du behöver inte ha varit konsult tidigare för att söka rollen, även om vi förstås ser det som meriterande för din ansökan. Då du kommer att jobba mot både svenska och internationella kunder är det en försättning att du kan kommunicera obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
  
Som person tror vi att du är har en stor portion driv och målmedvetenhet som kommer genomsyra dina dialoger med kund och i de projekt som du tar dig an. Likaså att du är positiv, öppen och trygg i kommunikationen med beslutsfattare på olika nivåer i en organisation. Vidare tror vi att du är affärsmässig och genuint intresserad av hur vi kan skapa värde för kundernas verksamheter och liksom vi brinner för digitalisering som en möjliggörare.
  
Det praktiska
  
**Start:** Omgående, men vi har givetvis förståelse för att du har uppsägningstid som vi behöver ta hänsyn till.
  
**Omfattning:** Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är väldigt flexibla här och utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter.
  
**Placering:** På något av våra centralt placerade kontor i Malmö, Göteborg, Helsingborg, Halmstad, Jönköping, Växjö eller Stockholm. Beroende på projekt så kan resor till kund förekomma i tjänsten.
  
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 16/3, men skicka gärna in din ansökan omgående då vi jobbar med löpande urval.
  
Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att bestå av telefonintervju, djupintervjuer, tester/case och referenstagning.

title: Solutions Architect - Stockholm
description:
At Funnel, Solutions Architects play a crucial role in designing solutions that align with customers' business goals. Leveraging the Funnel ecosystem, you will balance business and technical requirements to ensure the proposed solution fits the client's architecture and meets their needs. This role focuses primarily on Enterprise clients and involves meeting customers on-site as part of an account team.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Solution Design: Create solution architectures that align with business goals and technical requirements, including integration with existing systems, during both pre-and post-sales stages
* Implementation Guidance: Collaborate with Solutions Consultants (SCs), client stakeholders, and technical teams to guide the implementation of Funnel and ensure it delivers on customer objectives
* Technical Vision: Lead the technical vision and strategy for enterprise clients, including risk analysis and mitigation planning
* Product Improvement: Identify gaps in the Funnel product or processes and initiate changes in collaboration with commercial and product teams
* Complex Problem-Solving: Act as a project lead to address complex use cases for customers
* Product Expertise: Develop deep expertise in the Funnel platform
* Collaboration & Advocacy – Work closely with internal teams (Support, Product, Sales) to relay feedback, drive improvements, and ensure customer needs are met

**Who You Are**


We’re looking for a tech-savvy team player with exceptional communication skills. You’re solution oriented, proactive, and thrive in dynamic environments. Eager to learn and help, you excel in consultative roles, confidently guiding and supporting customers as a Funnel expert. Your analytical mindset and passion for working with data drive you to dive deep into problems and craft effective solutions.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
* 5+ years of experience in technical customer-facing role
* Experience working with cloud platforms
* Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python, JavaScript, etc.) and SQL
* Fluency in English

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in business, statistics, mathematics, economics, engineering, applied science, or a related field
* Experience in online advertising technology, data integration, and cloud technologies
* Familiarity with trends and business challenges in digital industries
* Strong relationship-building, stakeholder management, and influencing skills
* Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills
  
* Fluency in additional European languages (e.g., Spanish, German, or French)

**The Solutions Consulting Team**


You’ll join a diverse team of Solutions Consultants and Solutions Architects, reporting to the Global Manager of Solutions Architects. Our team brings together backgrounds in sales engineering, consulting, software engineering, and project management. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, collaborative, and fun work environment where team members learn from one another, experiment with new ideas, and combine their diverse perspectives to solve business challenges.

 **Who we are**  

Take a look at our Funnel benefits!


Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.  

Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.  

  

Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.  

Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.

  

Other information  

This role is based in our Stockholm office. At Funnel, we embrace an office-first approach, working on-site at least four days a week. While we offer plenty of flexibility for life’s events, summer months, and holidays, we aim to avoid fixed remote workdays.


We do not offer sponsorship or relocation for this position, and therefore we will take into consideration only applicants;  

  

* Who is located in Stockholm
* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship
* Have a valid work permit for working in Sweden
company_description: We have helped more than 1000 customers to grow their business – including digital leaders like Home Depot, Havas Media, and Samsung. Founded in Sweden and with offices in Stockholm and Boston, MA, we

title: AWS Architect
description:
**Job Description - Grade Specific**
------------------------------------

Är du en erfaren AWS-expert som brinner för att använda de senaste molntjänsterna och teknikerna? Vårt AWS-team växer och vi söker efter dig som är; AWS Architect, AWS Specialist, AWS Solution Architect, AWS System Architect, Tech Lead, eller AWS DevSecOps Developer.  

  



Capgemini söker passionerade AWS-experter, DevSecOps-ingenjörer samt Cloud Engineers för att ansluta sig till vårt dynamiska team i **Göteborg** . Ta din karriär till nästa nivå med oss och arbeta med banbrytande projekt!
  

  

Vill du i din nästa arbetsroll ha möjlighet att påverka, bidra och leda oss framåt på nordisk nivå? Oavsett om du drivs av tekniskt hands-on arbete, ta de stora besluten eller leda experterna så har vi möjligheter för dig!
  

  

Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med innovativa och mångsidiga projekt som använder de senaste AWS-teknologierna, GenAI och moderna frameworks. Vi erbjuder oändliga möjligheter för lärande och utveckling för att ta din karriär till nya höjder, med karriärvägar för arkitekter, tech leads, juniorer, gurus och alla däremellan. #GetTheFutureYouWant. Du blir en del av en vänlig och inkluderande miljö som firar mångfald och främjar samarbete. Dessutom erbjuder vi flexibla arbetstider som främjar en hälsosam balans mellan arbete och fritid.  

  



**OM ROLLEN**  

*Exempel på områden som du kan komma att arbeta med:*

* Leda mjukvaruleveranser på AWS.
* Designa och implementera robusta och skalbara AWS-lösningar.
* Säkerställ säkerhet och effektivitet i våra DevSecOps-processer, AIOps och CI/CD pipelines med AWS.
* Lösningsarkitektur för större system och microservicesarkitektur på AWS.
* Bygg och underhåll data pipelines och datalager i AWS.
Hantera och optimera molninfrastrukturen för våra kunder.  
* 

**DIN PROFIL**

* Minst tre års erfarenhet av AWS-tjänster.
* Kunskap om programmering eller skriptspråk.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med tjänster som exempelvis; AWS SageMaker, AWS Glue, AWS Security Hub, AWS API Gateway, AWS ECS, EWS Lamdba, AWS CodePipeline, AWS Step Functions.
* Förståelse för bästa praxis inom molnarkitektur och säkerhet.
Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift då båda språken kommer användas i det dagliga arbetet.  
* 

**VAD VI TROR KOMMER FÅ DIG ATT TRIVAS**

* Du kommer att arbeta med de nyaste teknikerna och kompetensväxla i samarbeten med andra specialister.
* Du får också chansen att påverka några av världens största bolag och bidra till att bygga AWS-kapabilitet på nordisk nivå.
* Du kommer att utvecklas via våra utbildningar och tilldelas värdefulla certifieringar inom de senaste teknologierna, som exempelvis AI, AWS eller Microsoft Azure.
* Nyttja Capgeminis olika fokusområden, såsom Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club och Art club.
* Vi erbjuder generöst friskvårdsbidrag och tjänstepension, bonusprogram, företagshälsovård och sjukvårdsförsäkring.
* En rolig och engagerande arbetsplats där du kan njuta av teambyggande aktiviteter, sociala evenemang med en härlig kontorskultur.
**ANSÖKAN**  

Redo att ta din karriär till nästa nivå? Ansök nu och bli en del av Capgemini Sveriges innovativa AWS-team! Rekryteringsarbetet sker med löpande urval, så välkommen in med din ansökan redan idag!
  

#LI-ET1


**OM CAPGEMINI**  

Hos våra kunder arbetar vi i leveranser som kan ha bland annat AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, Java, Go/Golang, Python, Kotlin, Node, HTML, TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, Java, CloudFormation, Terraform, Docker, Kafka, React, Angular, Vue, Bash, Spring, GenAI, GraphQL, Backstage, Kubernetes, LLM, RAG, Copilot, GitHub Actions, SonarQube, BlackDuck, Apache Beam, Kong, Jenkins, Apigee, OpenShift, Ansible, DevSecOps, cloud architecture, cloud assessments, integration, Snowflake, Elastic Search, Grafana, Kibana, Splunk, Databricks, HelmChart, CloudFoundry.  

  

  

  

Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda deras övergång till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2023 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,5 miljarder euro.


Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Electrical/ Mechanical Technician, Data Center
description:
• High school or equivalent diploma;
• 1 to 4 years of Knowledge of key electrical competencies and theory; generic mechanical room infrastructure such as chillers, cooler units, and fan controls; backup generator systems;
• Valid EU driving license;
  

We are currently hiring Data Center Engineering Operations Technicians to work as technical resources in our mission-critical data centers in multiple locations across Sweden: Eskilstuna, Västerås, and Katrineholm. 
Data Center Engineering Operations Technician is a hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operation responder. If you like to use apply your electrical and mechanical skills to solve problems, we’d like to meet you. Your work will help to maintain one of the world's largest information system infrastructures.
AWS Infrastructure Services (AIS)
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
A valid driver's license is required for this role.
This position requires the ability to work a 24x7 shift rotation.
Key job responsibilities
Troubleshoot and monitor mechanical, electrical, HVAC, voice/data, cooling, fire/life safety systems, and generators. 
Assist contractors or engineers in maintaining facility equipment, deploying new equipment (racks, cabling, etc.), and conducting site walkthroughs to verify equipment and system operations. 
In this role, you will act as a First Responder to critical events and support both new and existing data center facilities.
SAFETY
Follow and maintain the highest safety standards and diligently encourage a world-class safety culture. As a facility owner team, ensure remediation of safety risks/issues in conjunction with other teams. Own the safety initiatives and projects to foster strong safety culture.
ENGINEERING & FACILITY OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE
Operational experience and familiarity with electrical and mechanical equipment, including Uninterruptable Power Supplies (UPS’s), Switchgear, Circuit Breakers, Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS's), Diesel Generators, Chillers, Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC), Exhaust Fans, Variable Frequency Drives (VFD's), and Transformers. This equipment supports mission-critical servers and must maintain better than 99.999% uptime. Support the maintenance and monitoring of all data center systems, including incidents, events, problems, changes, and escalations.
o Troubleshoot events within internal Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
o Take daily operational readings of all mechanical and electrical equipment through routine rounds/log-taking (temperatures, voltages, currents, etc.)
o Supervise contractors who perform servicing or preventive maintenance
Physical requirements
• Manual handling and lifting of equipment may be required (weight limits in accordance with regulations).
• Ability to work shifts (morning, late and night) 
• On-call rotation reaction to off-duty emergency calls (if applicable)
• Work at heights and from ladders; in a noisy environment with ear protection
• Perform physical tasks during the shift
A day in the life
Your day-to-day activities will include:
Monitoring alarms and systems that manage power, cooling, and fire suppression in the data center.
Coordinating vendor work on-site to ensure equipment is maintained and uptime is preserved.
Supporting other teams and sites during events and planned works.
Handling rack installations and powering up equipment.
Monitoring and facilitating the handover of new equipment.
Sharing knowledge and supporting new team members.
Participating in event response drills.
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

* Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant discipline + Professional Certification in Electrical, Mechanical or Controls engineering.
* Experience in operations of critical facilities (Heavy Industry or Data Centers) which require in-depth knowledge in electrical, mechanical, and control systems and Data Center engineering experience

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: VMware Cloud Director Administrator
description:
**VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator** 



* Deploy and configure VMware Cloud Director components.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with vCenter Server and NSX for networking.
* Configure resource pools, storage policies, and other infrastructure elements.
* Create and manage organizations (tenants) and assign roles and permissions to users and groups.
* Enforce security policies and manage access controls.
* Allocate and manage compute, storage, and network resources for tenants.
* Monitor resource utilization and ensure optimal performance.
* Handle resource scaling for dynamic workloads.
* Onboard new tenants and set up their virtual datacenters (vDCs).
* Provide tenants with self-service portals and catalog access.
* Handle tenant-specific configurations, such as virtual networking and VM templates.
* Apply updates and patches to VMware Cloud Director and underlying infrastructure.
* Conduct backup and disaster recovery testing.
* Leverage APIs to automate provisioning and management tasks.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with third-party tools or custom scripts for automation.
* Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory standards.



 Key Skills and Knowledge Areas
 


* Virtualization: Deep understanding of VMware vSphere, including ESXi hosts and vCenter Server.
* Networking: Knowledge of VMware NSX (V or T), VLANs, VPNs, and software-defined networking (SDN).
* Storage: Experience with storage systems and VMware storage technologies like vSAN.
* Cloud Management: Familiarity with multi-tenancy and self-service concepts.
* Scripting: Skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or RESTful API usage.
* Security: Understanding of security principles, firewalls, and access control.



 Tools and Technologies
 


* VMware Cloud Director: Primary platform for administration.
* vSphere/vCenter: Managing the underlying infrastructure.
* NSX: For networking and security.
* vRealize Suite: Includes tools like vRealize Operations and vRealize Orchestrator.
* Third-party integrations: Tools like Terraform or Ansible for infrastructure as code

 For this client, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new Senior Data Engineer, you will collaborate with product owners, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation helping business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.
 



  





 You will be responsible for delivering value-add products, ensuring high success rates as well as being an ambassador that data quality is always a priority. Your primary focus will be designing, building and implementing scalable data products on our global data platform and securing ownership and stability of the products.

* Data Engineering

* Python
* SQL
* Cloud (AWS)

* Experience working within scrum and in an agile team



  





 Preferably you would be someone with strong experience in ETL processes and data pipelines.
 



  





 If you are interested in learning more please apply today!!
 



  





 To find out all other details, please apply below! We look forward to receiving your application.

title: System Engineer
company_industry: Software Development and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
Are you a passionate Systems Engineer with network expertise, driven by designing, building, and operating the infrastructure that supports professional digital systems?
 



  





 Being part of our IT team means joining a modern Nordic IT organization that provides shared IT solutions to thousands of dedicated colleagues across various industries, including media, content marketing, and travel. You will primarily be working from our office in Stockholm, but we also have offices in Copenhagen and Oslo!
 



  





 A well-functioning infrastructure is crucial to supporting the business on all levels, and we are now looking for someone who seeks the unique opportunity of ‘owning the systems.’ You will have the freedom to shape the future of our infrastructure, ensuring it not only meets but exceeds our organizational needs through your vision and expertise.
 



  





**Your Role and Responsibilities** 




  





 A typical day involves varied technical operational tasks combined with new development projects, including:
 



  




* Designing, implementing, and managing network infrastructure and services (Servers, LAN, WAN, VPN, Cloud setups in Azure and AWS).
* Configuring and maintaining networks and servers while monitoring performance and integrity.
* Collaborating with IT colleagues across locations to design and build integrated system solutions.
* Helping design and implement IT security strategies, including next-generation firewall features and other security measures.


- 


 While your main focus will be on network solutions, we also expect you to be hands-on with system operations, including logging into Windows/Linux servers and assisting colleagues with daily tasks.
 



  





 In this role, you will work closely with teams across the organization, both locally and at the Nordic level, and see the positive impact of your work in practice.
 



  





**Your Skills and Experience** 




  





 We believe you will thrive in this role if you:
 



  




* Have several years of experience in a similar position.
* Preferably hold relevant certifications such as Cisco/CCNP, Fortinet, or Microsoft and are familiar with Azure/AWS network suites and Windows servers.
* Enjoy taking ownership of systems and solutions.
* Like working in a hybrid infrastructure setup.
* Value collaboration with skilled IT professionals across teams and borders.
* Can present technical solutions to stakeholders.
* Are fluent in English and at least one Nordic language.



  





 You will work with modern and evolving infrastructure, including Windows and Linux servers, Cisco and Fortinet solutions, and extensive Azure integration. Tasks include monitoring, patch management, backup, SD-WAN, VPN, and more. Experience in planning, implementing, and troubleshooting servers will be an advantage.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




  





 You will join a team of dedicated IT specialists who appreciate an informal work environment and are driven to translate business needs into solutions. We offer a high level of flexibility, including the opportunity to work remotely when needed, while also valuing in-person collaboration at our offices.
 



  





 We believe in social engagement, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. You can expect a competitive salary based on your skills and experience, along with development opportunities and training. We are looking for the right mix of an independent driver and a real team player.

title: AV Support Engineer
description:
Do you wish to work with some of the best and most innovative audio and video solutions? And are you passionate about helping customers create the experiences they had expected by guiding, training and assisting them?
 



  





 Then our position as AV Technical Support Engineer in our Stockholm office could be the right one for you.
 



  





**What we do** 




  





 We make the world’s most extraordinary audio and video solutions.
 



  





 For over 40 years, Biamp has created and innovated professional audiovisual solutions that enable great communication. From the smallest of rooms to the largest of venues, we empower true human connection in every space.
 



  





 As we grow to meet our customers’ needs and evolve to address the challenges of tomorrow, one guiding principle remains the same: Biamp connects people through extraordinary audiovisual experiences.
 



  





**About our company** 




  





 We’re growing. In the span of just four years, five companies have joined the Biamp family, increasing our product offerings and expanding our presence within the global market.
 



  





 We’re global. Installed in thousands of applications in over 100 countries, our products are supported by our employees located throughout 15 Biamp locations worldwide.
 



  





 We’re empowered. Joining a scaling company means employees have greater opportunities to gain experience while effecting genuine change within the organization.
 



  





 We’re cutting-edge (but local about it). Initial design, engineering, manufacturing, and testing are all managed within our own facilities, leading to shorter lead times, faster responses, and greater convenience for our clients overall.
 



  





**Job Summary** 




  





 As an AV Technical Support Engineer you assist customers with technical questions, product and design problems, technical training, and occasional site visits. You will have daily interaction with Biamp customers, consultants and sales representatives, dealing with a variety of complex technical issues.
 



  





 You will be a part of our European Customer Experience Team and work out of our office in Stockholm.
 



  





**Your tasks and responsibilities** 




  




* Provide expert and friendly technical support to Biamp’s customers by phone, email and chat
* Provide commissioning, optimization and design assistance
* Troubleshoot and resolve a range of technical issues to an advanced level
* Coordinate returns and repairs of Biamp products as needed
* Document and escalate issues to engineering or other departments as required
* Make occasional site visits to customer installations, and conduct occasional customer trainings
* Internal testing, content creation and documentation for new products
* Contribute to Biamp’s online knowledgebase
* Assist with product set-up and staging at tradeshows



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* A minimum of 3 years of experience in the Audio/Video/Control Systems industry
* Relevant degree or professional qualifications desirable
* Good foundational knowledge of audiovisual systems and solutions
* Proven system design, implementation, and troubleshooting skills
* Good understanding of control and media networking
* Good technical presentation and training skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Swedish



  





**Compensation and Benefits** 




  




* €50.000 – 65.000 in annual salary
* 25 days of holiday
* Annual bonus scheme
* Health insurance, work insurance and pension
* Food allowance
* Fitness membership reimbursement



  





**Recruitment process** 




  





 The deadline for applying is 28/02 and we will ensure you get response as fast as possible. If we see a potential match, you will be invited to participate in an interview process, where you will get the chance to meet our Applications Engineering Manager and our Senior Manager for Customer Experience for Europe.
 



  





 Press Quick Apply, attach your resumé or LinkedIn profile, answer a few questions and we will get back to you.
 



  





 Best,
 



 Biamp

title: Data Analyst
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you passionate about transforming raw data into actionable insights? My name is Wilhelm Windrup, and I lead the Analytics & Strategy Management team here at Telia Finance. Right now, we are seeking a skilled
 **Data** 
**Analyst** 
 to join our team and play a critical role in helping us uncover patterns, trends, and insights that drive business decisions.
   

  

**Is this your new opportunity?**
 As a Data Analyst for Telia Finance, you have a great passion for understanding financing business principles and how analytics play a strategic role in supporting it. To achieve analytical goals, you will need to show strong technical and logical thinking skills in working with structured and semi structured data to improve data quality, provide valuable business insights as well as be good communicator.
   

  

 By applying various statistical and analytical techniques, such as exploratory, inferential, and diagnostic analysis, you will discover new trends and investigate potential causes. Additionally, you will work with databases, programming languages, and data visualization tools to present your findings in a clear and concise manner, ensuring effective communication for decision-making.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Collect, organize, and interpret large sets of data to identify trends, patterns, and underlying causes.
* Work closely with stakeholders to define and test business hypotheses using data-driven insights.
* Apply statistical and analytical techniques, including exploratory, inferential, and diagnostic analysis, to discover new trends and identify potential causes.
* Utilize databases, programming languages, and data visualization tools to present findings in a clear and concise manner for effective decision-making.


**Is this you?**
 To be successful in this role, we believe you have great experience in data exploration, insights generation and ensuring good data governance. You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, explore, analyze, and disseminate large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to details while maintaining the focus into what is the most important. We believe you are driven and proactively pursing new ideas and opportunities to improve business through data-driven approach.
   

  

 Telia Finance is a company regulated by the Financial Supervisory Authority and is subject to specific accounting and regulatory requirements. These roles require at least one year of experience in a credit market company or a similar field.
   

  

**Key competencies:**
* Strong skills of data modelling, transformation and exploration using SQL, BI tools and/or Python.
* Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Qlik Sense (preferred), Power BI, Tableau, Looker or similar.
* Cloud platform experience, such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform
* Background from working in a financial company or credit market company
* Experience with data quality improvement along with data governance initiatives.
* Experience with databases, programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R), and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
* Bachelor or higher degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Data Science, or related discipline.
* Experience from working in agile development teams is a plus.
* Fluent skills in Swedish language


**It’s more than just a job**
 At Telia Finance, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both professionally and personally. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you find this interesting, don’t hesitate to apply for this job. If you have any questions or just want to hear more, feel free to contact our Talent Partner Caroline Åberg at caroline.aberg@teliacompany.com or at Linkedin. Location for this position is Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

 Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. In the last steps of the recruitment process, required controls will be performed.
   

  

**Last application date is:** 
 27th of February
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Welcome to Telia Finance – Home to your next big opportunity!**

title: Identity Security Specialist
description:

 ,

 , and 
 **securing digital identities** 
 ? Do you want to help organizations across Europe strengthen their

 , enforce

 , implementing

  and ensure compliance with industry standards like

 ? If so, we want to hear from you!
 



  





 The

 is a fast-growing cybersecurity consulting firm

 Are you a skilled Systems Engineer with network expertise, passionate about designing, building, and managing infrastructure that supports professional digital systems?
 



  





 Join a modern Nordic IT organization that provides shared IT solutions to thousands of employees across multiple industries, including media, content marketing, and travel. You’ll primarily work from an office in Copenhagen, Stockholm, or Oslo.
 



  





 A well-functioning infrastructure is essential for business operations, and this role offers the unique opportunity to take ownership of critical systems. You'll have the freedom to shape the future of the infrastructure, ensuring it evolves to meet and exceed organizational needs through your expertise and vision.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:**
