title: (Associate) Data Centre Cloud Solution Architect  – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its
 **Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Infrastructure Services Division (IS), Network & Data Centre Unit (NDC)** 
 at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) Data Centre Cloud Solution Architect\*.**
**This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark: (Associate) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


*Panel interviews are anticipated for end of March 2025.*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you passionate about designing and maintaining robust IT infrastructure that bridges the gap between on-premises and cloud solutions? Join us as an (Associate) Data Centre Cloud Solution Architect and become a key player in our cloud journey! We're looking for someone who thrives on overcoming challenges and is ready to support us through our cloud migration journey.
   

  

 In this role, you'll manage our technology roadmap for comprehensive on-premises and cloud infrastructure services, leveraging industry-leading platforms such as AWS and Azure. You'll lead architecture design and oversee project delivery while ensuring cost-effective and efficient use of hybrid cloud resources. Your work will drive innovation, enhance operational excellence, and optimize performance, directly contributing to the achievement of the EIB Group objectives. By balancing the stability of on-prem systems with the flexibility of the cloud, you will help create a secure and efficient infrastructure that supports our long-term digital transformation.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report directly to the Head of the Network and Data Centre Unit. You will work in close collaboration with variety of IT teams in particular with infrastructure and application teams. This dynamic role not only offers the opportunity to impact our digital landscape but also enables you to engage with diverse teams and projects.
   

  

**What Will You Do**
* Maintain and develop on-premises data center and hybrid cloud environment
* Oversee the daily operations of our on-premises and cloud services, ensuring everything runs smoothly, performs optimally, and any issues are quickly resolved
* Lead Cloud migration projects, take charge of end-to-end cloud migration projects, ensuring everything runs smoothly, on time, and within budget, while maintaining top-notch quality
* Regularly connect with stakeholders to gather their needs, make sure they’re accurately translated into technical solutions, and keep everyone in the loop with consistent updates
* Work closely with technical teams to design and implement effective cloud migration strategies
* Keep an eye on cloud service health metrics, and act swiftly to resolve any performance issues or disruptions
* Implement and maintain cloud best practices throughout the organization, ensuring top-tier service resilience, security, and compliance
* Act as the main point of contact for all infrastructure service-related questions, concerns, and issues, ensuring prompt and effective resolutions
* Work closely with vendors and third-party providers to ensure optimal service delivery, support, and enhancements
* Continuously assess, research, and integrate the latest cloud technologies, tools, and services to keep us competitive and ensure operational excellence


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science, information technology or related disciplines
* At least 3 years of experience delivering IT Infrastructure Services with exposure to building, maintaining, and securing cloud technologies, cloud platform operations and cloud governance.
* Experience working with public, hybrid and on-premises private clouds
* Experience in on-premises infrastructure related technologies (compute, storage and backup and recovery)
* Experience of delivering IT cloud infrastructure projects and transformation programs, including rollouts would be considered an advantage
* Experience on troubleshooting cloud infrastructure issues.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**Deadline for applications:** 
 This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open position. The campaign will remain open until the position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

title: Product Manager – Customer Data Platforms
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you an experienced Product Manager with a passion for delivering outstanding business results? Do you have what it takes to lead the development, improvement, and scalability of modern MarTech solutions? If your answer is yes, then we have an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Product Manager to join the
 **Audience Data Platforms** 
 product team and lead the continuous development and management of our
 **Customer Data Platform (CDP) solution** 
 and audience targeting and segmentation capabilities. Your team’s mission is to provide modern and relevant audience creation and targeting capabilities to empower business users and regional marketing colleagues and their activation agencies. Your team’s goals are to build, implement and enable the right tools, automate business processes, decrease time to value, and contribute to driving sales and profitability with media and customer experience optimization in mind.
   

  

 The Audience Data Platforms product team is part of the
 **Marketing Business Components** 
 area, a global technology team driving core MarTech capabilities for the business. We are on a mission to transform and scale our marketing technology stack, dedicated to delivering exceptional value to our customers through innovative marketing solutions.
   

  

 The Marketing Business Components area is part of the
 **Consumer & Sales Unit** 
 , a global cross-functional and customer-centric function within the H&M Business Tech organization, with focus to deliver platforms and systems that enable an outstanding customer experience.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Product Manager, you will lead the development and execution of our CDP solution globally, ensuring seamless integration with the rest of the marketing technology stack and our data mesh/data products. You will be responsible for driving the product vision, strategy, and roadmap, focusing on enhancing the audience targeting and segmentation capabilities to deliver personalized customer experiences, across email, site, app & paid media channels, ensuring that the product meets end-user needs and brings value to the business.
   

  

 You will leverage your subject matter expertise in the business, technical and data areas, closely collaborate with other product managers, business experts, data engineers, data analysts, solution and application experts, as well as the wider business and tech stakeholders.
   

  

 You will contribute to the ideation, analysis, and business case creation to improve and scale our audience management and activation solutions, implement new use cases including the automation of target segment creation, enabling cross-channel activation, omni-experience personalization and cross-channel orchestration. Simply put, you and your team are the key to enabling the right audience at the right time with the right message on the right channel!
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Product Leadership: Lead and manage a cross-functional team to develop, implement, and oversee tech solutions and capabilities on a global scale. Define, align and communicate product vision, strategy, and roadmap with our brand direction and business needs.
* Customer Value Creation: Develop and implement solutions to create exceptional value for our customers and business users, through effective adoption of CDP capabilities and audience driven marketing activation strategies.
* Stakeholder and Partner Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams and external vendors to ensure alignment with business goals and desired outcomes, understand strategic priorities that address critical business challenges.
* Business Case Development: Create hypothesis-driven business cases to outline the expected value from product improvements and secure necessary funding. Manage project risks and issues effectively to ensure successful product delivery. Oversee the timely delivery of new features and products, ensuring resources are allocated appropriately to support business needs.
* Operational Stability and Security: Ensure stable operations by implementing appropriate resource monitoring and incident management processes. Define, implement, and track security and performance metrics to ensure continual optimization and secure performance.
* Value Management: Maintain the financial health and outcomes of technical solutions by optimizing cost efficiency and ensuring sustained financial viability, with a strong focus on commercial outcomes and value realization.


**Qualifications**
 As a Product Manager, you should have the ability to understand and analyze information and determine the best course of action, resulting in business value & end-user satisfaction. You take responsibility, work proactively and continuously measure and improve activities in a fast-paced dynamic and technical and data driven environment. You have great skills in influencing others within the organization and you can effectively communicate your ideas, both within the team and with different stakeholder groups and prioritize what needs to be done based on business requirements and potential impact. You are truly a doer, willing to get hands-on solving any problems needed to help the product move forward.
   

  

 In addition to this, we’re looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Proven experience (5+ years) within the area of marketing and advertising tech solutions related to CDP, CRM, audience management, and channel activation.
* Strong understanding of CDP architecture and functionalities with experience in solution integration, knowledge of data ingestion, data processing, and data activation needs.
* Experience with audience segmentation and targeting capabilities and understanding of marketing analytics and marketing automation tools and platforms.
* Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies and ability to manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables with hands-on experience in agile ways of working and tools (Jira, Confluence, etc.).
* Experience with GCP services, including BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflows, and general knowledge of GCP's data processing and analytics capabilities, security, and compliance features.
* Knowledge of customer data transformation and ETL tools, processes, and best practices to design and implement data pipelines.
* Strong understanding of global data protection and privacy acts such as GDPR, CCPA, etc.
* Experience working with external suppliers and solution providers.
* Strong understanding of user behaviors, customer journey, and end-user feedback.
* Full ownership of the product lifecycle with strong experience in digital product development goal setting and performance measurement frameworks (OKRs and KPIs)
* Strong communication and coordination skills, identify responsibilities, and engage stakeholder community to share best practices.


**Additional Information**
 This position is based in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 .
   

  

**Diversity, Inclusion, and Innovation**
 At H&M Group, we're deeply committed to fostering a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We actively seek out qualified candidates regardless of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.
   

  

 Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At H&M Group, you're not just joining a team – you're joining a value-driven culture and an expansive tech network. Enjoy perks like staff discount cards, flexible work arrangements, wellness benefits, parental support, and more. Here, you're encouraged to be yourself, experiment, and chart your own growth path. As you flourish, so do we, with opportunities to create tangible impacts and shape the future.

title: CloudOps Team Lead
description:
**Assignment description:**
 In this role you will lead CloudOps teams and be responsible for managing and work with change in all aspects of a modern compute environment, including servers, storage, networking and supporting systems in a hybrid cloud IT environment. This also includes, but not limited to, end-user computing, SaaS cloud services, Identity Access Management, Cyber Security, vendor & supplier engagements, procurement and Enterprise Mobility Management. You will under broad direction design and oversee upgrades, new installs, integration tasks, operations duties and troubleshooting of delivered IT systems and services in Dev, Test and Production environments.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
 Key areas of responsibility include (but are not limited to):
   

  

* Deliver and adopt according to the IT Service Delivery Management and IT Operations life cycle
* Change, release and deploy management life cycle is adopted and followed.
* Participate in Incident Management, Problem and Change Management
* Help automate and streamline our operations and processes
* Develop and maintain scripts for automation and monitoring
* Hybrid and cloud infrastructural components such as general compute services, VPC, PKI Management, Networking, Storage services, security systems, communication systems, and backup operations
* Proactively maintain and monitor delivered IT systems and related services
* Ensure all servers and related workloads have required security compliance for patch management, anti-malware, and other threat protections applied and up-to-date
* Work collaboratively with other operations staff, development and service delivery teams to ensure critical L.O.B. systems and services are available 24 x 7 x 365
* Works closely with NOC and SOC as an escalation tier for customer support and for operative production cases
* Support local and remote users across offices, stores and warehouses world-wide
* Managing Public Clouds accounts which are the infrastructure of the company's delivered services, the integrations to 3rd party and SaaS Cloud services
* Identify, categorize and respond to Network, Security & Compute system events and alerts
* Optimize the performance of our systems through team collaboration of hardware and software configurations
* Record, track, follow-up and maintain documentation of systems and the ITSM processes
* Engage with hardware and software vendors and suppliers as needed
* Ensure that the business (customer) expectations are met or exceeded
* Fulfil individual SMART goals and KPI’s through everyday work.
* Perform internal audits and auditable evidence of internal audits for non-technical areas
* Monitor, verify, measure delivered services and solutions from suppliers and partners
* Review survey feedback to improve delivered services, SLA’s, tools and support experience.
* Perform backup and restore operations
* Be part of Line of Business-related projects
* Possible rotate in on-call rotation
* Mentor junior employees within the function
* Adhere to policies, procedures and routines


**Experience and
 **Competence requirements:****
 +3 years’ experience working within an IT Operations team or equivalent in related field(s)
   

  

* Advanced knowledge and experience of building, maintaining, monitoring and supporting hybrid cloud compute and related IT infrastructure services
* O365 Administration (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive etc)
* Advanced knowledge and experience working with different kind of anti-malware and threat protection services
* Advanced knowledge and experience working with user and service catalog services such as Active Directory and Azure AD
* Experience working with Identity Access Management and SSO
* Experience working with Enterprise Mobility and Device Management
* Advanced knowledge and experience working with datacom and networking services
* Advanced knowledge and experiencing working with backup and restore operation services
* Advanced knowledge and experiencing with PowerShell scripting
* Advanced knowledge of and experience supporting PCs and Macs within Microsoft network and Office 365 environment
* Microsoft Azure services
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Experience with modern ITSM processes and techniques.
* Fluent in English, written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
* DNS & PKI Management
* General knowledge and experience working multi-platform environments such as Windows Client and Server OS, Mac OS X/iOS/Android devices and related services such as Autopilot, VPP, DEP, Knox etc
* Fluent in English, written, oral,and interpersonal communication skills.


**Advantages**
 Meriting with knowledge in:
   

  

* Microsoft certifications is a plus.
* Meriting with ITIL certification
* Meriting working with PowerApps and PowerAutomate
* Meriting with knowledge in IT purchasing and project coordination
* Meriting working with public cloud services such as GCP and AWS
* Meriting with Cisco Meraki solutions
* Meriting with ServiceNow and AzureDevOps tooling
* Retail, wholesale, e-commerce or logistics business flows.
* Fashion industry.


**Estimated Workload :** 
 Full time, start asap
   

  

*We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.*
*hat means that we sometimes remove the assignments before deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.*

title: Contract Manager
description:
At Iver, we make the same promise to our colleagues as we do to our customers. The promise is to always be “beside you”, “behind you” and “before you”. We call it “The Iver way”. We are now looking for a Contract Manager to join our growing team,
   

  

 who wants to be part of Iver and who wants to contribute to better IT solutions that make a difference for our customers! Are you our new colleague?
   

  

**About Iver**
 Iver is a leading Nordic full-service provider of cloud-based IT services with cutting-edge expertise in operations, cybersecurity, cloud and innovation. Our services are critical not only for our customers – but for the digitalization of society at large. Headquartered in Stockholm, Iver operates primarily in the Nordic region with an agenda to continue expanding. Iver has a turnover of just over SEK 3 billion and has approximately 1,500 employees working in one of our 25 offices in the Nordic region.
   

  

**Your Role**
 Iver is looking for a Contract Manager to join our growing team. In this key role, you will work closely with the sales and customer teams throughout both the pre- and post-signature phases, ensuring that our contracts are managed effectively and that all processes run smoothly.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the implementation of contract lifecycle management processes across Iver.
* Oversee and guide the contract management activities for assigned accounts, ensuring a seamless execution of contract terms.
* Collaborate with delivery teams to support contract management tasks, including contract changes.
* Work with the legal team to resolve more complex matters.
* Provide training to key account teams on contract management processes and controls.


**Why join us?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. At Iver you get the opportunity to work with the latest technology and be part of an exciting growth journey. At Iver we are inclusive and strive for genuine collaboration where we work towards common goals. Within Iver there are great opportunities for development and we stand behind you when you want to learn more - within your specialist area, leadership or new areas. At Iver you are also part of an ambitious and innovative company, which means that improving, testing, evaluating and daring to change how we do things are important ingredients and we are convinced that this is how we develop.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We believe that you have experience in commercial contract management, or similar roles, and preferably experience with IT outsourcing contracts. You have an ability to handle complex and high-pressure environments and prioritize tasks accordingly and you aim to drive impacts (vs. activities) and have a focused mindset.
   

  

**We Also Believe That You Have**
* Experience in cross-functional roles such as bid support, legal, sales or procurement.
* An education in business administration, law, finance or other relevant areas.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.


**Desired Attributes**
* You are consistent and durable in a fast moving and at times unclear environment with multiple stakeholders.
* Curious, self-motivated, and committed to continuous learning.
* You have a strong ability to establish trustworthy relationships and collaborate with people at all levels within the organization.
* You believe in trust, openness and honesty and are not afraid to take the initiative.
* We believe you are analytical and have a problem-solving attitude with the capability to effectively handle complex tasks and priorities.
* A good understanding of what creates business value and have a supportive mindset.


**Location:**
 Iver has 25 offices around Sweden and Norway. For this position you will be based in our Headquartered in Solna.
   

  

**Join us!**
 Selection is ongoing, the position can be filled before the application deadline. Iver strives for an even gender distribution and values ethnic and cultural diversity. Desired start is as soon as possible or by agreement. Application deadline is 2025-02-28. You are welcome to contact recruiting manager, Selma Becirbegovic (selma.becirbegovic@iver.se) if you have any questions or concerns about the position.
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Dataarkitekt med inriktning plattform
description:
Vi söker dig som är en erfaren Dataplattformsarkitekt och som är grym på att vägleda kring och skapa skalbara, robusta och moderna dataplattformar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder och som både kan leda och vara "hands-on" i att designa, bygga, migrera till och optimera dataplattformar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som kombinerar djup teknisk kompetens med en stark kommunikativ förmåga.
   

  

 Vi vågar påstå att Sogeti är ett av de mest framåtlutade konsultföretagen när det gäller Data, Analytics och AI. Vi driver transformationsprojekt tillsammans med våra strategiska kunder, alltifrån nya ekosystem av tjänster och samarbeten kring avancerad analys av satellitbilder, till införande av moderna dataplattformar hos multinationella företag.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Senior Dataplattformsarkitekt ansvarar du för att designa, implementera och optimera dataplattformar.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter kan vara allt från dataarkitektur och datamodellering till säkerhetsmodeller och datastyrning. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder för att skapa lösningsförslag, leda implementationer och säkerställa kvalitet i leveranserna.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
**Arkitektur dataplattform**
 Val av teknologier och verktyg, definiera scheman och etablera datastyrningspraxis för att säkerställa säker och skalbar arkitektur.
   

  

**Bygga och underhålla ETL-flöden**
 Extrahera, transformera och ladda data från olika källor med fokus på pålitlighet och effektivitet.
   

  

**Datasäkerhet och efterlevnad**
 Implementera säkerhetspolicys och säkerställa att plattformen följer dataskyddsregler som GDPR.
   

  

**Optimering av lagring och åtkomst**
 Utveckla strategier för datalagring och optimering för snabb åtkomst och kostnadseffektivitet.
   

  

**Integrationer och skalbarhet**
 Stöd för flera datakällor, design av framtidssäkra lösningar för datahantering, dataflöden och integrationer.
   

  

 Förmåga att designa skalbara lösningar.
   

  

**Kommunikation & Ledarskap**
 Du är positiv, lösningsorienterad och kan presentera tekniska lösningar på ett engagerande sätt för olika målgrupper. Förmåga att bygga och leda team samt driva leveranser mot uppsatta mål.
   

  

**Tekniker**
 Erfarenhet av tekniker som Teradata, Databricks, Snowflake, Synapse, Ab Initio, Mainframe, Informatica, PowerCenter, PowerShell, SQL, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Fabric, ETL, Power BI och DataOps.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Du Behöver Ha**
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och leda migrering, införande och förvaltning av dataplattformslösningar.
* Förmåga att agera rådgivande och driva diskussioner med olika intressenter, både under inför och i leveranser.
* Passion för data och tekniska lösningar och med en vilja att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt.
* Stark lagspelare med förmåga att samarbeta i tvärfunktionella agila team.
* Självständig, initiativrik och en problemlösare som balanserar detaljer med helhetsperspektiv.
* Tala och skriva flytande svenska och engelska.


 Vill du utvecklas tillsammans med oss och verka i en dynamisk miljö med värde för kunden i fokus, tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan!
   

  

**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**
* Ditt Sogeti - Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!
* Dina förmåner - Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?


 Välkommen in med din ansökan idag, vi behandlar alla ansökningar löpande!
   

  

**Vill du veta mer? Prata med TA Partner Helena Bejerstål, eller Teamchef Johan Alsén så berättar vi mer, du hittar kontaktuppgifterna längre ner eller gå in på Stockholm.**
-

title: Senior Lösningsarkitekt inom Dynamics 365 och Power Platform
description:
**Är du en lösningsarkitekt med djup expertis inom Dynamics 365 och Power Platform? Är du redo att leda design och implementering av avancerade lösningar som möter våra kunders komplexa behov och affärsmål? Då kan Innofactor vara din nästa arbetsplats!**
**Om Rollen**
 I rollen som Lösningsarkitekt på Innofactor har du en central roll där du ansvarar för att utveckla och designa innovativa lösningar med Microsoft Dynamics 365 och Power Platform för att tillgodose våra kunders behov. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Arrangera workshops för att analysera och identifiera kundens behov och möjliga lösningar.
* Samarbeta med våra applikationsspecialister för att implementera den optimala lösningen.
* Navigera mellan företagsbehov och teknik, och se till att lösningarna uppfyller både tekniska och affärsmässiga krav.
* Stödja försäljning genom att arbeta nära vår säljavdelning och säkerställa att kunderna förstår affärsfördelarna med Microsoft-plattformen.


 Din roll är avgörande för vår framgång och du kommer att ha en stor inverkan på både våra kunders och vårt interna applikationsteams arbete.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Med Erfarenhet Av Att**
* Skapa fungerande affärsflöden mellan CRM och affärssystem i en Dynamics 365 miljö.
* Skapa lösningar eller konfigurera flöden och integrationer i Power Apps (Canvas och Model Driven) och Power Automate enligt kundens krav.
* Översätta affärskrav till både funktionella och tekniska lösningar som genererar värde för våra kunder och presentera dessa lösningar på ett begripligt och affärsvänligt sätt.
* Leda tekniska team och driva projekt till framgång.


**Tekniska Kvalifikationer Och Färdigheter**
* Omkring 10 års erfarenhet av arbete med Dynamics 365 och Power Platform.
* Djup kunskap inom moduler som Sales och Customer Service i Dynamics 365; erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 Marketing, Dynamics 365 Project Management, och Dynamics 365 Field Service är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet av Dataverse, Power Virtual Agents, Copilot, och AI Builder.
* Starka färdigheter i integrations- och migrationsprojekt, inklusive arbete med API


 och
 **datamodellering** 
 .
   

  

* Kunskap om Dynamics 365 säkerhetsroller och Azure säkerhet.
* Certifieringar i MB-200, MB-210, MB-230, MB-400, och PL-600 är högt värderade.
* Erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 konfiguration och anpassning.
* Designa, utveckla och felsöka lösningar baserade på Dynamics 365, Azure, och Power Platform.
* Erfarenhet med Power Pages och hantering av Azure Synapse länkar.
* Skapande av komplexa integrationer med Power Automate (Flows).
* Utarbetande av funktionella och tekniska designdokument.
* Kravanalys och design baserat på bästa praktiska lösningar.
* Kunskap i Plugins, Azure, C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, GitHub, och Azure DevOps


**Vår Företagskultur**
 Hos oss är samarbete nyckeln till framgång. Vi är ett starkt team och vårt mål är att tillsammans möta marknadens krav på innovativa lösningar och hjälpa organisationer och individer att transformera den digitala världen. Om du väljer att arbeta i vårt team kommer du att bidra till digitaliseringsresor, lära känna nya personer och bli expert inom ditt område. Du kommer att få en vardag som både känns utmanande och trygg, där balans mellan arbetsliv och privatliv går hand i hand.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

title: Data Governance Lead
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you passionate about data quality and eager to grow in the field of Data Governance? We are looking for a
 **Data Governance Specialist** 
 to help us strengthen our data quality practices at Telia Finance. This is a great opportunity to develop your expertise in data management while working in a collaborative and supportive environment.
   

  

**Is this your next opportunity?**
 In this role, you will focus on improving and maintaining data quality across our organization. With our data governance policies already in place, your primary responsibility will be to support the implementation of data quality processes, help monitor and improve data accuracy, and work closely with business and IT stakeholders to ensure our data meets business needs.
   

  

 You will also contribute to maintaining our business glossary and data catalog, ensuring consistency and clarity in how data is defined and used across Telia Finance. Collaboration will be key, as you will work with different teams to address data quality challenges and drive awareness of data best practices.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Support data quality initiatives by identifying and addressing data issues.
* Assist in monitoring data quality metrics and reporting on key findings.
* Work with data owners and stewards to implement data quality improvements.
* Maintain and update the business glossary and data catalog.
* Assist in data cleansing activities to improve data accuracy and consistency.
* Collaborate with different business areas to ensure a common understanding of data definitions and quality requirements.
* Help facilitate data governance forums and discussions.


**Is this you?**
 To be successful in this role, we believe you have 1–3 years of experience in Data Governance, Data Quality, or a related field, with strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Your experience includes data management processes, standards, and documentation, and you thrive in a collaborative team environment. Experience with data profiling, cleansing, or validation tools is a plus. While experience in the financial sector is an advantage, it is not required.
   

  

**Key knowledge:**
* 1-3 years of experience in Data Governance, Data Quality, or a related field.
* Strong analytical skills with an eye for detail.
* Fluent skills in Swedish, and a great communicator in English
* Experience with data management processes, standards, and data governance principles and frameworks.
* Experience with data profiling, cleansing, or validation tools is a plus.
* Experience in the financial sector is an advantage but not required.


**It’s more than just a job**
 At Telia Finance, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both professionally and personally. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you find this interesting, don’t hesitate to apply for this job. If you have any questions or just want to hear more, feel free to contact our Talent Partner Caroline Åberg at caroline.aberg@teliacompany.com or at Linkedin. Location for this position is Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

**Last application date is:** 
 27th of February
   

  

 Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. In the last steps of the recruitment process, required controls will be performed.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Welcome to Telia Finance – Home to your next big opportunity!**

title: Tech lead Data engineering - Coop Sverige
description:
At Coop we are boldly going where no one has gone before. We look at creating a new standard in the industry as a whole. Together with a fantastic team of highly skilled team members we are on a journey to innovate new ways of interacting with customers and finding ways of helping them with the constant puzzle that is life.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Tech lead to our Data platform . The purpose is to continue building our state-of-the-art data platform up in the cloud to make Coop a truly data driven company. Our motto is “Relevance in every touchpoint”! The understanding of our customers’ needs and behaviors will fuel the innovation process to become more personalized and efficient.
   

  

 Are you a data engineer passionate in finding and creating new solutions in the food experience arena? Then this exciting job-opportunity might be something for you.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We have come a long way in building a great data platform, but we need your help on the way forward. The platform empowers both our data scientists to develop new AI/ML models as well as democratize data to the analysts and business users throughout the organization.
   

  

 The team works with data from both digital and physical touchpoints to find and identify complex patterns and relationships in large data sets.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Be responsible for the platform in terms of technology, platform strategy and architecture and our platform KPI’s
* Develop pipelines and data products that help improve our data platform and provide business value
* Lead "how we do things”
* Keep the technical landscape together


 The position is permanent with a 6-month probationary period starting by agreement. Working from home or at the office? We usually say "team over individual" and expect you to be at the office when needed, plain and simple.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**We Believe That You**
* Have at least 5-10 years of expertise working as Data Engineer, preferably with cloud architecture.
* Have worked with data lake and the concept of save data in raw immutable form
* Have experience working with data pipelines in cloud environments, preferably in Azure and Databricks.
* Are skilled in programming (SQL and Python)
* Have communicative and educational skills to be able to discuss solutions both with technical specialists and people without technical knowledge


**It’s Meritorious If You**
* Have experience from being tech lead or similar role
* Have experience working with DevOps
* Are familiar with Kafka, and the principles and concepts of event-driven architecture and streaming data
* Familiar with Kubernetes and software development best practices
* Experience from other programming languages such as Java or Scala


**Who are you?**
 To succeed in this role, we believe you have a great passion for getting value from massive datasets, without compromising our platforms integrity. We hope that you love to work with state-of-art technologies that make it possible to create completely new data driven solutions, because we surely do!
   

  

 As a person, you enjoy working with different tasks and stakeholders, you are result-oriented and spark when giving room for taking own initiatives and creating solutions
   

  

 As a team, we believe in supporting and challenging each other and growing a positive and learning team culture.
   

  

**About Us**
 The retail grocery sector is a stable and important part of our society. With over 4 million members across the country, Coop is a key player in pushing for a greener and more sustainable future.
   

  

 You will be part of a corporate culture characterized by humility, initiative, and strong values. We collectively take responsibility and have a strong desire to help each other succeed. Our office in Solna offers a modern and great working environment with a fantastic staff restaurant. At Coop, we work for our 4 million members, making us by far Sweden's largest cooperative.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact the Jakob Liljedahl, jakob.liljedahl@coop.se. Contact information can be found further down the page.
   

  

 To fairly match candidates with the demands of the role, we will use tests during the selection process.
   

  

 Please submit your application as soon as possible as we are continuously working on selection and interviews!

title: Data Engineer
description:
**We are looking for Data Engineer**
 Our Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for
 **Data Engineer** 
 to join the team to build, support and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule. If you want to grow and build the foundation on working across multiple customers, look no further.
   

  

 In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day
   

  

**Location: Stockholm**
**Responsibilities**
* Build, optimize, and support data products.
* Manage CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and GCP infrastructure.
* Ensure data products meet security, scalability, and performance standards.
* Collaborate with stakeholders on product vision and new data products.
* Engage with teams on data mesh concepts.
* Drive continuous improvement and reduce technical debt.


**Qualifications**
* 4+ years of experience in data engineering or software engineering with cloud technologies.
* Proficiency in data formats (Avro, Parquet) and query languages (SQL).
* Experience in data-centric programming (Python, Java, Scala).
* Understanding of data modeling, NoSQL, and RDBMS databases.
* Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* Fluent in English.


**Preferred**
* Experience with GCP tools (Dataflow, Dataproc, BigQuery).
* Familiarity with data processing frameworks (Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink).
* Business understanding of the retail industry.


**What We Offer**
* Access to a strong developer community within the company to learn and grow.
* Competitive Salary, Good work-life balance along with health and life insurance.


 AVIGNA holds Service authorization for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP Business All in one.
   

  

 We have received an
 **SAP Recognized Expertise designation for SAP® S/4HANA.** 
 We have consultants serving various customers using SAP and non-SAP products. Our Consulting experience spans across Telecom, Retail, Electrical, Paper, and Social Service Industries.

title: Insurance Software Senior Sales Executive – Nordics Region
description:
**Job Description**
 Leads the planning and execution process of selling, qualifying, and closing of large and/or challenging opportunities. Works closely with the dedicated Insurance Software pre-sales team and acts as a subject matter expert on both the company's and competitor's ISB offerings and services for Nordics.
   

  

**About us :** 
**Insurance Software & BPS**
**Essential Job Functions**
* Leads sales cycle from start to finish for delivery of customized business Insurance Software offerings to large or challenging clients. Meets or exceeds annual new business revenue target for an assigned application offering within a defined sales territory
* Works closely with client relationship and account management team to develop an account development plan for accounts within application efficiency, business process outsourcing (BPO) and mobility solutions, or full life cycle application management
* Works across a medium territory to create a market for defined offerings and services, and to qualify and develop opportunities within those markets
* Provides pre-sales support to client relationship personnel to drive an Insurance Software offerings pipeline of qualified leads across a medium sales territory. Engages with the same to qualify leads into opportunities. Executes the standard sale process through to closure
* Addresses complex client business problems through our offerings. Develops a compelling value proposition for our solution based on a solid business case and its overall impact on the client's agenda as well as company goals
* Develops strategic business relationships with key decision makers including customer senior management. Builds relationships while positioning company for future prospects
* Interfaces with internal department senior management and external partners to develop and implement strategies, plans and business models. Ensures sales solutions meet the needs of customer and company goals
* May provide leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel and sales support team


**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Bachelor's degree in business administration or related field preferred
* Ten or more years of business development or sales experience
* Experience working with the technology industry
* Experience working with technology products, services, competencies, solutions, and offerings
* Experience working with a standard sales methodology and supporting tools
* Experience in Insurance Software deals
* Experience working with finance and accounting


**Other Qualifications**
* Strong interpersonal and presentation skills for interacting with team members and prospective clients up to the Board level
* Strong selling and negotiation skills
* Strong communication skills to listen to the client and articulate back for solutioning
* Leadership skills to guide and mentor the work of less experienced personnel
* Ability to lead and work in a team environment
* Ability to create and maintain formal and informal networks
* Willingness to travel


 Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here
 *.*

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Location:** 
 EMEA - Remote
   

  

 Canonical is the global open source solutions provider and the publisher of Ubuntu. Since 2004, Canonical has led the way in providing free open source software solutions, putting innovation in the hands of everyone. Our portfolio of solutions is designed to support enterprises to innovate from the data centre to the edge, leading the way in cloud infrastructure, advanced robotics, and enabling AI, blockchain, autonomous cars, and smart things. We are proud to support the critical infrastructure and operations for thousands of businesses and millions of Ubuntu users worldwide including AT&T, Bloomberg, Netflix, Paypal, Sky, Slack, Spotify and Tmobile.
   

  

 At Canonical, the product marketing team is not just marketing products—we're building the best Go-To-Market (GTM) engine in the open-source world. Our mission is to take the power of open-source innovation and bring it to businesses everywhere, from the data center to the edge. We're growing fast and looking for a Product Marketing Manager (PMM) to join our team—someone who loves technology, thrives in fast-paced environments, and wants to make a global impact.
   

  

 This is a hands-on, multi-disciplinary, and dynamic position, requiring close collaboration with the Product, engineering, content, Sales, and other Marketing teams. The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing, and the use of technology in marketing. They prefer to work in an environment that emphasises ownership of GTM campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity, and a drive to always improve oneself / the team / the organisation. They love solving problems, getting hands-on, experimenting, measuring, and using automation to make daily life easier.
   

  

**Why You'll Love This Role**
 You'll own the GTM strategy for key products, shaping messaging and positioning that speaks to developers and enterprise buyers alike.
   

  

 You'll collaborate cross-functionally with product management, sales, regional marketing, content, and partner marketing teams to bring campaigns to life.
   

  

 You'll get creative, crafting compelling advertising, launch plans, and campaigns that make our products stand out in a competitive landscape.
   

  

 You'll measure impact, using data to refine messaging, optimize marketing funnels, and drive customer engagement.
   

  

 You'll be part of a truly global team, working with colleagues in over 85 countries in a fully remote, high-performance environment.
   

  

**As a product marketing manager, you will:**
* Develop and execute go-to-market (GTM) strategies for a range of products.
* Lead messaging and positioning efforts ensuring our products stand out in a competitive market.
* Lead content planning with product managers —from website copy to whitepapers, blogs, and sales enablement materials.
* Collaborate on marketing campaigns, partnering with regional marketing teams to execute integrated campaigns that drive pipeline growth.
* Launch new products and features, leading cross-functional teams to drive awareness and adoption.
* Run competitive analysis, staying ahead of market trends and evolving our positioning accordingly.
* Support the customer success team on driving customer engagement and growth, working on strategies to upsell and cross-sell across our customer base.
* Plan and execute global events, live webinars, and community meetups that align with our GTM priorities.


**The successful PMM will have :**
* Experience in product marketing for enterprise software, cloud, DevOps, or open-source solutions.
* A passion for technology and open source—you get excited about innovation, software, and community-driven development.
* Strong storytelling skills—you know how to craft messaging that resonates with both technical and business audiences.
* Experience with demand generation, understanding how to translate GTM strategies into pipeline growth.
* Comfort working cross-functionally with product, sales, partners, and marketing teams.
* Data-driven mindset, using insights to refine strategies and improve performance.
* Growth mindset—someone who thrives on experimentation, learning, and continuous improvement.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.


**What Canonical Offers:**
* Learning and Development
* Annual Compensation Review
* Recognition Rewards
* Annual Leave
* Priority Pass for travel
* Flexible working option


 Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Software Engineering Manager - Container and Virtualisation Infrastructure
description:
Our mission is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We're hiring engineering managers with experience in high-quality microservice architectures and high-performance team leadership who also have deep familiarity with Linux kernel, virtualisation, storage and networking.
   

  

 LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.
   

  

 As an engineering manager at Canonical you must have a solid technical background, but your responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do important work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The successful candidate will have experience leading successful, collaborative engineering teams, and demonstrate the ability to solve challenging distributed systems problems and deep knowledge of Linux.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Lead a team of remote engineers
* Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, senior management, and external stakeholders
* Advocate and advance modern software development practices
* Participate in the engineering process through code and architectural review
* Engage with teams at Canonical, the open source community and partners
* Work from home with global travel for 4 to 6 weeks per year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You understand modern Linux cloud computing technologies, including networking, storage, containers and K8s
* You love developing and growing people and have a strong track record of doing it
* You are focused on success and the delivery of timely, high quality software
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have strong written and verbal technical communication skills
* You have experience programming in C and/or Go.


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Observability Engineering Manager
description:
Engineering managers at Canonical are always coders who are able to review and lead both architecture and code. They should also be astute judges of character, and comfortable setting expectations and holding colleagues accountable to them.
   

  

 The team has grown and we are now looking for a dedicated, technical, engineering manager. As part of the observability group, you will lead the development of the distributed tracing or service mesh elements.
   

  

 We are building an observability stack that is easy to deploy and operate on Kubernetes. This is part of a broader initiative to deliver the world's best suite of open source tools, where we provide deep integration and automation for best-of-breed open source offerings that cover metrics, logging, telemetry, alerting, tracing and profiling. Our goal is to make observability tools integral and pervasive across software practices .
   

  

 Our implementation of Kubernetes operators is opinionated, resilient, and scalable, providing deep insights out of the box. The user experience is polished and seamless for the end-users, and its administrators will enjoy smooth, lightweight Day 1 and Day 2 operations. We are excited to be improving the state of the art for open-source observability.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Kubernetes, and Observability. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu.
   

  

 As an Engineering Manager at Canonical, you must be technically strong, but your main responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You will develop and review code as a leader, but know that the best way to improve the product is to ensure that the whole team is focused, productive and unblocked. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do meaningful work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. You will also be expected to be a positive influence on culture, facilitate technical delivery, and regularly reflect with your team on strategy and execution. You will collaborate closely with other Engineering Managers, product managers, and architects, producing an engineering roadmap with ambitious and achievable goals.
   

  

 We expect Engineering Managers to be fluent in the programming language, architecture, and components that their team uses. Code reviews and architectural leadership are part of the job. The commitment to healthy engineering practices, documentation, quality and performance optimisation is as important, as is the requirement for fair and clear management, and the obligation to ensure a high-performing team.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This role can be home based in the* 
*EMEA or Americas regions.*
 What your day will look like
   

  

* Manage a distributed team of engineers and its observability portfolio
* Organize and lead the team's processes in order to help it achieve its objectives
* Conduct one-on-one meetings with team members
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Interact with a vibrant community
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Attend conferences to represent Canonical and its Observability Stack


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* A proven track record of professional experience of software delivery
* Professional software development experience, preferably with a track record in open source
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience as an engineering manager, with a track record of building great, high performance teams
* Professional Python development experience
* A working knowledge of Go
* Open source contribution experience
* Interest and experience with container technologies
* A proven understanding of the importance of observability and monitoring for keeping software running smoothly
* Experience designing and implementing observability solutions


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of open source. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Named Enterprise Account Executive (Finland focus)
description:
SLSQ426R82
   

  

 Want to help solve the world's toughest problems with data and AI? This is what we do every day at Databricks.
   

  

 Databricks operates at the leading edge of the Data and AI space. Our customers turn to us to lead the accelerated innovation their businesses need to gain first-mover advantage in today's ultra-competitive landscape.
   

  

 We are looking for a creative, delivery-oriented Named Enterprise Account Executive to join the team in the Nordic Region to maximise the phenomenal market opportunity that exists for Databricks. As an Account Executive, you know how to sell innovation and value to existing customers, identify new use cases and grow consumption and can guide deals forward to compress decision cycles. You love understanding a product in depth and are passionate about communicating its value to customers and partners. You will be offered huge potential for career progression with the pace of the team's growth.
   

  

 This position is based in Sweden and you will report to the Sales Director for Enterprise Sales, Finland.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
* Assess your territory and develop a successful execution strategy
* Drive quarter-on-quarter consumption growth in existing accounts
* Exceed activity and quarterly revenue targets
* Track all customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting in Salesforce
* Identify new use case opportunities and showcase value to existing customers
* Promote the value of the Databricks' Data Intelligence Platform
* Orchestrate and utilise our field engineering teams to ensure valuable outcomes for clients
* Build and demonstrate value with all engagements to guide successful negotiations to close point


**What We Look For**
* Extensive understanding of the data platform, open source and cloud ecosystems
* Highly skilled in prospecting research and ability to map out key stakeholders
* Demonstrated success in Value Selling and developing a mutual action plan
* Ability to influence decision-making and strategy with customer leadership teams
* Ability to establish credibility with the C-suite
* Adept in selling to technical buyers
* Experience growing consumption and closing commit deals in a direct sales role
* Mastery of MEDDPICC
* Bachelor's Degree or relevant work experience
* Fluency in English is required, fluency in Swedish and/or Finnish is preferred


**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Senior Embedded Platform Engineer – 11577
description:
We are looking for a Senior Embedded Platform Engineer to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**What you will work on:** 



* Configure and maintain a Yocto-based Linux platform (including BSP, drivers, and system services) for an ARM-based connected industrial system.
* Integrate an open-source management platform with secure APIs, ensuring secure communication (TLS, certificate management) between system nodes.
* Maintain cloud connectivity, IoT security, and OTA update mechanisms.
* Design, manage, and streamline the CI/CD pipeline to support deployment and application integration.
* Collaborate in the integration of industrial communication protocols (CAN, MODBUS, API integration).
* Work with embedded Linux systems, focusing on security hardening and automated build systems.



  





**What you bring:** 



* Experience with Embedded Linux (Yocto, BSP, driver integration, security hardening).
* Strong expertise in ARM-based platforms and networking.
* Knowledge of Cloud & IoT technologies, including MQTT, TLS, and secure OTA updates.
* Familiarity with industrial communication protocols (CAN, MODBUS, API integration).
* Experience with CI/CD, automated build systems, and developer enablement.

title: Territory Manager, Endoscopy Solutions (ESL) Sweden
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Are you looking to make a difference in your career and become part of an innovative, global medical device company? Ambu is comprised of team members who are driven by its mission to save lives and improve patient care through innovative medical devices and industry changing single use scopes. If you are excited by the idea of contributing in a fast-paced, fast-growing, international organization where your work can make a real difference, we want you to join our team!
   

  

 Ambu Sweden is looking for a
 ***Territory Manager, Endoscopy Solutions (ESL)***
 , who will sell Ambu Endoscopy products in the assigned regional territory.  Reporting directly to the Nordic Sales Director, ESL, the Territory Manager, ESL will be become part of Sales team in Sweden and an integral part of the Nordic Sales team. This ideal location of this position is within Northern Sweden, in Stockholm proper and/or north of Stockholm.
   

  

 As Territory Manager, ESL, you will be responsible for driving revenue and market share growth through converting new and/or competitive accounts while expanding utilization in current accounts. This position is ideal for a resilient individual with a proven entrepreneurial skillset to drive growth.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Include**
* Developing relationships with key clinical and non-clinical decision-makers
* Identifying and following-up on new sales opportunities
* Developing sales in your region according to budget
* Providing product training, sometimes to large audiences, and support to customers
* Participating in relevant national exhibitions
* Using CRM tools and processes, ensuring improved reporting and accountability
* Ensuring effective communication of agreed value propositions through proposals and presentations
* Ensuring seamless collaboration with key internal stakeholders - hereunder product marketing, market access, customer service, etc.
* As territory manager you ensure a professional tender management process for the Visualization business including market intelligence and post-tender follow-up.


**Your Background**
* As a person, you display optimism, a growth mindset, curiosity, and have a knack for building relationships
* Prior sales management and/or key account management experience
* Sales experience from a Medical Device/IVD company in the Nordic region, primarily with surgical products
* Experienced with regional tender processes
* Experience with relation-driven sales
* Documented experience with sales planning, sales optimization, pipeline management and performance analytics
* Preferably some clinical experience
* Strong understanding of the healthcare sector


*Please note:* 
 While you will be working from your home office, you should expect to be out with customers 4 out of 5 days a week.
   

  

**Deadline**
 Don’t wait to apply! The Talent Attraction team will engage with candidates on an ongoing basis; hence we encourage you to not hesitate and apply!
   

  

**Ambu – a visionary and international workplace where your efforts matter**
 Ambu is a company that expands rapidly and has ambitious growth targets. We meet these targets through interdisciplinary teamwork between motivated and highly skilled employees. Your contributions and efforts are crucial to our success and by joining us you will get the opportunity to work in an international head office with an informal working environment.
   

  

 We offer great opportunities for personal development. Furthermore, we offer a wide range of professional, social and financial employee benefits in addition to exciting job challenges and continuous professional and personal development.

title: Vehicle Diagnostic Engineer
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* You will support Electrical hardware and software build, test, and maintenance activities of prototype vehicles and boxcars.
* You will have the ability to analyze Electrical hardware and software faults and work with the SW Integration engineers and SW developers to help identify solutions.
* You will support Software Download activities and updates other markets.
* You will support verification/validation activities including in-market testing, rig testing.
* You must be able to manage large workloads in a high-pressure environment and prioritise accordingly.
* You are methodical, pay attention to detail and a flexible and enthusiastic person who can work under your own initiative.


**Requirements**


* Experience of using Automotive vehicle diagnostic tools. DSA, VIDA etc.
* Experience using laptop based diagnostic software, measurement, and calibration tools (CANalyzer or equivalent).
* Experience in identification and diagnosis of vehicle issues and working with cross functional teams to implement required resolutions.
* Experience with vehicle network architectures CAN, LIN, FlexRay and Ethernet.
* Experience in reading and interpreting circuit diagrams and working on vehicle harnesses.
* Knowledge of software/feature fault diagnostics methods, tools and practices.


**Technical Skills**


* Knowledge and working experience on EV’s and Hybrid vehicle architectures.
* Experience in working with prototype vehicles and rigs.
* Experience of building and commissioning of test properties such as rigs and boxcars.
* Experience of using specialised diagnostic and test tools (e.g. CANoe, CANape, INCA).
* Experience in aspects of vehicle repair outside of electrical systems.
* Experience using diagnostic tools such as DSA.
* Experience of automotive pre-production build environments: manufacturing processes, car configuration, feature coding, VCATS implementation.
* Good computer skills (Office programs).
* Good written and verbal communication, including appropriate escalation and reporting where required.
