title: Network Application Engineer - Energy Sector
description:
*Are you a Network, Software or Systems Engineer? Do you like to work with customers and help solving their challenges? Would you like to develop new applications for the market and immerse yourself in the latest technology? Join us as a Network Application Engineer!*

  

Westermo is seeking a skilled Network Application Specialist to join our team and support our customers in the energy sector. As a Network Application Engineer, you will play a crucial role in understanding and addressing the data communication and cyber security needs of our clients.

**Are you our new Network Application Engineer?**


In this role, you will get a great mix of network technology and customer relations! Perhaps you meet a potential client at an industry fair. Or, a colleague in one of our global sales teams needs your assistance. Either way, your task is to listen to and understand the customers’ needs, and work with them and other colleagues at Westermo to propose the solution.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Understand and analyze customer requirements in the energy sector related to data communication and cyber security.
* Design and set up robust network solutions tailored to customer needs.
* Act as a pre-sales engineer, working closely with customers worldwide to provide technical expertise and support.
* Collaborate with various teams to ensure seamless integration and implementation of network solutions.
* Travel to customer sites as needed to provide on-site support and consultation.

 **So, who are we looking for?**


We are looking for someone who has a background working with Data Communication, i.e. Networks. You are technically savvy, but what really motivates you is solving a customer’s challenge. You enjoy communication with others, and are comfortable giving presentations for smaller groups. Taking ownership and responsibility for your work are important aspects in this role. You think that Quality is key and understand how important Teamwork is.

**Requirements**:

* Academic Degree in Engineering.
* Extensive knowledge of network technology and experience in designing and setting up networks.
* Strong understanding of data communication and cyber security principles.
* Fluent in English; and at least intermediate proficiency in Swedish.
* Willingness to travel as part of the job. (Approx. 6-10times per year)

**Meritorious:**

* Software Background
* Driving license
* Other languages (than Swedish and English)
* Knowledge in Visio and/or GNS3

**In return, we offer:** You will be working at the forefront of technology in a friendly, open culture where we you get the opportunity to learn from skilled colleagues every day. A mature and caring leadership in a flat organization. Through our collective agreement you will be covered in terms of insurance, pension and other benefits. We like to have fun together and we regularly enjoy sports and other social activities as a team. We believe that magic happens when people meet. We are a learning organization and we truly love to try new things, think outside the box and be innovative together!

**Basic information:**

* Location: Kopparlunden, Västerås
* Job type: Full time
* Employment contract: Permanent


Don’t miss out on this opportunity – apply today. For further information please contact:


Henrik Envall: henrik.envall@westermo.com or Elin Sandell, Recruiter at elin.sandell@westermo.com

**About Westermo:**

*Welcome to a rapidly growing international company, thriving at the forefront of cutting edge technology. Westermo develops and manufactures advanced devices for industrial data communication, used in mission-critical installations and harsh industrial environments. The very robust and secure communication networks built with our products provide a high value for our customers.*

*We are focused on leveraging growth opportunities in our market and are devoted to delivering the world's best industrial networks. This is achieved through a very dynamic work environment where teamwork and loyalty are valued. Strong and honest relationships with colleagues, customers, and suppliers are important to us. We have an open culture where we share knowledge, learn from one another and explore new ideas, allowing us to constantly improve.*

*Westermo is a leading provider of Industrial Data Communications equipment to the global market. Sales are conducted through our own offices in key markets in Europe, North America, Australia and Asia, as well as through distributors and OEM customers worldwide. Development and manufacturing take place in Sweden, Ireland, Germany and Switzerland. Westermo was founded in 1975 and today has over 480 employees with a turnover of around 1000 MSEK. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ependion, listed on the Nasdaq OMX Nordic stock exchange.*
company_addresses: Westermo Network Technologies, Metallverksgatan 6, SE-721 30 Västerås, Sweden
company_description: We are a leading supplier of robust, reliable and easy-to-use Industrial Data Communications equipment to the global market, devoted to delivering the world's best industrial networks.

title: Verification Engineer
description:
Plats: Tranemo

**Välkommen till AP&T!**
------------------------


Här blir du en viktig del i arbetet med att skapa innovativa lösningar för våra kunder tillsammans med kompetenta, nyfikna och engagerade kollegor.

  

Hos AP&T kan du växa både som individ och tillsammans. Vi är tillräckligt stora för att kunna erbjuda många olika spännande utvecklingsmöjligheter, antingen du vill bli bättre på ett specifikt område som du redan brinner för eller prova något helt nytt. Men vi är också tillräckligt små och informella för att alla ska känna sig delaktiga och engagerade i vad vi skapar tillsammans. Vi är både ett litet storföretag och ett stort småföretag.


Att arbeta som **Verification Engineer** innebär att utföra uppgifter inom processen för pressverifiering. Huvudfokus ligger på att kostnadseffektivt verifiera maskiner som skapar mervärde för både externa och interna kunder. Detta arbete innebär att säkerställa att maskinerna uppfyller krav från både myndigheter och kunder, där aspekter som säkerhet för människor och maskiner, miljöpåverkan, funktion, teknik, ekonomi och tid är avgörande.


Som Verification Engineer är det viktigt att följa gällande direktiv och standarder som rör de produkter och moduler som testas. Arbetet innebär också att säkerställa att både externa och interna kunders krav och standarder efterlevs. Alla arbetsuppgifter ska utföras enligt avdelningens instruktioner och rutiner, samtidigt som företagets regler och policyer följs.


Ett centralt ansvar i rollen är att upprätthålla hög kvalitet i det arbete som utförs. Dessutom förväntas en Verification Engineer att hålla sig till uppsatta tidsplaner och rapportera eventuella avvikelser så snart som möjligt.


För att bidra till en ständigt förbättrad arbetsprocess är det viktigt att aktivt delta i förbättringsarbetet för avdelningens processer och rutiner. Rollen kräver också en vilja att kontinuerligt lära sig och hålla sig uppdaterad om nya funktioner och system som ska verifieras.

#### **Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**

* Uppstart och verifiering av Hydraulpressar i vår fabrik.
* Genomföra pressverifiering i kund-/utvecklingsprojekt.
* Utföra erforderliga tester för att säkerställa att våra produkter uppfyller krav från myndigheter och kunder avseende maskinsäkerhet.
* Säkerställa att utlovad prestanda till kund uppfylls.
* Skapa och spara nödvändig data som myndigheter och kunder efterfrågar.
* Förbättra och utveckla funktioner tillsammans med konstruktörer och mjukvaruingenjörer.
* Felsökning och problemlösning under verifieringsfasen.
* Utveckla och förbättra testverifieringsprotokoll och testmetoder.
* Driftsättning av levererad utrustning på plats hos kund.
* Support och utbildning av kunder och AP&T-personal.

#### **Din profil**


Vi ser gärna att du som söker tjänsten har flerårig erfarenhet av liknande tjänst. Som person är du en nyfiken lagspelare och lösningsorienterad, samt har förmågan att se både till detaljerna och helheten. Du gillar tydliga deadlines och jobbar gärna med flera projekt parallellt. Du har även ett stort tekniskt intresse.

#### **Krav**

* Ingenjörsutbildning med inriktning mot el, elektronik och hydraulik.
* Minst tre (3) års erfarenhet av liknande roll eller arbetsuppgifter.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Körkort för bil.

#### **Meriterande**

* Kunskaper inom något av områdena el/programmering/hydraulik.

#### **Uppgifter om anställningen**

* Lön - Månadslön. Enligt överenskommelse.
* Anställningsvillkor - Heltid 100%, dagtid.
* Tillträdesdag - Enligt överenskommelse.

#### **Vi erbjuder**


Vi erbjuder ett arbete med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett internationellt företag. Du kommer att ha en individuell utvecklingsplan och kontinuerliga avstämningar med din närmaste chef. Utöver ovanstående erbjuds ett utmanande och varierande arbete med stor möjlighet att utveckla våra arbetssätt och metoder.  

  

Som anställd på **AP&T** erbjuder vi förutom karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter andra förmåner som exempelvis friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, flexibel arbetstid och kollektivavtal.


Läs mer om AP&T på www.aptgroup.com/company/about-apt


Intervjuer sker löpande. Tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
  

Vi använder logik- och personlighetstester i rekryteringsprocessen.


Vid frågor om tjänsten och rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta **Peter Granqvist** på telefonnummer **010-4713828** eller mejla **peter.granqvist@aptgroup.com.**

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**


Location: Tranemo

**Welcome to AP&T!**
--------------------


Here you will be an important part of creating innovative solutions for our customers together with competent, curious and committed colleagues.


At AP&T you can grow both as an individual and together. We are big enough to offer many different exciting development opportunities, whether you want to improve in a specific area that you are already passionate about or try something completely new. But we're also small and informal enough that everyone feels involved and engaged in what we create together. We are both a small big company and a big small company.

  

Working as a **Verification Engineer** means performing tasks within the press verification process. The main focus is on cost-effectively verifying machines that create added value for both external and internal customers. This work involves ensuring that the machines meet the requirements of both authorities and customers, where aspects such as safety for people and machines, environmental impact, function, technology, economy and time are crucial.


As a Verification Engineer, it is important to follow the applicable directives and standards relating to the products and modules being tested. The work also involves ensuring compliance with both external and internal customer requirements and standards. All tasks must be carried out according to the department's instructions and procedures, while complying with company rules and policies.


A key responsibility of the role is to maintain high quality in the work performed. In addition, a Verification Engineer is expected to adhere to set schedules and report any deviations as soon as possible.


To contribute to a continuously improving work process, it is important to actively participate in the improvement of the department's processes and procedures. The role also requires a willingness to continuously learn and keep up to date on new features and systems to be verified.

#### **Your main tasks**

* Start-up and verification of hydraulic presses in our factory.
* Accomplish press verification in customer/development projects.
* Make required tests to ensure that our products comply with requirements from authorities and customers considering machine safety.
* Ensure that promised performance to customers are fulfilled.
* Create and save required data that authorities and customers requests.
* Improve and develop functions together with design engineers and software engineers.
* Troubleshooting and problem solving during verification phase.
* Develop and improve test verification protocol and testing methods.
* Commissioning of delivered equipment at customer site.
* Support and education of AP&T-personnel.

#### **Your profile**


We would like you to have several years of experience in a similar position. As a person, you are a curious team player and solution-oriented, and have the ability to see both the details and the big picture. You like clear deadlines and are happy to work on several projects in parallel. You also have a strong technical interest.

#### **Requirements**

* Engineering degree with specialization in electrical, electronics and hydraulics.
* At least three (3) years of experience in a similar role or work tasks.
* Good knowledge of Swedish and English.
* Driving license for car.

#### **Preferred**

* Knowledge in one of the areas of electrical/programming/hydraulics.

#### **Details of the employment**

* Salary - Monthly salary. According to agreement.
* Employment conditions - Full-time 100%, daytime.
* Starting date - According to agreement.

#### **We offer**


We offer a job with good development opportunities in an international company. You will have an individual development plan and continuous reviews with your immediate manager. In addition to the above, we offer challenging and varied work with great opportunities to develop our working methods and methods.  

  

As an employee at **AP&T**, we offer not only career and development opportunities, but also other benefits such as wellness allowance, occupational pension, flexible working hours and collective agreements.


Read more about AP&T at www.aptgroup.com/company/about-apt


Interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis. The position may be filled before the closing date. We use logic and personality tests in the recruitment process.


For questions about the position and the recruitment process, please contact **Peter Granqvist** on telephone number **010-4713828**or email **peter.granqvist@aptgroup.com**.

**Welcome with your application!**

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Sr. Frontend Engineer (React & NextJS) for Portfolio Brands
description:
**Company Description**
 Join our innovative team to work with our Portfolio Brands in Stockholm where we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional online shopping experiences as we are looking for
 **Senior Frontend Engineer** 
 .
   

  

 Portfolio Brands Engineering is part of Business Tech within H&M group and support technical development for our
 **Portfolio Brands -** 
**COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, and ARKET.** 
 We are on a journey to implement latest innovative solutions, offering seamless navigation, personalized recommendations, and an immersive browsing experience. We leverage advanced technologies to ensure a fast, secure, and user-friendly interface, allowing customers to explore our curated collections effortlessly. Our commitment to excellence drives us to continuously enhance our digital storefront and ensuring that our customers experience an exceptional online shopping journey.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Develop and maintain high-quality responsive web applications.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including designers, backend developers, and product managers to deliver seamless user experiences.
* Participate in code reviews, mentor junior developers, and contribute to a culture of continuous improvement.
* Drive initiatives with CoP(Community of Practises), sharing knowledge and collective growth.
* Contribute to architechtural decisions and technical roadmap planning.
* Work closely with stakeholders from all parts of the organization to develop the technical aspects of prioritized business projects.
* Ensure engineering excellence through customer centricity, rigorous testing, innovative solutions, and adherence to best practices in software development.
* Work-in and follow Agile methodologies.
* Learn, grow, be challenged, and have fun!


**Qualifications**
* At least 5+ years experience working as a software engineer with strong frontend focus.
* Extensive experience in frontend development, particularly with React, Nextjs and Typescript.
* Strong understanding of modern frontend architectures and best practices.
* Proficiency in frontend build tools and package managers such as Webpack, Babel, or npm.
* Interest and experience in mentoring a team of developers.
* Collaborate with backend, data, analytics and designer teams to create seamless user experiences.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail.
* Working in CMS tool is desired.
* Knowledge in tailwind is an advantage.
* Good to have knowledge in Nodejs.
* Staying updated on emerging technology trends like API strategy, event-driven architecture, and cloud computing to contribute effectively to evolving technology strategies.
* Fluency in English as it is the working language at H&M Group.


**Additional Information**
 For this position, we are primarily looking for candidates located in and around the Stockholm region to work in our
 **office in Liljeholmen.** 
 We work from our office 3 days a week.
   

  

* Relocation is not offered for this role\*\*


 Benefits at H&M Group:
   

  

* 6 weeks time off yearly and good work-life balance
* Special discount for our employees in all H&M stores and online worldwide.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to Swedish market
* Lots of additional perks and discounts from Benify for health and wellbeing
* Ample of focus groups to celebrate diversity and inclusiveness as well as our international culture and events.


**Are you the person we are looking for?** 
 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.

title: Java Software Engineer
company_industry: Information Services and Data Infrastructure and Analytics
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet** 




 Dun & Bradstreet combines global data and local expertise to help clients make smarter decisions. With 6,000+ people in 31 countries, we are a team of diverse thinkers and problem solvers who all share a common curiosity: to find new ways to turn data into value. If you share this curiosity and want to be part of a future-ready company, come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers.
 



  





 Are you passionate about backend development and ready to take on a wide-ranging, impactful role? Our Development Unit 4 in Sweden, is looking for a driven developer to join our agile team.
 



  





 The team manages a diverse set of responsibilities, including Solinfra, BRG, AAA Live-logo, RGS-services, D&B Credit Reports, and more. As an active team member, you’ll contribute to coding, testing, and documenting new features while maintaining existing services in a production environment. Collaboration is key—working closely with Product Managers, stakeholders, and other teams, you’ll help move tasks forward in alignment with our Tech Lead and Agile Product Owner’s guidance.
 



  





 If you thrive in an agile, collaborative environment and are eager to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Coding, including creating unit and integration tests, and documentation for code and services produced.
* Be an active participant in the team’s agile work process; estimate work tasks, sprint planning, participate in sprint demos etc.
* Align and coordinate delivery with Product Managers, product team colleagues and Tech Lead to ensure consistency in solutions.
* Collaborate with other teams and stakeholders outside of the product team when needed to solve an assigned task.
* Participate in handling of incidents related to team’s services in the production environment.



  





**Your profile:** 



* Experienced backend developer with experience from working in microservices environment with continuous deployment. Extensive experience from working with some of our technical tools including Java, Spring, REST APIs, SOAP, Apache Camel, Kubernetes, Spring Boot. Preferably also with some experience from XSLT, MongoDB, Postgres and Kafka.
* An academic degree in one of the following areas Engineering/Computer science/Information systems.
* Experience from working with Nordic credit data solutions.
* Problem-solver with a positive attitude and experience of managing and working with stakeholders.
* Team player, responsible, structured.
* Good communication (English) and social skills.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




  





 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
 



  





 · Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
 



 · A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
 



 · Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
 



 · Annual wellness/sport benefit
 



 · Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
 



 · Access to free services providing support and counselling
 



 · Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
company_industry: Blockchain Services, Embedded Software Products, and Information Services
description:
**Senior Full-Stack Engineer - Wingbits**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden - Hybrid (must live in Stockholm)
   

  

**Compensation:** 
 Salary + Equity. We ensure fair and equitable compensation based on experience and contribution.
   

  

**Tech stack:** 
 AWS, TypeScript, Next.js, Serverless, Python, Go, Rust
   

  

**Why you should work at Wingbits**
 We hire amazing and very skilled people, who build fun, complex, and challenging tech that requires thoughtful problem solving. We treat everyone like adults, we know you are skilled and dedicated to your work, so we give you the trust and freedom to execute in your role.
   

  

**About Wingbits**
 Wingbits is a pioneering startup at the intersection of blockchain technology and flight tracking. Our mission is to revolutionize flight tracking networks worldwide, enhancing safety, efficiency, and transparency in the aviation industry. This is a unique opportunity to join us at a pivotal moment and shape the future of aviation technology.
   

  

 Since starting in fall 2023, we have raised $9.3 million dollars, been nominated for startup of the year, and grown the company immensely. We currently have 8 people in our Stockholm office, and 7 people working remote in various roles.
   

  

 Read more about Wingbits on our website: https://wingbits.com/about
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for someone who wants more than just a job—someone excited about the challenge of building a complex tech company from the ground up while being part of a supportive, tight-knit team. This role is both fun and challenging, offering the opportunity to work on a technically complex product that will push you to learn, grow, and work across multiple technologies. You'll spend most of your time building alongside our engineering team, but beyond just coding, you'll have a real impact on our technical strategy and how the company evolves over time. While the work will be demanding, you'll be surrounded by smart, driven teammates who collaborate, share knowledge, and support each other, making this an exciting opportunity to shape both your career and the future of Wingbits.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build & Scale – Contribute to the development and scaling of our flight tracking network, ensuring our technology is robust, efficient, and industry-leading.
* Problem Solving - We work as a team to tackle challenges, and we encourage proactive problem-solving with plenty of support when needed.
* Collaborative Growth – Be part of a supportive, high-performing team, learning from senior engineers while sharing your own insights to elevate our engineering culture.
* Cross-Team Collaboration – Work closely with product, design, and business teams to ensure engineering efforts are aligned with company goals.
* Performance & Reliability – Help ensure our platform remains fast, scalable, and reliable, keeping quality and customer experience at the forefront.


**Ideal Candidate**
* Really enjoys software development and actively engages in coding or technology projects outside of work.
* Has around 5 years of experience in software development, with a strong preference for proficiency in TypeScript and Python. Knowledge of Go is a bonus.
* Enjoy problem-solving and have a proactive mindset, able to work independently while seeking guidance when needed.
* Exhibits a growth-oriented mindset, a willingness to learn, and an open-minded approach to new technologies and challenges.
* Is open minded and humble, no one knows it all.
* Has a practical, hands-on approach to development, whether from a traditional computer science background or self-taught experience. Demonstrable skills and past projects matter more than formal credentials.
* Values collaboration and team engagement, preferring an in-office environment when possible. We trust our team to balance flexibility and responsibility—working remotely as needed is totally fine, but we believe in the power of in-person collaboration.


**Expectations**
**About**
 At Wingbits,
 **innovation, speed, and flexibility** 
 drive everything we do. This role isn’t just about executing tasks—it’s about
 **building, problem-solving, and adapting** 
 . Here’s what we expect from you:
   

  

* We love having our team together in the office—collaboration fuels creativity and momentum. That said, we treat everyone like adults. We understand that life happens, and flexibility is key. You’ll have the freedom to balance remote work when needed, as long as you take ownership and deliver results.
* We don’t measure success by hours clocked in but by the impact of your work. Some weeks may demand more than 40 hours to hit key milestones, while others may require less. What matters is delivering on our goals, adapting when needed, and being accountable to your teammates.
* Startups evolve quickly, and we embrace flexibility and adaptability while ensuring a supportive and structured work environment. This means that we all figure things out together as we go, and priorities and what you work on can change rapidly.
* We encourage taking initiative and having a sense of ownership, but we also value work-life balance and a sustainable pace.
* Your role won’t be limited to a single function. One day you might be deep in code, the next helping refine our product strategy, or even assisting with customer needs. Flexibility and a willingness to dive in wherever needed are key.
* We’re building something transformative in flight tracking technology. We want people who are passionate about making an impact while working in a balanced and sustainable way.
* We value positivity, problem-solving, and a solutions-oriented approach. Challenges will come, and we need people who see opportunities rather than obstacles.


**Why Wingbits?**
* Culture: We hire great people, treat everyone like adults giving you trust and freedom to execute in your role.
* Complex & Fun: Touching multiple technologies and areas from IoT, Hardware, Blockchain, Big data, global community management, aviation and more
* Growth: Be part of our journey from the ground up, with significant opportunities for personal and professional development.
* Team: Working with a very accomplished, supportive and skilled team who you can build, learn and grow with.
* Rewards: Receive a highly competitive salary, equity, and the chance to share in our success.
* Other Benefits: Supportive environment, kind & respectful teammates, health/fitness reimbursement, centrally located private office in the center of Vasastan/Norrmalm.

title: Firmware Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a
 **Firmware Engineer** 
 to develop high-performance, low-power firmware for AI-driven embedded systems. Based in Stockholm, a global leader in telecom and tech innovation, you’ll work on the cutting edge of AI, ML, and real-time embedded processing.
 



  





  





 Your Role:
 



  




* Develop and optimize low-level firmware for AI-enabled edge devices and real-time inference engines.
* Implement efficient DSP algorithms for embedded machine learning applications.
* Work with neural network accelerators (NPU) and optimized hardware for AI-driven tasks.
* Design and integrate AI models for ultra-low latency, real-time applications in robotics, automotive, and IoT.
* Ensure power-efficient, high-performance firmware for battery-operated devices.



  





  





 What We’re Looking For:
 



  




* Strong experience in embedded C/C++ with low-level hardware optimization.
* Familiarity with ARM Cortex-M/A, RISC-V, or dedicated AI accelerator architectures.
* Knowledge of embedded AI frameworks such as TensorFlow Lite, Edge Impulse, or TinyML.
* Understanding of real-time processing, DSP, and hardware/software co-design.
* Passion for AI, edge computing, and high-performance embedded systems.

title: Programmer/System Developer, 2358
description:
**You can look forward to**
 Are you a dedicated and driven individual with a passion for technology? Do you want to contribute to an international and dynamic environment while making a real impact? If so, this opportunity is for you!
   

  

 At Life & Health Sweden, we are seeking a Java Programmer/Systems Developer to join our team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the business to help enhance our client offerings in life reinsurance.
   

  

 For the past 15 years, Hannover Re has been a trusted partner to our Nordic and Israeli clients, providing system support for the automated risk assessment of life insurance products. Now, we are looking for a developer to continue delivering top-notch service and drive future innovation for our clients.
   

  

 As our new Programmer/System developer, you'll join a dedicated team focused on developing, customizing, and maintaining our automated risk assessment system. Your role will include writing new code, maintaining the codebase, and contributing to the implementation, testing and documentation process.
   

  

 You’ll work with our custom editor and IDEs, collaborating with customers to translate business needs into technical solutions. We follow agile methods and use modern tools to deliver high-quality results.
   

  

 This role involves close teamwork with colleagues in Stockholm, Germany, and global Hannover Re offices. You will also communicate with clients and business partners, with occasional travel to meet with them.
   

  

**You come equipped with**
* A university or college degree focused on system development, or equivalent education and work experience.
* Strong knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and proficiency in Java, JavaScript, and Unix/Linux.
* Experience with automated software testing, particularly in continuous integration, is a plus (e.g., Cucumber/Gherkin, ISTQB certification).
* Familiarity with Jira/Confluence and requirements engineering is beneficial but not required.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.


**Key Skills & Traits**
* Excellent communication skills: You can explain technical concepts clearly and simply to both colleagues and clients, actively listening to and understanding the needs of others.
* Team player: You collaborate effectively with others and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
* Structured approach: You tackle technical challenges with well-thought-out, organized solutions.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills: You approach issues with a logical mindset and can think critically to find the best solutions.
* Attention to detail while keeping an eye on the bigger picture: You ensure precision without losing sight of the overall goal.
* International mindset: You thrive in a diverse, global work environment.


 We are #somewhatdifferent – people with their own stories, experiences, and career paths. Everyone is welcome! Apply with just one click on the "Apply now“-button and become part of our diverse team! We'd love to hear about your skills and experiences

title: Erfaren frontendutvecklare
description:
Som erfaren frontendutvecklare hos Hallon får du en central roll i att utveckla och förverkliga vår vision i att skapa den bästa kundupplevelsen på hallon.se. Du kommer tillhöra ett agilt utvecklingsteam på cirka 10 personer med blandade kompetenser, varav fyra jobbar med frontendutveckling. Tillsammans med teamet är du med och bestämmer arkitektur och teknikval samt utvecklar automatiserade tester. Vi vill lära oss av varandra och dela kunskap, därför jobbar vi emellanåt med par- och mobbprogrammering.
   

  

 Vår frontend bygger på Next och Typescript. Andra tekniker som vi använder är Node.js, Cypress, JEST, CI/CD i Azure, Docker och React native.
   

  

**Du kommer se fram emot att**
* ingå i ett team som vill bygga framtiden och vara nära affären med tekniken i centrum
* jobba med erfarna och kunniga kollegor som brinner för sin profession
* vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work
* tillhöra en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till att kvinnor vill välja och stanna kvar inom teknikbranschen, vi är stolta partners till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar


 ,
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen löser du problem genom att tänka om och ta input av andra. Du är nyfiken och inser den unika möjligheten i att lära dig teknikens olika delar. Behöver du ha flerårig frontend erfarenhet? Nej, har du några års erfarenhet men ett stort engagemang och intresse för frontend och trygg i att du bidrar i linje med mer erfarna utvecklare och utvecklas snabbt, då kan du också vara rätt för den här rollen. Vi ser att du är trygg i React och Javascript/Typescript.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Välkommen till Hallon!

title: Erfaren Mjukvaruutvecklare
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Hos oss bidrar du till att säkra Sveriges territoriella gränser och skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.
   

  

 Din roll
   

  

 Vår avdelning levererar ledningssystem både till det svenska flygvapnet och till internationella kunder. I den här rollen kommer du främst att arbeta med det svenska ledningssystemet för luftbevakning och flygstridsledning – ett komplext system med många gränsytor och höga krav på tillförlitlighet och säkerhet som alltid är i bruk och alltid måste fungera.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett team på 15 personer, där alla arbetar med mjukvaruutveckling. Teamet jobbar nära kunden och har en flexibel, skräddarsydd leveransmodell där kundens prioriteringar styr. Vi genomför regelbundna leveranser och arbetar alltid med ett agilt scope.
   

  

 All utveckling sker i Linux, och vi programmerar huvudsakligen i Ada, men även Java, C och C++ förekommer. Arbetet innebär att utveckla nya funktioner, förbättra befintlig mjukvara och integrera den i systemet. Vi har en löpande dialog med kunden för att bedöma och planera uppgifter inför kommande releaser.
   

  

 Eftersom vi arbetar med försvarshemlig information sker merparten av arbetet på plats på kontoret, där du samarbetar med kollegorna i en säker miljö.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker en strukturerad och engagerad mjukvaruutvecklare med minst fem års erfarenhet och ett genuint intresse för att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar. Du har förmåga att utveckla högkvalitativa mjukvarulösningar med fokus på både kodkvalitet och användbarhet, och en stark önskan att bidra till Sveriges säkerhet. Vi värdesätter goda sociala egenskaper och förmågan att samarbeta väl med andra, men också att du kan arbeta självständigt och ta initiativ.
   

  

 Din bakgrund är troligtvis civil- eller högskoleingenjör inom datavetenskap, teknisk fysik eller närliggande område.
   

  

**Krav**
* Goda färdigheter i olika programmeringsspråk (t ex Ada, C/C++, Java)
* Goda kunskaper om datastrukturer och operativsystem
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i Linux
* Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska, både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla komplexa system / system för behandling och lagring av stora datamängder
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla säkerhetskritiska system
* Kunskaper i Ada
* Goda kunskaper i Linux (Bash, rpm-paket, nätverk)
* Intresse eller erfarenhet av flygdomänen


*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: 💫AI-experter 💫 till Sogeti Stockholm
description:
**Är du redo att forma framtiden genom att omvandla information till värde?**
 På Sogeti är vi övertygade om att information är den nya valutan och vi söker nu efter passionerade AI-profiler med djup teknisk kompetens och en vilja att ständigt lära sig nya saker.
   

  

 Sogeti strävar efter att hjälpa våra kunder genom både strategiska och operativa förbättringar. Vi tror på att utmana befintliga lösningar för att göra dem effektivare och att använda de senaste teknologierna för att skapa värde genom moderna tillämpningar som GenAI.
   

  

 Sogeti söker AI-experter som vill vara med och driva området i Stockholm i samarbete med kollegor i övriga landet och världen. Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, tekniskt skicklig och driven att förbättra och effektivisera verksamheter.
   

  

 Vi vill att du ska vara en lagspelare som är bra på att arbeta i team men även på att leverera på egen hand. Du är utåtriktad och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknologierna. Att hjälpa kunder att identifiera användningsfall och skapa största möjliga värde är något du brinner för.
   

  

* Tillämpa stora språkmodeller (LLM) på specifika affärsproblem för att extrahera, bearbeta, klassificera och härleda insikter från ostrukturerade datamängder.
* Utveckla domän- eller uppgiftsspecifika språkmodeller för affärsproblem när befintliga modeller inte kan användas
* Utvärdera prestandan för maskininlärningsmodeller och ge rekommendationer för förbättringar
* Hålla dig uppdaterad kring kärnteknologier inom NLP och generativ AI
* Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och ta gemensamt ägarskap och ansvar för planering, arbete, kvalitet och leverans.
* Agera mentor till juniora teammedlemmar för att bidra till en miljö där de får utvecklas genom stöd och support.


**Krav**
* Akademisk examen inom Data Science, Data, Machine Learning, Theoretical Linguistics eller motsvarande.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av stora språkmodeller (GPT, XLNet, T5, etc.).
* God erfarenhet av att använda moderna NLP-verktyg och bibliotek som spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers.
* Goda kunskaper i Python-utveckling inklusive bibliotek som NumPy, SciPy och erfarenhet av SQL.
* Duktig på att kommunicera och lära ut, förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för icke-tekniska intressenter.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med både on-prem och molnplattformar, MS Azure är meriterande.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av vektordatabaser som Pinecone, Milvus eller Weaviate är meriterande.


**Capgemini och Sogeti utsedda till ”Årets AI-Partner” i Sverige**
 ,
   

  

**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**
* Ditt Sogeti - Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!
* Dina förmåner - Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?


 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan idag.
   

  

 Hoppas vi ses!
